npc.1: I'm looking forward to working with you.
npc.3: Thank you for your hard work.
npc.301: Keep up the good work, Admiral!
npc.303: So, which piece of equipment do you want to improve?
npc.304: Right now, you can improve these pieces of equipment.
npc.308: Looks good! The improvement was successful!
npc.309: I'm sorry... I couldn't improve it...
npc.310: It's possible to upgrade this equipment into something better!
npc.312: Welcome. How may I help you?
npc.313: So it's gonna be this one?
npc.314: Are you sure you want this?
npc.317: Thanks for your continued support, Admiral!
npc.318: Please try out Large Ship Construction when you have enough resources and materials to spare!
npc.402: As expected of you, Admiral. The operation was a success!
npc.406: What would you like to do?
npc.407: Admiral, please carry out these operations.
npc.408: Admiral, the time has come to move on to a new operation.

titlecall_b.07: Listen well! Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.08: Let's go! Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.09: Listen well! Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.10: Listen well! Carve victory into the dawn horizons!

titlecall_c.01: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.02: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.03: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.04: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.05: We will be under your care~

titlecall_c.07: The admiral has arrived at the naval district. From here on out, he will be in charge of the fleet.

80.1: I am the battleship Nagato. I'll be counting on you. Leave the enemy battleships to me.
80.25: The first battleship born under the Eight-Eight Fleet Program and nameship of the Nagato-class battleships, Nagato here. Until the Yamato-class was commissioned, I served as the flagship of the Combined Fleet. I was known around the world as one of the "Big Seven".
80.3: Is there something on my face?
80.4: I'd prefer it if you wouldn't touch my rigging so much.
80.28: It's alright... I'm right here beside you.
80.24: What is this...? What is this vision, deep inside my memories? Ships, both friend and foe, and then that massive light... I must be exhausted... right, Admiral?
80.9: My thanks. Now I can fight on their level.
80.10: Modernization, huh? I don't really need it, though...
80.27: My thanks. Now I can fight on their level.
80.11: A little bit of maintenance is essential.
80.12: I'd prefer to enter the decisive battle in perfect condition.
80.6: The repaired ship, can now return to the line of battle.
80.5: It seems a new comrade has been launched. Looking forward to meeting her.
80.7: Mission complete. The fleet has returned.
80.15: Don't underestimate the power of the Big Seven.
80.16: The long-awaited decisive battle, huh. I'm getting all excited.
80.18: Alright! Fleet, I, Nagato, shall lead the way!
80.17: All main batteries, full salvo! Fiiiiire!
80.23: Compared to the glory of serving as the Combined Fleet's flagship, this is insignificant, but I'll accept... it.
80.20: The Nagato-class' armor isn't just for show.
80.21: Ngh... The enemy fleet is pretty good...
80.22: To sink in the midst of battle... and not in that light... how satisfying...
80.Anniversary 6547: It has been three years for us. How thrilling... Right. Today, let's open our naval shop magnificently! I see, It's the third year... Time sure flies...
80.Rainy 6547: Mutsu. ...What's this? An umbrella? ....Ah, much appreciated. Rain in the rainy season, huh...? Well, a calm day like this once in a while isn't bad sometimes....
80.Summer 6547: Alright! Summer is here! Fleet, assemble at the beach with your swimsuits! We're going to practice 'beach volleyball'! I, Nagato, have already set the teams!

50.1: I'm destroyer Shimakaze. When it comes to speed, I'm the best there is— swift like the island breeze!
50.25: Fast and armed with heavy torpedoes, developed as the pinnacle of destroyers— the Shimakaze class. I can go even faster than 40 knots. But... I wasn't suitable for mass production, so I was the only one built.
50.4: Want to race? I won't lose.
50.28: Eh? Admiral, you're tired from running? How slo~w...! But still, do your best!
50.24: Admiral, did you watch me run? Well? I was fast, right? Right? Hmhmhm!
50.8: Seems like there are messages addressed to you.
50.9: Can I keep getting faster and faster?
50.10: Don't blame me if I get even faster!
50.27: Can I keep getting faster and faster?
50.11: I want my turbines serviced, too!
50.12: Rensouhou-chan needs to be fixed, too.
50.6: Looks like a ship is completely repaired.
50.5: It looks like another ship slower than me was built.
50.7: The fleet finally came back. Slow, huh?
50.15: There's no one who can keep up with me, you know!
50.18: I'm telling you! There's no escape from me!
50.23: I'm the best? Really? I knew it! After all, I'm fast!
50.21: Haa... for me to get hit...
50.22: I guess being fast... was useless...
50.Anniversary 6547: It's still only the third anniversary? How slow! Congrats anyway. Admiral, let's race as a celebration. I won't lose!
50.Rainy 6547: It rains a lot at this time of year. I feel bad for Rensouhou-chan. Summer, come quickly! Hurry, hurry~!
50.Summer 6547: Summer...! Let's go swimming with Rensouhou-chan. I won't lose even if we race at swimming! After all, I'm fast!

107.1: Seaplane tender Chiyoda. My older sister Chitose isn't bothering you, is she?
107.25: Laid down as a Seaplane Tender, second of the Chitose class, Chiyoda. I was able to make use of midget subs, you know. I'll do my best alongside Chitose-onee!
107.2: Eh? Did Chitose-onee do something again?
107.3: Chitose-onee... watch out... ah... A dream?
107.4: Chitose-onee.. that tickleeeesss... oh, Admiral, What are you doing?
107.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
107.28: Admiral, had you not seen Chitose-onee around here? Ah, is that so, hmm... well, then, umm... you look a little worn-out so I'll lend you my lap! I'll let you rest a little!
107.24: Admiral, do you need something? Ah- You wanted to know if I'd seen Chitose-onee? I see...
107.8: Communique for Chitose-onee... no, for the admiral.
107.9: I'm getting a bit closer to Chitose-onee, aren't I?
107.10: Heheh I can win with this... Maybe even beat Chitose-onee!
107.11: I'm not really fond of docking, actually...
107.12: Urgh... I'm going for heavy repairs...? Don't tell Chitose-onee! I beg you!
107.6: I heard the the damaged ship has been repaired.
107.5: A new ship has been finished~ Oh, here she comes~
107.7: The fleet has returned. Is everybody safe?
107.15: This is Chiyoda's seaplane. I've spotted the enemy!
107.23: Chiyoda's the best? Oh my, am I as good as Sis?
107.20: I'm not going the same way as Chitose-onee!
107.21: No... At this rate, my seaplanes...
107.30: I'm Chiyoda. I'll be acting as your timekeeper today. Ah, it's midnight.
107.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, your're going to keep going at this time? You should sleep soon.... I want to go to Chitose-onee's....
107.32: 2 A.M. Not sleeping? I wanna hurry up and go to Chitose-onee's room so go to sleep~
107.33: 3 A.M. To call on the admiral hourly... seriously, what kind of mission is this?
107.34: 4 A.M.... I-I can't sleep now! I'm in the middle of a mission!
107.35: 5 A.M. Admiral, It's morning. This mission, will Chitose-onee have to do it... if I don't?
107.36: 6 A.M. About time for the town to wake up.
107.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it's morning! Are you refreshed?
107.38: 8 A.M. You look busy. Job? Study? Manuscript? Anything's fine. Going off to sortie!
107.39: 9 A.M. I wonder what's Chitose-onee's doing around this time...
107.40: 10 A.M. Admiral, what do you think of Chitose-nee? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
107.41: 11 A.M. Sooooo, you like Onee, huh? E-eh!? N-No, you can't!
107.42: Midday.... hey, Admiral, until you take back what you said, today's lunch is on hold!
107.43: It's 1 P.M. Admiral, take it back! I'm getting hungry too~ hey~
107.44: 2 P.M. The admiral's so stubborn~ You'll be my rival in love from today! Eh, it can't be helped. Here, onigiri.
107.45: It's 3 P.M. So, where are we attacking this afternoon? East? South?
107.46: 4 P.M. Not here... Chitose-nee's not here!
107.47: 5 P.M. Admiral~ What do you like about Sis? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
107.48: 6 P.M. So, what's your answer!　hmm... I see... hmmm... e-eh! N-No way!
107.49: 7 P.M. It's dinner time but.... Admiral... you go on ahead... I'm a little shocked... I lost my appetite...
107.50: It's 8 P.M. My eyes aren't red...because I've been crying!
107.51: It's 9 P.M. Admiral... giving me supper... I'm a little glad, maybe...
107.52: It's 10 P.M. As I thought, Chitose-Onee sleeping on the admiral's lap, I can't forgive this!
107.53: 11 P.M! I'll refresh the memories of Onee! So, gimme that lap! Good night!

73.1: We meet again, Admiral. It's Mogami. How's my flight deck? Does it suit me?
73.25: First of the Mogami-class heavy cruisers. By taking off my stern cannons and replacing them with an aviation deck, the Aviation Cruiser was developed! Equal fire and air power, howzat!
73.2: Admiral, have you got something for me to do?
73.3: You interested in my flight deck?
73.4: Yeaaah, well, I am different from the regular carriers. If you use me well, I think it'll be interesting, you know?
73.29: Admiral! Oh, you're busy? I'm going out for some workout.
73.28: I'm always crashing because I've only got eyes for you, Admiral! Just kidding!
73.24: Admiral, wassup? What's with that look? Is there something up with my flight deck?
73.8: Looks like there's a notice for the admiral
73.9: Ooh, you're gonna make me even stronger?
73.10: So you use it like this... huh~
73.11: Going in for repairs. Why do I keep running into friends...? This sucks...
73.12: Aaah... my long-awaited flight deck came to nothing, damnit...
73.6: An ally has return from the dock.
73.7: The operation is over, the fleet has come back
73.17: Gathering the rains of summer, how swift it is... Basho, right?
73.23: This is my true power, dude. 'cause I'm something like the pioneer of the helicopter destroyers, you know?
73.21: Damnit! A direct hit... that's no joke...
73.22: Ugh...I wonder if I can apologize to Mikuma in the other world...
73.32: 0200. Say, I didn't know I have to do night shifts.
73.33: 0300. *yawn* Eh? You're still working in this late time? Thank you for your work!
73.34: 0400. *big yawn* Man, Admiral sure works hard.
73.35: 0500. Huh? Ah, I was dreaming a bit just now.
73.36: 0600. What was my dream about? That's a secret!
73.37: 0700. Is it OK if I sleep now?
73.38: 0800. Oh, come on. Your office has a futon, right?
73.39: 0900. Ehh? You've packed the futon? Well, the kotatsu is fine too.
73.40: 1000. Your eyes are wide open when you're bustling.
73.42: 1200. Admiral, let's fill up at lunch, okay?
73.43: 1300. I'm stuffed! Dessert goes in a different stomach, though.
73.44: 1400. Mmm, Mamiya's ice cream is delicious! Admiral, you got cream on your face... Yep, there you go!
73.45: 1500. If the meal comes with dessert, I guess I can do the night shift.
73.46: 1600. I managed to eat a lot, but I'm sleepy now.
73.47: 1700. I'm so tired, I feel like I can sleep while walking...Oh, sorry!
73.48: 1800. This... This is the admirals office!? Why!?
73.49: 1900. The admiral carried me here!? I'm really sorry!
73.50: 2000. Wah! I'm supposed to make curry for dinner tonight!... Hm... this smell....
73.51: 2100. Admiral, As a backup, Kumarinko brought some curry she made. Well, let's dig in!
73.52: 2200. Eating curry together with the admiral makes it delicious. I could eat it every day!
73.53: 2300. So, Admiral, we're finished with everything, right?

82.1: I'm the aviation battleship 'Ise'! With a rear-facing flight deck and 2 catapults, I can make use of the power of aviation!
82.25: To obtain the power of marine aviation, a main cannon was removed, and in it's place a flight deck was installed, granting the aviation power of a light aircraft carrier. Aviation battleship, Ise. My name was taken up by the newly-developed DDH of the Marine Self Defence Force.
82.2: Ah, sorry. Did you call me?
82.3: Well, seaplanes are just the standard, you know.
82.4: The firepower of a battleship with the flight power of a light aircraft carrier... yeah, it's pretty awesome, isn't it?
82.24: Admiral, erm... could you please not take my catapult away... If I don't have that, I'll... Ah! You meanie!
82.8: Letter for the admiral.. you are probably busy, yeah?
82.9: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?
82.10: Aren't they just perfect, these things!
82.27: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?
82.11: It's just a scratch. But thanks anyway.
82.12: As expected, it looks like I need some repairs.
82.6: Admiral, seem like repairs are finished.
82.5: Admiral, looks like a new ship type has been launched.
82.7: The armada has returned. Good work!
82.14: You're late, Hyuuga. I'm leaving you behind!
82.16: Zuiuns and the like, how are they? Are they cool?
82.17: Main cannon, 4 rounds 8 shots, broadside fire!
82.23: Eh, I've still got the number one result? How about that Hyuuga, you're being a bit quiet.
82.19: Compared to the Ozawa Decoy Fleet, this is nothing!
82.20: Hit me with your best shot!
82.22: Well, I guess I did what I could...Hyuuga, take your time to come...

108.1: I'm the girl who took a diet and became an aircraft carrier, Chitose. I even got faster. Maybe I should write a book about it.
108.25: Renovated from a seaplane carrier to a carrier, I'm Chitose. Slimming down my body by dieting. My legs even became faster. This will let me play a part in the Task Force! I'll do my best for you!
108.3: Isn't it great, this flightdeck? It's my favorite.
108.4: Admiral, I don't recall saying it was okay to touch.
108.29: You're busy aren't you? That's fine, that's fine. How about we take it easy?
108.28: The admiral is always doing his utmost best. It's okay. I understand.
108.24: Thank you for always looking out for the reborn Chitose, Admiral.
108.9: I wonder if Chiyoda has gotten stronger.
108.10: No way, I might actually be cool.
108.12: Man, that's gonna leave a mark... Chiyoda will worry, so let's keep it a secret, yeah?
108.5: A new ship has been completed.
108.7: The fleet has returned to the home port.
108.17: I hope this isn't like the Philippine Sea...
108.23: Chiyoda's gonna yell "Don't get too cocky" at me, so let's keep quiet about this.
108.20: I won't let you hit my flight deck!
108.21: Ah man, my precious flight deck...
108.22: Chiyoda... I leave the rest... to you...

109.1: The girl that became an aircraft carrier, Chiyoda. Of course, I'll be assigned to Chitose-onee's fleet, yes?
109.25: Heavily remodeled from a seaplane tender, I'm the job-changed aircraft carrier Chiyoda. I'm quite the carrier, no? I'll fight the enemy air force together with Chitose-onee!
109.4: Chitose-onee, do that when we're alone in the room... Oh. It's you, Admiral?
109.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
109.28: Even though I'm worried for just Chitose-onee, the admiral upon that... really, good grief.
109.24: Admiral.... I'm happy that you have feeling for me, but still, I'm worried about Chitose-onee...
109.9: Thank you! With this, I can match the regular carriers, no?
109.10: Leyte will be okay this time!
109.11: Carrier maintenance is vital, you know.
109.12: Ow-w-w~ Keep this a secret... from Chitose-nee~
109.5: A new ship has been added to our fleet.
109.7: Operation's complete, the fleet has returned.
109.14: Aircraft carrier Chiyoda, launching! Attack wings are all ready, sortieing!
109.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Strike wing, commencing assault!
109.16: Right, bomber wing, attack wing, It's your turn!
109.18: It's about time for the coup-de-grace!
109.17: I really want to fly with Chitose-nee's fleet...
109.23: Yay! I can really do it with as an aircraft carrier, can't I? Chitose-nee, did you see me?
109.20: The flight deck's on fire!? Put it out!
109.21: Oooh... Well, I'm a light carrier... I can't be too reckless.

110.1: I'm Shoukaku, the first of the Shoukaku-class carriers. I will try my best with Zuikaku to try and live up to the names of my seniors in the first and second aviation divisions.
110.25: I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines.
110.3: Zuikaku, don't bother the admiral so much, okay?
110.4: Geez, Zuikaku, stop fiddling with my skirt so mu- huh, oh my, Admiral?
110.29: Admiral? Um... We should head to Port Moresby... Um, uh...
110.28: Admiral, I'm always really grateful for you hard work. Please take a short break, okay?
110.24: Thank you, Admiral. Giving me these planes that I've never seen before, my gratitude is overflowing. Maybe… just maybe… if my wish comes true, after the Marianas, we can stay together…
110.8: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
110.9: Thank you! I can use these!
110.10: I'm so happy! Many thanks, Admiral.
110.11: I'll take a short bath... be out in a bit.
110.12: I seem to get injured rather easily... right, Zuikaku?
110.6: Admiral, ship in the dock was fully repaired.
110.5: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
110.7: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
110.14: You ready, Zuikaku? Let's go. Mobile squad, deploying!
110.16: Here I go. All planes, attack!
110.18: Now... what's going to appear? Make sure you watch out for submarines.
110.17: Support team, cover the assault squad!
110.23: I did it, Admiral! It's all thanks to the planes and supporting ships! Thank you all!
110.19: O-ouch... I can still do this!
110.20: Geez, why is it always me?
110.21: I've been hit! It's difficult to launch and land ship-borne planes!
110.22: Looks like... I'm gone again... Yahagi, Akizuki... please take care of things now.
110.30: Admiral? Seems like the date has changed.
110.35: It's now 0500. The sun's about to come up, huh.
110.36: 0600. It's about wake-up time for everyone.
110.37: 0700. What would you like for breakfast?
110.38: 0800. I'll do my best today too.
110.39: It's now 0900. Should I send out scout planes?
110.40: It's 1000. I wonder if Zuikaku is okay?
110.41: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
110.42: Admiral, it's 1200. Shall we have lunch?
110.44: It's 1400. Admiral, are you feeling tired?
110.45: It's 1500. The campaign is about to begin.
110.46: 1600. I'll be sending up the CAP.
110.47: It's 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful, Admiral?
110.50: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
110.53: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?
110.Rainy 6547: It's the rainy season. This reminds me of the days of Operation MO. There was a squall then, too.... right, Zuikaku?
110.Summer 6547: Zuikaku, did you buy a new swimsuit? My, it's nice. It's very cute. Eh? Me? I'm fine with last year's. Wha... really? Do you think so?
110.6547: Fall. That's right, Zuikaku. Fall makes me... start to feel a bit lonely. No... I'm fine right now.

111.1: Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, the younger sister, Zuikaku. The lucky carrier, you say? That's not it— I just fight with all my might... you see? As long as I still have planes, I won't lose!
111.25: Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, Zuikaku. Following the battle of Midway, I occupied a core position in the First Mobile Fleet along with Shoukaku-nee. I fought until the very last arrow was fired... which was literally the day the Mobile Fleet was completely annihilated...
111.2: Admiral... what is it? An operation?
111.3: Shoukaku-nee, what is it? A-Admiral, it was you?! What do you want? Are you trying to get bombed?
111.4: All bomber aircraft, prepare for immediate takeoff! Objective: the admiral in his home port office! Get him!
111.29: Admiral...! You know, I'm getting really bored here... I'm gonna throw a fit...
111.28: Admiral... you shouldn't overdo it, you know...?
111.24: Admiral... what's up...? You're looking at me so seriously. Is there something on my face? Eh? Ah! Too close! You're too close! Your face... ah.. ah~h~h...! Ah...
111.8: Admiral... so...? How'd you do, how'd you do?
111.10: Oh, wow... this is pretty good... ♪Thaaank you!
111.27: Fuel... ammunition... the planes are fully resupplied.
111.11: I'm going into the bath for a bit.
111.12: Well... even I get hurt sometimes.
111.6: Admiral, The bath seems to be empty. I want to jump in!
111.5: Admiral, it looks like a new ship is ready.
111.7: The fleet has safely returned. Haaa~h...! Thank goodness...
111.16: We'll decide this... from outside their range!
111.18: Turkey, you say...? This isn't funny!
111.17: Second strike squadron, all airworthy planes, commence takeoff!
111.23: Yes!!! Did you see? This is the true power of the CarDiv 5! The Goddess of Fortune is on my side!
111.21: Damn! These hits are coming out of nowhere! Suppress any explosions! Is the flight deck okay?
111.22: Nh... am I done for...? All hands, to the flight deck... Shoukaku-nee, are you there waiting for me...?
111.30: Admiral, the date just changed, you know?
111.36: It is now 0600. Rather than getting up early, it's better to stay up late...
111.37: 0700. What's for breakfast? I'm looking forward to it~
111.38: It is now 0800. Let's outrange them today as well!
111.39: The time is now 0900. For now, shouldn't we get ready to find the enemy?
111.40: It's 1000. I wonder if Shoukaku-nee is doing fine?
111.41: 1100. What for lunch? Hey, what's for lunch?
111.42: Admiral! Twelv... It's noon, noon! I wanna have luuunch!
111.43: Thirte... ah, so troublesooome. It's 1 o'clock, 1 o'clock.
111.44: Yeah, yeah, I know. "It is now 1400". Is that okay?
111.47: The sunset is gradually coming, yeah? 1700.
111.49: Ninetee.... man, it's still troublesome. 7 o'clock. Dinner time, yeah?
111.50: 2000, Eight o'clock! I don't really care, but...Kawau— Sendai, shut up!
111.52: It is now 2200. Completely night time. Admiral, is it okay to take a break now?
111.53: It's late night now. 2300. Yeah, let's go to sleeeep.
111.Rainy 6547: I don't like this season for some reason.... I just can't warm up to it. I wonder if Shoukaku is alright? I'm kinda worried....
111.Summer 6547: Shoukaku-nee, look, look! It's my brand new swimsuit for the year! I went and bought it! I mean, it's almost summer! You should come with me and buy one, too!
111.6547: Fall, huh...? That's true, fall is the season of endings. However, it's also the season of beginnings. It definitely is. That's what I believe. Heh... that's so unlike me!

113.1: Yeah yeah yeah! Finally, Kinu has arrived!
113.25: Born in Kobe, I'm Kinu! I trained well at the Maizuru School. After lots of dangerous things happened, I did my best in the Southwest... Well, that was bad too. Kuma-chan was suprisingly helpful too. But... Panay Island was seriously panai!
113.2: I will work hard again today, too.
113.3: When I look at the admirals face, I get all motivated~
113.4: Hm, what's up? Why don't we sweat it out together?
113.29: Admiral~ Aren't we going to train or anything?
113.28: Admiral~! Shall I give you a shoulder massage? Or perhaps, some training?
113.24: Admiral! We're always just training together, maybe that's a signal that we should spend some more time together… maybe… haa.. Eh?! No, I didn't mean it in that way, I mean that I since I'm nearest to you, I should protect you… I want to… yeah… ah, whatever!
113.8: What, the report? Lemme see, lemme see!
113.10: Anti-aircraft weaponry is very important, you know?
113.26: All you can do is practice!
113.27: This way I can do my best again.
113.11: After a battle, isn't a bath just great?
113.12: Ah, I've had it... I'm going to rest for a bit~!
113.6: Looks like the repair is complete.
113.7: Oooi, Admiral~! The fleet has returned~
113.14: Alright, I'll show you the results of my training.
113.15: Adapt to changes while maintaining formation. Let's go!
113.17: Enemies on the port, take this!
113.23: This victory is the result of the practice battles, yes. I will continue to work hard, Admiral!
113.21: Kinu won't sink with just this.
113.22: Admiral, sorry, looks like this is it for me... please withdraw the other girls...
113.31: 1 o'clock!. I'm going to sleep soon, 'kay? G'night~
113.32: It's 2 o'clock. It's the middle of the night, how scary~!
113.33: It's 3 o'clock... I really want to go to sleep....
113.35: It's 5 o'clo~ck! Gonna get up? Gonna sleep?
113.36: It's 6 o'clock. Let's do our best today as well!
113.37: It's 7 o'clo~ck! What'cha doing for breakfast?

124.1471: Ah, that sandwich? Yup, it turned out great, if I do say so myself. Ehehe♪ I put it together along with Kumano. Should I make more?

125.28: Admiral. W-well... You appear to be doing quite well? I just might praise you, you know.

126.1: I'm I-168. What? It's hard to say? OK, just call me Imuya. Nice to meet you!
126.25: I am a submarine born and raised in Kure. After that battle of Midway, I managed to land the final blow to Yorktown who defeated Hiryuu! Our carriers were avenged! I also worked hard running transport missions to that terrible island.
126.2: Commander, are you used to my name? It's I-Mu-Ya, you know?
126.3: I may be riding on a float right now, but I'm actually an amazing diver!
126.4: Ah, were you looking at me from behind? It's not like I'm playing with a smart phone or anything!
126.29: Commander, did you come to hate Imuya?
126.28: Commander, let's take a break if you are tired.
126.24: Commander, I can dive to about 100m. Won't you come dive with me this time? I, will guide you with all my strength. When this fight is over... it's a promise, okay?
126.8: There seems to be a report addressed to the commander.
126.13: It's time to deploy, I'll show you the power of a Kaidai-class submarine!
126.9: If it's the commander's desire, then this is alright too...?
126.10: No way, I keep getting stronger!
126.12: This wound is nothing serious! ...D...don't make it too sore...
126.5: A new ship has been created! I wonder what kind of ship it is?
126.7: Operation complete! The fleet has returned.
126.14: I'm gonna put some big holes in the enemies' hulls!
126.16: Load torpedoes from 1 to 4. Let's go get a win!
126.18: The night is our world! I'll finish you!
126.17: I'll approach stealthily, sinking you for certain.
126.23: I did it! You can rely on Imuya, the sniper of the sea! I'll even finish off aircraft carriers!
126.22: Ahh, I wanted to bathe in the sun more... I've had enough of... the seabed...

126.33: 0300. Is it okay? You really don't have anything planned for tommorrow?
126.35: 0500. Eh, did you want to hear Imuya's voice?
126.36: 0600. Commander, it's morning before you knew it!
126.38: 0800. I'm pretty strong in the morning, you know!
126.39: 0900. Let's get to work let's get to work!
126.40: 1000. Let's go with all our strength until lunch!
126.41: 1100. If we work hard I'm sure there will be delicious lunch waiting for us!
126.43: 1300. Lunch with the commander, I'm really happy!
126.44: 1400. Well then, let's give it our best and sortie even in the afternoon!
126.45: 1500. The 3 o'clock you... the disaster of yours... it's somehow scary!
126.49: 1900. I can only make curry, is that okay? Alrighty, let's make it together! We can eat together in an hour!
126.50: 2000. Did you make the curry properly? Well then, let's eat together!
126.51: 2100. Somehow after eating dinner and getting full, I get sleepy...
126.53: 2300. Commander, thanks for another day's hard work!
126.Anniversary 6547: Commander! It's the third anniversary, the third anniversary! So cool! Imuya is a bit surprised too. Please take care of me from now on, too!
126.Rainy 6547: It's been raining a lot recently, hasn't it? It's the rainy season, so it can't be helped. Ah, Iku! So you're making a teru teru bozu! Show me, show me! ...That's very unique.
126.6547: Goya... even though fall is a time for eating, if you eat that much, the beautiful and functional swimsuit designated by the admiral won't fit anymore, you know? Is that fine?

127.4: If it's armour, it has to be a school swimsuit! Look, it's efficiently smooth!
127.28: Do your best with your KanColle study!
127.24: Being with the admiral is so much fun! You know, there are lots of fish that only live in the south, they're worth seeing, yeah? This time, I'll take you there!
127.8: Communication for the admiral? Lemme see!
127.10: Admiral, I don't really need this...
127.5: A new ship has been finished! Anyhow, it's an above-water ship, isn't it?
127.15: Wa~ I found a lot of scary things!
127.17: Goya's torpedos - they're clever little things!
127.23: Goya, she did her best, yes? Eh? Chanpuru? I'm not a side dish, you know~
127.21: My swimsuit, a functional beauty & designated by the admiral, is...
127.22: Someday, Goya wants to dream of the day I met you all... diving deep....
127.32: 0200. Oh... There is something behind... Ah well, forget it.
127.37: 0700. If nothing else, eat some breakfast.
127.38: 0800. What kind of day will today be, I wonder?
127.39: 0900. 9 o'clock. Where are you taking 58 today?
127.40: A~dmiral. 1000. I'd like a new swimsuit soon~
127.41: 1100. A~dmiral~, I wanna try on this fluttery swimsuit too~
127.42: 1200~. After lunch, let's look at more swimsuits!
127.43: 1300. Ah, Admiral, why don't we take a nap?

128.4: Ah! ...You've surprised me, touching me all of a sudden and making these loud noises.

128.8: A report for the admiral. Let's see...
128.10: That's right. I think upgrading is essential...
128.11: May I entrust you with the servicing?

128.5: It seems a new ship has been constructed.

128.21: I have to surface, and re-position myself...
128.22: I always knew I'd sink, some day... Admiral... everybody... I'm glad that I met you all...

128.33: 0300. If you keep going now, you wont last through tomorrow. Admiral?
128.34: 0400... Aa, sorry, I nodded off there...
128.35: 0500. Do you like German bread? I was just thinking about it, so I'll go make some.
128.36: 0600. I'll have some German bread ready for after breakfast.
128.38: Eight!... no wait, 0800. The roggenmischbrot, freshly baked!

128.40: 1000. It's time to refocus on my reading!
128.41: 1100. Once, I gave Hibiki some freshly baked bread, and she was so happy! What a good kid...!
128.43: 1300. Let's keep on reading, shall I?
128.44: It feels refreshing to not be submerged.
128.45: 1500. I'm a bit distracted, so I can't focus on reading....
128.46: 1600. Admiral, what do you usually do around this time?
128.47: 1700. What should I make for dinner..?
128.48: 1800. I really like the atmosphere the sun setting over the sea creates.
128.49: 1900. I want to try something other than swimsuits... like the uniform everyone is wearing... maybe?
128.50: 8-8! Wait, 2000. Admiral, here and some ham, cheese and potato. Eat up!
128.51: 2100. Admiral, are you feeling better now?
128.52: 2200. Admiral is playing Kancolle! I am reading! Eheh~
128.53: It's 2300. It's getting late, isn't it. I'm a bit tired...

128.Rainy 6547: It feels so humid. After all, it's the rainy season. Hacchan is still fine even in rainy season, you know?
128.EarlySummer 6547: Eh? A swimsuit? Hacchan is fine staying with this swimsuit, but if you insist on a change... Glasses. Wouldn't you like to see me with new glasses?
128.Summer 6547: It's summer. Acht-acht! It's already August and we haven't gone swimming together. Ah, Hacchan goes swimming every day, of course. Would you like to go swimming, too?
128.6547: It's autumn. Autumn is for reading. The amount of reading I get done goes waaaay up in autumn. I'd like a new book. Admiral, would you buy me one?

201.1: Fubuki here! Thanks for having me today!
201.4: Whaat is iiit, Mutsuki-chan? Eh, er... C-Commander?!
201.29: Main gun... check. Torpedo tubes... check. Engine... no problems! *whew* Next was... Ah! That's right, let's scan the horizon, too. Let's see...

201.13: I'll definitely be the one to finish them off! Setting sail!

201.47: It's 1700! Commander, the sunset is pretty, isn't it? It'll be time for dinner soon, and a meal hasn't been prepared yet. Oh, you'll treat me to dinner tonight?

201.49: It's 1900! Commander, this consommé soup is hot and delicious! This salad, too... it's very extravagant and Western, isn't it?
201.50: It's 2000! I'm full, Commander! Ah, now then, I have to work hard to return the favor. Sir! I will continue to do my best!

201.53: It's 2300. Commander, what are your dreams for the future? Mhm, mhm... is that so? That's great♪ They're the same as mine. Aye!

132.1: Akigumo, reporting for duty~ Look after me Admiral~

I mean, I always thought I was a Yuugumo-class... (even our uniforms are the same)... *grumble, mutter*... ah, whatever. After that, I was assigned to guard the 5th CarDiv. I didn't get to finish drawing Shoukaku and Zuikaku, though...
132.3: What what? Sexual harrasment? Is that okay?
132.4: Hmmh~mm. If you want to play with me that much, then why don't I sketch you? If you look at it this way, you can see the artistic sensibilities! Hmmh~mm♪
132.29: Waaaa! That's it! It's almost the submission deadline, isn't it! I can't just sit around!
132.28: Admiral, are you beat? Well then, Akigumo will draw a picture of you♪
132.24: At last the admiral has been caught by my charm~? Ju~st kidding! But I wonder what kind of picture the future of me and the admiral would be… Should I seriously try drawing a thin book? Wouldn't it be great?
132.8: A report has arrived for the admiral. Hmm, gonna read it?
132.10: Mmm, yeah, equipment is important, you know.
132.11: Even Akigumo needs some repairs, yeah? I'll draw an illustration in the bath~
132.12: Going for a long bath~. Geez, those guys~ After I'm fixed, I'll return it twice over!
132.5: A new shipdaughter~ Admiral likes them too, yeah?
132.7: The fleet has come back. Good work!
132.14: You wanna order one of my illustrations?
132.15: All of you who are waiting, welcome!
132.16: Battleship class... I wanna beat them up~
132.18: The night's so dark that I can't draw very well, you know~ Let's fire up the searchlights!
132.17: Makigumo, look, look! Attacking is like th~is, yeah?
132.23: Lo~ok, I can do things that even battleships and heavy cruisers can't, you know. Oh, do you have a sketchbook?
132.19: Woah! A hit like this won't penetrate me!
132.21: I won't able to draw like this~!
132.22: Hey, my resting place... will anybody sketch it out...
132.30: It's 0 o'clock. Are you okay? You ain't spacing out?
132.31: 1 at night, looks like you're still going, yeah?
132.32: It's 2 o'clock, I'm a night owl too, so it's fine~ I'll stay with you while I write out a manuscript!
132.33: It's 3 o'clock, but... are you alright? Will you be okay at your job tomorrow?
132.34: It's 4 A.M. At resting times you rest! At drawing times you draw! That's what the great circles do, yeah?
132.35: 5 A.M... And that's why I sleep from morning to mid~day...Zzz
132.36: It's finally 6 in the Morning, huh.... Admiral~ I'm gonna borrow a futon~ G'night~
132.37: 7o'clock... As I feared, it's bright so I can't sleep... What ever will I do...
132.38: 8 o'clock. I'll be able to do a manuscript 'cause I ate breakfast... Admiral, bread or rice in the morning, what kinda guy are you?
132.39: 9 o'clock, huh... a~nyway, flipping around the front cover and submit first and then off for training!
132.40: It's now 10 o'clock~ Are you making progress on your work, Admiral?
132.41: 11. With that said, Admiral, what kind of girl do you like the most?
132.42: Lunch~! When this time comes around, it's UkiUkiWatching time!... Ah, d-don't mind me...
132.43: 1 P.M... 'Lunch time' somehow sounds fun, yeah?... What'cha eating?
132.44: 2 P.M... Well, let's do the afternoon sortie!
132.45: 3 P.M! Admiral Ranks, check 'em! It'd be great if it's gone up, yes?
132.46: 4 P.M. Almost time for the sun to go down... If it gets dark, you can't really draw, you know?
132.47: 5 P.M. Hah-... Even though I'm, always fighting, I somehow really want to draw a carrier sinking... Why?
132.48: 6 P.M... I'm hungry~ I wanna eat canned beef, yeah, canned beef... Admiral, open up a can, will ya?
132.49: 7 P.M. Yeah, canned beef with silver chalis is great!
132.50: 8 P.M... For this evening's performance, of course the searchlight will be lit!
132.51: 9 P.M. Makigumo's 'Sleep, Sleep!' is so annoying~. Why does she do it?
132.52: 10 P.M. I'm tired, so I just be borrowing a futon~ Getting in with me is for.bid.den!
132.53: 11 P.M. Just a moment's sleep! Zzzz~... This is just practice, one more time.... Admiral, you too.. go sleep!
132.Rainy 6547: The rainy season is so boring... eh? What? So everyone is making teru teru bozu? Then I'll make some from scratch. Now, for the paint...
132.EarlySummer 6547: Hoho, it's almost summer. What's everyone up to? Getting their swimsuits ready? I have to prepare! Time to stock up on drawing materials at the base exchange, hehe!
132.Summer 6547: Ah, that pose is good. That angle... don't move... Oh, right there works♪ Just a minute, I'll take a reference picture... uhhyoyo~♪ It's here— summer!
132.6547: Fall has come around, huuuh? Oh well. The time between summer and winter is short, so you'd better be ready! But I guess fall is an easy time to let your guard doooown♪ I'll have a potato.

220.1: Fourth ship of the Nagara-class Light Cruisers, 'Yura'. Pleased to make your acquaintance!
220.25: I'm Yura, the fourth ship of the Nagara-type Light Cruisers. I was the first out of all of us to be equipped with seaplanes. I've served as the flagship of torpedo and submarine squadrons. I'm not so good with Dauntless and B17 planes.
220.4: Admiral, do you really like my single barrel guns so much?

221.28: Yeah! Then... that's all from me...
221.24: The admiral doesn't really like fighting as well, it makes me feel at ease. For the admiral, no, for y-you… I'll keep doing my best.
221.13: You called for me... Eh!? Sortie!?
221.10: Modernization... sorry! Even though I'm old...
221.26: Yeah! Then... that's all from me...
221.12: It's going to take a while to recover...
221.6: The repair is complete. And, that's all...
221.5: A new friend... well... that's all from me...
221.7: The operation is complete and the fleet has returned. Then... that's all from me...
221.15: E-enemy spotted... wait, it's a real battle!?
221.18: Night battle.... I'm good at them but... I...
221.17: Surface action... it'll be okay... I've practiced for this...
221.23: Eh!? I was the one who did the best...!? You're going to praise me...? Thank you...
221.20: Hieeeee! I-I'm on fire? Help meeeee!
221.21: Everyone... where did you all go...? *cries*
221.22: I've sunk a lot of ships already... I guess... this would have happened sooner or later...

222.1: Sendai has arrived. Please leave the night battle to me.
222.25: I am the culmination of the 5500-ton light cruisers, the Sendai-class. I'll fully teach you the appeal of a mature light cruiser. Of course, it'll be with a night battle!

222.28: The night is great, yup. Ah! You're also pretty good, Admiral ♡ Tonight, shall we... night battle?

222.8: It looks like there's a letter for Admiral!
222.9: You're going to make me stronger? Thanks!
222.10: With this, I can go hard at night battles again.
222.27: Supplies are absolutely necessary for night battles!
222.11: Morning, huh... I'm going to rest for a little while.
222.12: As expected, I'm dead tired... I'll just head into the docks for a bit, okay?
222.7: The fleet has returned. I wonder how the results are?
222.14: You must night battle, okay? Promise?
222.23: This is the expected outcome. It's fine, it's fine. You don't need to praise me so much.
222.22: I wanted to... go wild... at night some more....

223.29: Admiral... um... that is... um...! I'm sorry... it was nothing...
223.27: Thank you for the supplies. I appreciate it.

224.1: The fleet's idol, Naka-chan!Nice to meet you!
224.25: Selected as the Centre of DesRon 4, it's Naka-chan! Doing lots of work, from guarding transports to doing the Tokyo Express from Truk... Eh? Was it a Provincial tour, you ask? That is SO not what I was doing!

225.1: We've finally met! I'm Kagerou. Treat me well!
225.25: Constucted for the Circle-4 programe, Kagerou-class nameship, Kagerou. As the main power of the newly-made ships, staring off with the Hawaii attack force, I was in lots of varied battles! Treat me well!

227.25: Built in the Osaka Civilian Naval Yards, third of the Kagerou-class Destroyers, Kuroshio. Even though I look like this, I participated in such hard-fought battles as Surabaya, the South Pacific and the third Battle of Solomon, ya' know.

228.25: I'm Yukikaze, eighth ship of the Kagerou-class destroyer. Among the destroyers of the main fleet, while taking part in over 10 major naval battles, I'm the only one to have survived the war with barely any damage. Miracle destroyer? Nope, it was no miracle!
228.4: Um, do you have any business with Yukikaze?

228.27: I can feel the kiss of the fortune goddess!
228.12: Repairing so I can rejoin operations!

133.1: First ship of the Yuugumo-class, Yuugumo, has arrived. Admiral, it's okay to spoil me a bit.
133.25: First ship of the final mass-production destroyers. Laid down in Maizuru. My first battle was the ignominious defeat at Midway. It's okay, I don't mind. In the Tokyo Express to that island, Operation Ke, the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands and the evacuation of Kiska, I fought bravely, no? *sigh*

133.8: A report from headquarters. Please examine it.
133.13: Destroyer Yuugumo, going with full force!
133.9: Many thanks, I will use it well.

133.21: Kyaaaa! Now you've really done it.... I-I'll return this twice over!

133.45: 3 P.M. Admiral, the new rankings have been released, no? Let us have a look.

133.6547: It's fall. At this time of year, I'd rather not go to the south. Kazagumo-san and Isokaze-san, you two are always so lively.

230.1: I'm the Ayanami-class destroyer Oboro. I won't lose to anyone. Probably.
230.25: Seventh ship of the Ayanami-class, Oboro. Laid down in the Sasebo Naval Arsenal. I participated in the Southern operations. Hot places are better, aren't they? Kiss...? No, not that, the cold Kiska Island... I don't want to get close to that... I hope.

231.9: Just this? Well, guess I'll use it...

232.25: Special-type destroyer number 19, ninth of the Ayanami-class, Sazanami. It's hard to read? Only you don't know that character, you know. I was with the Nagumo Task Force when Pearl Harbour was burbling, and headed off to bombard Midway. Wasn't that unexpectedly cool?

232.9: It may be rather nice, thaanks~☆

232.12: Ah~ I've really done it this time too... Oh, that's wrong?
232.15: Even Sazanami can sometimes be earnest too, working working♪

232.21: Guh... I've got nothing to say~

233.28: Admiral. Even before Shoukaku-san does, and even more kindly than Mutsu-san does, you're always there watching over me. I-I'm truly always... thank you!

234.27: As a first-class lady, I shall accept it.

234.32: 0200. Co-Commander... I'm a little concerned about the hallway. Shall we go and patrol it together?
234.33: 0300. It's not like I asked because I needed to go to the bathroom or anything!
234.34: 04... 00... A lady can even pull an all-nighter flawlessly, you see?
234.36: 0... 6... 00... Ah...? "A well-rested child is a healthy child," they say...!
234.37: 07... 00... Eh? No way! I'm really late, aren't I?!

234.43: 1300. Well then, you may now to treat me to an extravagant lunch, ok?

234.45: 1500. "My, how extravagant." Yeah, right! So annoying!
234.46: 1600. Well then, I, as a fully-fledged lady, shall make a name for myself.
234.47: 1700. Now then, let's go the extra mile.

As the clouds of war gathers, we did our duty in the Northern seas at such places as Attu and Kiska. The seas around Hokkaido are our favourite, no? The Gulf of Manila and Ormoc... ah, we are weak to the heat.

I rampaged all over as a member of the proud Second Torpedo Squadron. At Guadalcanal, we gave an enemy ambush a beat down under the famous command of Rear Admiral Raizo Tanaka.

I rampaged all over as a member of the proud Second Torpedo Squadron. At Guadalcanal, we gave an enemy ambush a beat down under the famous command of Rear Admiral Raizo Tanaka.

Taking care of yourself is important, you know. Hmm... You had slight fever. Right, I'll make you something nutritious. I'm off using Mamiya's kitchen for a while. Wait for me, okay?

I will protect them.

328.39: 09...00! Oh right, during today's lunch, I'm going with Asagumo on a date! A date...isn't that nice? I'm looking forward to it!

328.41: 11...00! Commander, how do I look? I look fine? Alright, I'm heading out!

149.33: Three... A..M... I'm just sleeping now...
149.34: Four... A..M... the admiral is here, too... (...) ...Admiral...?

149.41: Eleven~! Hey, Admiral~... just looking at you never gets old!

398.1: I'm I-168. What? It's hard to say? OK, just call me Imuya. Nice to meet you!
398.25: I am a submarine born and raised in Kure. After that battle of Midway, I managed to land the final blow to Yorktown who defeated Hiryuu! Our carriers were avenged! I also worked hard running transport missions to that terrible island.

398.3: I may be riding on a float right now, but I'm actually an amazing diver!
398.4: Ah, were you looking at me from behind? It's not like I'm playing with a smart phone or anything!
398.29: Commander, did you come to hate Imuya?
398.28: Commander, let's take a break if you are tired.
398.24: Commander, I can dive to about 100m. Won't you come dive with me this time? I, will guide you with all my strength. When this fight is over... it's a promise, okay?
398.8: There seems to be a report addressed to the commander.
398.13: It's time to deploy, I'll show you the power of a Kaidai-class submarine!
398.9: If it's the commander's desire, then this is alright too...?
398.10: No way, I keep getting stronger!
398.12: This wound is nothing serious! ...D...don't make it too sore...
398.5: A new ship has been created! I wonder what kind of ship it is?

398.14: I'm gonna put some big holes in the enemies' hulls!
398.16: Load torpedoes from 1 to 4. Let's go get a win!
398.18: The night is our world! I'll finish you!
398.17: I'll approach stealthily, sinking you for certain.
398.23: I did it! You can rely on Imuya, the sniper of the sea! I'll even finish off aircraft carriers!
398.22: Ahh, I wanted to bathe in the sun more... I've had enough of... the seabed...
398.31: 0100. Night-time. Will you be okay at school or work tomorrow?
398.33: 0300. Is it okay? You really don't have anything planned for tommorrow?
398.35: 0500. Eh, did you want to hear Imuya's voice?
398.36: 0600. Commander, it's morning before you knew it!
398.38: 0800. I'm pretty strong in the morning, you know!
398.39: 0900. Let's get to work let's get to work!
398.40: 1000. Let's go with all our strength until lunch!
398.41: 1100. If we work hard I'm sure there will be delicious lunch waiting for us!
398.43: 1300. Lunch with the commander, I'm really happy!
398.44: 1400. Well then, let's give it our best and sortie even in the afternoon!
398.45: 1500. The 3 o'clock you... the disaster of yours... it's somehow scary!
398.49: 1900. I can only make curry, is that okay? Alrighty, let's make it together! We can eat together in an hour!
398.50: 2000. Did you make the curry properly? Well then, let's eat together!
398.51: 2100. Somehow after eating dinner and getting full, I get sleepy...
398.53: 2300. Commander, thanks for another day's hard work!

399.1: Hello! I-58 here! You can call me Goya. I'm not bitter!
399.25: I have fought hard from the beginning to the end. Even when the war had became harsh, I managed to take down that heavy cruiser! After fulfilling my mission and everything was all over, I managed to make it back safely to Kure, my home port.
399.2: Hello from beneath the sea! Goya here!
399.3: Phew! It's lovely good in the sea. Nothing begins unless I dive!
399.4: If it's armour, it has to be a school swimsuit! Look, it's efficiently smooth!
399.28: Do your best with your KanColle study!
399.24: Being with the admiral is so much fun! You know, there are lots of fish that only live in the south, they're worth seeing, yeah? This time, I'll take you there!
399.8: Communication for the admiral? Lemme see!
399.10: Admiral, I don't really need this...
399.5: A new ship has been finished! Anyhow, it's an above-water ship, isn't it?
399.15: Wa~ I found a lot of scary things!
399.17: Goya's torpedos - they're clever little things!
399.23: Goya, she did her best, yes? Eh? Chanpuru? I'm not a side dish, you know~
399.21: My swimsuit, a functional beauty & designated by the admiral, is...
399.22: Someday, Goya wants to dream of the day I met you all... diving deep....
399.32: 0200. Oh... There is something behind... Ah well, forget it.
399.37: 0700. If nothing else, eat some breakfast.
399.38: 0800. What kind of day will today be, I wonder?
399.39: 0900. 9 o'clock. Where are you taking 58 today?
399.40: A~dmiral. 1000. I'd like a new swimsuit soon~
399.41: 1100. A~dmiral~, I wanna try on this fluttery swimsuit too~
399.42: 1200~. After lunch, let's look at more swimsuits!
399.43: 1300. Ah, Admiral, why don't we take a nap?
399.49: 1900. I should study sometime... It's gotta be German, yeah?
399.51: 2100. Ice-cream for dessert is great, yeah? Mamiya-san, come o~n!

33.1: So you're the commander, huh? Well, I expect you to work very hard.
33.25: Fifth ship of the Special Type destroyers, Murakumo here. Huh? Never heard of me? You can't be serious. Don't even know a famous ship like me, who rescued Furutaka's crew, took part in the Southern Operations, and many other operations? Just how inept are you?!
33.3: You look restless. Are you okay?
33.4: You... I'll make you eat these oxygen torpedoes!
33.29: You... just how are long you planning on making me wait here?! What the hell! What are you thinking? Geez... hurry it up!
33.24: I just want to tell you... well, I don't really dislike you, you know. I guess you can order me to do anything... you want... What are you...?! I-I didn't mean it like that!

33.9: Heh. Not bad... this'll make me even more captivating.
33.10: I can fight on with this... ...W-What? I-I'm not thanking you or anything!
33.11: My clothes got a little dirty...
33.12: ...! ...I can't believe I have to go into the dock... how humiliating...!!
33.5: Looks like the newest member of the fleet has arrived.

33.14: Ha! Finally, to the front lines!
33.18: Now this is where I really shine!
33.17: All you fools in my path... just sink!!!
33.23: Well, it's only natural. ...What? Are you dissatisfied?
33.22: I won't forgive you... I will never forgive you for this!!

33.Rainy 6547: The rainy season, huh.... Well, it isn't so bad. It allows us to take it easy for a while. You dislike it?

150.1: I'm Hiei, Kongou Onee-sama's sister. I'm looking forward to gaining experience and getting closer to my sister's brilliance.

150.2: Ah, yes. Did you call for me?
150.4: Unnnngh... Ah..!! What is it? I wasn't sleeping! I swear I wasn't!
150.29: Oh yeah! I'm feelin' psyched! ...or so I felt? huh what?... whattt...?
150.28: Hiei can still fight some more. Commander, let's do our best together!
150.24: Thank you for your favour, Commander... B-but... my heart... belongs to oneesama! Eh? It's not that kind of talk!? O-oh.. I see... I-I'm so embarrassed~!
150.8: Seems like there's a notice for the admiral.
150.13: Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!
150.9: Yes! I can feel the power surging!
150.10: I wonder if I got closer to Onee-sama?
150.27: Alright! With this, I'm good to go!
150.11: These injuries, are just scratches though...
150.12: While dreaming of Onee-sama, I'll rest.

150.18: I will not forgive anyone who gets in the way of Onee-sama!
150.17: I, will do my best, so don't abandon me!

150.21: To do such things to the equipment handed over from Onee-sama... I-I can't forgive this!

150.33: 3 A.M. Now I am getting wide awake.

150.36: 6 A.M. I'm all swollen... I can't let Onee-sama see my face like thiiiis!
150.37: 7 A.M. Hmmm... I didn't get enough sleep, you know~ Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!

150.39: 9 A.M. Yeah! The prep work will be always be ready now!
150.40: 10 A.M. I'm gonna watch TV while on standby, 'ka~y?

150.42: 12 midday~ I've taken a liking to this midday program~ Eh? You'll take me to the recording? I'm fired up now!
150.43: It's 13 o'clock. Whew~ Lunch breaks sure are fun~
150.44: It's 14 o'clock now. H-huh? Oh no, we forgot to eat lunch! Wha-what should we do?
150.45: 15 o'clock. Ah Commander, that store over there is still doing lunch.
150.46: 16 o'clock. Ah, today I got to enjoy an outing with the commander. Eh? That's a bad thing?

150.49: 19 o'clock. Done~! My famous recipe—Hiei Curry! Go on, eat it up!
150.50: 20 o'clock. How is it? Your impression of Hiei's curry? Your impressions...I wanna hear your impressions!
150.51: It's 21 o'clock. It's been an hour since the commander ran away... Why do you run from Hiei?!
150.52: It's now 22 o'clock. *gloom* Looks like the commander got away...
150.53: 23 o'clock. Oh well, I guess I'll go to Onee-sama's room... Onee-... Commander! Why are you here?!

400.1: Guten Tag ... ah, my mistake... sorry, please call me "hachi".
400.25: I made it to Germany as the second submarine sent on the transoceanic voyage. Then, I received a U-boat. This operation was carried out 5 times, but because of mines and other events, I was the only one who was able to successfully complete the return trip... yeah, I really hate mines!

400.4: Ah! ...You've surprised me, touching me all of a sudden and making these loud noises.

400.10: That's right. I think upgrading is essential...
400.11: May I entrust you with the servicing?

400.19: It's glossy black... and its eyes are glaring...

400.34: 0400... Aa, sorry, I nodded off there...

400.40: 1000. It's time to refocus on my reading!

400.43: 1300. Let's keep on reading, shall I?
400.44: It feels refreshing to not be submerged.
400.45: 1500. I'm a bit distracted, so I can't focus on reading....
400.46: 1600. Admiral, what do you usually do around this time?
400.47: 1700. What should I make for dinner..?
400.48: 1800. I really like the atmosphere the sun setting over the sea creates.
400.49: 1900. I want to try something other than swimsuits... like the uniform everyone is wearing... maybe?
400.50: 8-8! Wait, 2000. Admiral, here and some ham, cheese and potato. Eat up!
400.51: 2100. Admiral, are you feeling better now?
400.52: 2200. Admiral is playing Kancolle! I am reading! Eheh~
400.53: It's 2300. It's getting late, isn't it. I'm a bit tired...

401.1: Such a great admiral makes me happy. I'm I-19. Yep, calling me 'Iku' is fine!
401.25: I'm the submarine I-19. Yes, Iku! I sunk the carrier Wasp with my pride and joy, my oxygen torpedoes! I was even able to hit a battleship and destroyer that was waaaay ahead of the carrier! Don't you forget Iku, Sniper of the Ocean's great abilities... 'kay?
401.2: Admiral! You're not allowed to look away from Iku!
401.3: Nnfu~, you won't get mad no matter what I do, so I like you.
401.4: Admiral? Are your shoulders sti~ff? How's thi~s? Does it hurt? Ehehehehe.
401.29: Admiral~! What were you thinking, keeping Iku waiting? Do you want to be punished again~?
401.28: A~dmi~ra~l! I'll massage your shoulders! ...Uuu, they're all stiff...
401.24: Admiral, what i~s it? You wanna dive with Iku? Oka~y...here, a wetsuit! Doesn't that look great on you♪ Well now, let's dive together! ...Fufu, make sure you absolutely don't let go of my hand. Ready and splaaash!!
401.8: Admiral, there's a message for you.
401.9: Fufu~. My sniper soul is burning~.
401.10: With this, I'll get all of them in one go!
401.11: Just a li~ttle bit of repairing~
401.12: Nn, I got beat... Once I'm better, I'll pay them back twice over!
401.14: Iku's torpedoes are itching to go!
401.15: Iku's torpedo strike, off it goes!
401.18: Admiral, I want a reward if I beat that one.
401.17: "Aim at me!" is what it feels like it's saying!
401.23: Iku had a great, dazzling victory! I'm expecting a reward from you~

401.22: Iku...is sinking...? Hey...Admiral...even if I'm not there...please...don't worry...okay...?
401.34: 0400. Really, didn't you fall asleep a bit there? Iku knows it.

401.45: 1500. Admiral? What do you normally do at this time?
401.47: 1700. Somehow, I'm itching to do something, you know?
401.50: 2000! It was great to spend Iku's favourite time with you!
401.51: 2100. So~ It's nearly time for tonight's performance!
401.52: 2200. Whoops, I got all fired up~
401.53: 2300. Almost time for Iku's sleep time, isn't it?

402.1: Sir, please let Maruyu keep working hard.
402.25: Maruyu isn’t from the Navy shipyards, so I don’t have any friends from home. I’m a little different from everyone else… I mean, the first thing Kiso-san said to me was “What are you. Can you actually go underwater?”... I'm starting to wonder if Maruyu can survive out here...
402.2: Sir, don’t you call me Mole-chan too!
402.4: I told you, It's not 'mole'! My name is Maruyu!
402.29: Siiir… I get the feeling people are just looking at me from a distance… Why is that?
402.28: Oh, are you tired? Why don't you relax with Maruyu?
402.24: S..Sir. To care for Maruyu this much... Maruyu is touched! I'll keep on doing my best!
402.8: Maruyu, delivering a communication to you sir. Otherwise known as “Mole-mail”… Huh?
402.9: I wonder if there’s anyway to fix my slow speed…
402.10: So, um… Could I.. um, get a, um… “Seiran” too… oh…. never mind…
402.26: Don't call me Moley. I'm Maruyu!
402.27: Now I can go underwater again!
402.11: Please give me a little rest.
402.12: U wa~a it's tattered, although it's the important swimsuit that I got from the captain...

402.15: Maruyu will transport it properly to the very end!
402.16: I can see you all the way round!
402.23: Maruyu can be amazing too, you know! …Wait, did someone just call me a mole?

402.22: No... I don’t want to go down... I don’t want to...!

402.31: 0100 hours. If you’re staying up sir, so will I.
402.32: 0200 hours. Sir, I'll make sure I'll dive better tomorrow!
402.33: 0300 hours. How am I doing with everyone else? I… It's fine! Of course it's fine!
402.34: 0400 hours. You worry too much, sir.
402.35: 0500 hours. It’s almost morning. I’ll go wake everyone up.
402.36: 0600 hours. All the ships were already awake… Ha ha ha…
402.37: 0700 hours. Okay, Maruyu will off to the cafeteria.
402.38: 0800 hours. *Sigh* My eyes are red? That’s… that's just because I didn’t sleep properly last night... I think?
402.39: 0900 hours. Okay, sir! Let’s switch the mood, and march on forward!
402.40: 1000 hours. I told you, I’m not sad!
402.41: 1100 hours. It’s almost time for a fun lunch!
402.42: 1200 hours. Maruyu’s going to go underwater for a bit. I’ll see you after lunch!
402.43: 1300 hours. Hmm, today’s swim went pretty well!
402.44: 1400 hours. Having a late lunch. Oh these? These are combat rations!
402.45: 1500 hours. Huh. I guess you have a lot of friends, sir.
402.46: 1600 hours. But Maruyu has you, so that’s okay.
402.47: 1700. It’s sunset. And Maruyu’s all alone…
402.48: 1800. Huh!? You’d like me to cook, sir!? B-but, I'm not sure if I can do curry...
402.49: 1900. Oh, I don’t know how to make curry… What I am going to do…
402.50: 2000. Oh… I-it’s you! You’re going to teach me? Oh, thank you so much!
402.51: 2100. Here is your curry, sir! Kiso-san taught me how!
402.52: 2200. That was good, wasn’t it sir!
402.53: 2300. Sir, friends are nice, aren’t they!

403.1: A good day to you, Admiral. It's the upgraded I-401, of the special submarine class.
403.25: I'm I-401, the second ship in the I-400 submarine series. I'm a submarine carrier capable of making a round trip around the world, and carries 3 units of the special attack plane "Seiran". Yes, it's a secret tactical weapon... it's a secret, okay?
403.3: What is it? A dive? How about a dive?
403.4: I told you that the Seiran is a delicate plane... so stop touching it so much.
403.29: Umm... the canal, can we go to the canal?
403.28: Hmm? What's up? Are you tired? Admiral, you shouldn't work so hard.
403.24: Admiral... did.. I do well? Really? You're not lying? Well, that's great! Then, can I ask for a favour from the admiral? Yeah, just one... okay?
403.8: Hmm? Admiral, going good? How is it?
403.9: Aah, so that's how it works... This'll do!
403.10: Yeah, yeah! This is great, this is really great!
403.27: Ah, thank you! I'll use them wisely!
403.12: The bath sure is nice... yep, it sure is!

403.51: 2100. Phew, this sure was a tiring day. Guess I'll sleep after maintaining my Seiran.

403.53: 2300. Admiral, shouldn't you sleep now? Sleep is important, you know?

334.1:
Submarine U-511 of the German Navy, please call me Yuu.
I've come a long way, so I'll be in your care...
334.25:
I'm the... German Navy U-Boat, U-511.
I worked hard to come here.

167.25: 12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze. If it's about combat experience, I won't fall behind that Yukikaze. I've fought again and again, participated in decisive battles, and fought to the bitter end. Yamato, Musashi, Kongou, Taihou... their last moments have been etched into my eyes. This time... I will protect them.

170.25: I am Hamakaze. I participated in many fierce battles. At Leyte, I was a part of Kongou's ring formation. Futhermore, I burned into my memory the final moments of Musashi, Kongou and Shinano. At the fateful Bounomisaki, I, Yukikaze and many others struggled to protect Yamato.

171.4: Admiral, it seems that your fleet is lacking in discipline. I shall instruct you from the basics.

171.28: Admiral, no matter what it is, it's bad to work too hard, okay? A change of pace is also a good thing, you know?
171.24: Admiral, what is it? Such an earnest expression... This is for me? ...I-I see... Y-you can give it to me. I won't give this back, you know? Definitely...
171.8: What is it? Has the situation changed for the better?
171.13: Battleship Bismarck, setting sail! Sally forth!
171.27: My thanks. I can continue to fight with this.
171.12: Apologies, I shall take a short respite. Please call on me later.

171.14: I shall show you how Bismarck fights!
171.15: A fleet battle... I'm itching for a fight!
171.18: I won't let you escape... Don't underestimate me!
171.23: I am number one? What are you saying, of course that's the case. Is that not good? You can praise me more.
171.21: They got me...! The rudder! Is the rudder alright!?... Well then, I can continue on...from here.
171.22: Once again, I shall return to Brest... I exchanged enough shells... I'm...satisfied...
171.30: 12 o'clock midnight. I'm a little tired.
171.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, is it not about time for bed?
171.32: 2 A.M. *ya~wn*... Of course, I'm tired also...
171.33: 3 A.M. You will rise properly tomorrow, yes? Could you please be punctual in the morning?
171.34: 4 A.M. I shall take a short nap. All-nighters are bad for the skin.
171.35: It's 5 A.M. Alrighty, get up! Good morning!
171.36: 6 A.M. Well now, Admiral, let's go and get all the morning affairs in order!
171.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it is time for breakfast. What have you prepared for me?
171.38: 8 A.M. This Admiral-made breakfast is pretty good. Japanese-style isn't bad.
171.39: 9 A.M. Well now, let us up and go and start today's commerce raiding! ...Eh, I'm mistaken?
171.40: 10 A.M. Kongou? Nagato? No, I don't know them. Who are they? Are they strong?
171.41: It's 11 A.M... Yamato-class? That's got a strong feeling to it. I'd like to meet them.
171.42: I am informing you that is it now 12 midday. Well now, what would be good for lunch?

171.47: 5 P.M. Phew~, today was hard work as well. Well now, shall we stop at this checkpoint for today?

171.50: 8 P.M. It's really night now... It's bad for my skin, so could we not go on a night battle?

171.52: It's 10 P.M. I shall take a rest soon.
171.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, are you still going? Good night.

174.1: Good morning. I'm Leberecht Maass. Lebe is fine, yep.
174.25: The German-born destroyer, the first genuine large-type. This shifted high temperature, high pressure engine, it could only have been designed in the country of technical skills! I'm not so great at open-sea warfare though... I'll do my best!
174.3: Nn, what is it? My boiler needs servicing...
174.4: Admiral, what is it? Is this one of this country's greetings? It's going to be difficult until I'm used to it.
174.29: Ah, It's not that I'm bored, I'm just fine, yep.
174.28: Admiral, you're always working so hard, aren't you. But, you shouldn't push yourself so much. I'll work with you.
174.24: Admiral, why the serious face? Eh? What's this box... O-oh. Thank you.
174.8: Looking at the report? Analysis is important.
174.11: Ah, they got me. I've gotta get fixed.
174.6: Admiral, a comrade's repairs have been completed.
174.5: Admiral, looks like a new comrade is here.
174.14: Not commerce raiding, but a fleet battle?... I- I can do it!
174.15: Fleet battle, huh... Okay, here I go!
174.18: Night battle huh, I'll give it a shot
174.23: I did the best? Oh... that's great, yep.
174.21: The engine room is alright, I can still sail forth.
174.22: I'm sinking, once again, huh. But, this time... it was in a real battle...
174.30: Midnight. It's a new day, yeah?
174.32: 2 o'clock. I wonder if Max is still going?
174.33: 3 o'clock. Ngh... Admiral, aren't you tired? Wow, that's impressive.
174.35: 5 o'clock. It's morning, some new missions have come.
174.36: Good morning. 6 o'clock. Admiral, good day to you.
174.37: 7 o'clock. Breakfast time, yeah? I'll go and get it started.
174.38: 8 o'clock. Admiral, how's the Nürnberger Rostbratwurst? Was it tasty?
174.39: 9 o'clock. Almost time for serious action, yeah?
174.40: 10 o'clock. About time to sortie. But, I've gotta be careful of mines.
174.41: 11 o'clock. I won't confuse fishing boats and enemy vessels, yep. Naturally.
174.42: 12 o'clock. Lunch time. What would be good for lunch, Admiral?
174.43: It's 13 o'clock. I wonder if Max is okay, I'm a bit worried.
174.44: It's 14 o'clock. Practice is important, even in the North Sea, yep.
174.45: 15 o'clock. Talking about seaworthiness...nah, I'm just wondering...
174.46: 16 o'clock. It's okay, I can do it.
174.47: 17 o'clock. It's getting a little dark, yep.
174.48: 18 o'clock. What shall we do for dinner?
174.49: The Sauerkraut and Eisbein, how is it? Admiral, is it tasty? Ah, 19 o'clock.
174.51: 21 o'clock. About time for night battles, yeah? I'm not so great at those.
174.52: 22 o'clock. It's amazing, everybody here just loves night battles, I'm surprised.
174.53: 23 o'clock. Admiral, thanks for everything today. Let's do our best tomorrow too!

175.1: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz. But, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
175.25: Zerstörer 1934 program, third ship. I was designed with good survivability, but... these new turbines have a small issue with maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
175.3: What? Don't touch me that much.
175.4: You... Does that action have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm, I see...
175.29: Hrmm... is there nothing to do? I see... there's really no battles? H~mm...
175.28: Hey, why don't you stop straining so much. Let's take it easy. It'll be alright.
175.24: What is this important business?... Oh, this is for me? Y-you.. h~mm... I-I see... That's how it is... h~mm. Thank you very much.
175.12: Docking for some large-scale repairs. Goodbye for now.
175.6: Looks like a ship was fully repaired.
175.5: It appears that a new ship has been completed.
175.14: Let's show them our true power. Casting off!
175.15: Fleet... battle, huh... Off I go!
175.16: The enemy is trapped, beginning the attack.
175.23: Oh? I'm number one? H~mm... I-I really am? H~mm...
175.21: I got hit... W-what? A Mine? I was mistaken...?
175.22: To be sunk in this strange ocean... I shall... be sleeping once again...
175.30: It's 0 o'clock. H~mm, it's quite late.
175.31: It's 1 o'clock. You're still awake? Such zeal.
175.32: It's 2 o'clock. I wonder if Lebe is still up too?
175.33: It is 3 o'clock. Hey, you dozed off there just now. Why not take a break soon?
175.34: It's 4 o'clock. H~mm, you're a bit peckish? It's better to not eat anything right now, you know.
175.36: It is 6 o'clock. During the morning, let's clear everything up.
175.38: It's 8 o'clock. For breakfast, would Roggenbrot and cheese be okay? Do you like rye bread?
175.39: It is 9 o'clock. Well now, let us reorganize the fleet. Which ship do you wish to drop?
175.40: It 's 10 o'clock. Sea mines are a bit of a landmine for me... as are puns.
175.41: It is 11 o'clock. You're still hungry? Was breakfast not enough?
175.42: It's 12 o'clock. Lunch. It can't be helped, let's have a fulfilling lunch.
175.43: It's 13 o'clock. How about some Baumkuchen for dessert? It's not too heavy?
175.44: It is 14 o'clock. Oh yes, I would like to form a fleet with the rumored Bismarck, I think.
175.45: It is 15 o'clock. H~mm, what is it? You're all restless, aren't you? Don't worry.
175.46: It's 16 o'clock. If you're tired, let's go and have a break.
175.47: It's 17 o'clock. Are you doing well? H~mm, I see. Don't push yourself too hard.
175.48: It is 18 o'clock. I'll prepare for dinner.
175.49: It is 19 o'clock. Yes, Admiral, all the preparation is complete.
175.50: It's 20 o'clock. Admiral, would you like some coffee?
175.51: 21 o'clock. I'm not particularly fond of night battles, I'd rather take a break around now.
175.52: It is 22 o'clock. To prepare for tomorrow, I shall be taking my leave shortly.

176.1: Guten morgen! I'm the heavy cruiser, Prinz Eugen. Take care!
176.25: Woah! You startled me! Ah... I am the German-born heavy cruiser, Prinz Eugen. Admiral Hipper-class, third ship. Along with Bismarck onee-sama, I took part in Operation Rheinübung. A lucky ship... ...me? I'll be fighting in this sea, too!
176.2: Woah! You surprised me! ...A-Aye! Setting off!
176.4: Admiral! Will we be doing the Rhine Exercise? ...Ah, huh? So we won't... Anyway, I'll still work hard! Leave it to me!
176.29: Bismarck onee-sama... I wonder if she's okay...? I'm a little worried... maybe I should go see how she's doing?
176.28: Woah...! Admiral, if you're tired, you need to take a little break. Definitely! Got it?
176.24: Admiral, you said you needed something? Wha- t-this is for me? U-Umm, Bismarck onee-sama is... a-ah... u-um... da... danke! I'll treasure it!!
176.8: Fleet intelligence, right? Wait just a moment... Oh... oh, oh.... so that's how it is?
176.13: Heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen, setting off!
176.11: *sigh* I got hit. I'll be fixed shortly
176.5: It looks like a new ship has been commissioned. I can't wait to meet her!
176.14: Bismarck onee-sama, let's head out together!
176.17: Main battery... aim carefully...! Commence shelling!
176.23: Wha...? I'm a lucky girl? I'm nothing of the sort! I'm bad at stuff like the shallows, after all...!
176.19: Wha...?! I got hit! But still, I can...!
176.20: Uu... I need to snap out of it...
176.21: At this rate, Bismarck onee-sama is going to laugh at me...!
176.22: I'll... be the... first to go this time... Sakawa... Nagato... see... you...
176.Anniversary 6547: Today is a wonderful day! Good work as usual, Admiral! Ehehe.

177.2: Oh...! Roger that! Prinz Eugen, sortieing!
177.20: I won't sink from something like this...! Return fire!
177.30: Woah?! It's exactly midnight! For today, it'll be my duty to notify you of the time. Alright, I've got it! Leave it to me!
177.31: It's now 1 a.m.! Was that okay, you think? Ah, I see! Thank goodness!
177.32: It's 2 a.m. In this country, you say... ushi-mitsu-doki-tte-iu-no? Ahh, that sounds a little funny to me.
177.33: Woah, you startled me! Ah, my hairstyle... you mean? Ahh! It's now 3 a.m.!
177.34: *stretch*... It's 4 a~m. ...nn... As expected, I'm a bit tired... but... I'm fine.
177.35: It's now 5 o'clock! Guten morgen! And what a nice morning it is! Let's do our best!
177.36: 6 o'clock. Breakfast, huh... eh? M-Me?! G-Got it! Leave it to me! Umm... hmm, what should I make? I wonder if I should make some for Bismarck onee-sama, too? Should I?
177.37: Okay! Today's breakfast is bread, sausage, and cheese. There's also salad... and of course, have some hot coffee! It's fairly typical, but delicious, right? Ah, it's exactly 7 o'clock now.
177.38: It's now 8 o'clock. So then, Admiral, let's break down today's operations! Shall we start with exercises? Or maybe expeditions?
177.39: It's 9 a.m. Hm? Ah, it's Nagato! Heeey, Naagatooo! ...Hm? Do I remember where we met? Well, of course I do! ...Ah... that is... huh? Ehehe... where was it...?
177.40: It's 10 o'clock. A battleship? 'Course! Together with Bismarck onee-sama, we'll sink it in no time! Leave it to us!
177.41: It's now 11 a.m. It's almost lunchtime, huh? For today, let's have lunch outside, okay?
177.42: Ah, it's already noon! It's midday! For lunch, does having cheese and bread outside sound good? Since it's so nice, shall we have a beer, ☆too? Aha, maybe not...
177.43: It's now 13 o'clock. Time to start the afternoon operations. Let's do our best!
177.44: 14 o'clock. Eh? What, what? Sakawa? Ah! I know her. She's that cute light cruiser.
177.45: 15 o'clock. Ah, you mean this? Yup! This is my rigging from Operation Cerberus. What do you think? Does it suit me~?
177.46: It's now 16 o'clock. Woah! You startled me, Bismarck onee-sama! You'd like to sortie together with me? Yes, certainly.
177.47: 17 o'clock. It's evening now. It's going to start getting dark. *sigh* Such a beautiful sky... Ah, of course, Bismarck onee-sama is even more beautiful!
177.48: It's 18 o'clock. I'll start preparing dinner. For today, does kaltes essen sound good? Eh... not in the mood? You'd prefer something warm?
177.49: It's 19 o'clock. Well then, I tried to make Eisbein pot-au-feu for dinner. You don't mind if the flavoring soaks into the soup, right? And finally, if you add in rice to make it a porridge, it's delicious!
177.50: It's now 20 o'clock. Japanese heavy cruisers are pretty well-rounded, huh? Hmm, hmm... mmm, I see~... hmm, hmm...
177.51: 21 o'clock. Huh? A signature move...? Let's see... I spent a lot of time shelling hordes of advancing enemy tanks! I'm pretty good at that! Yup!
177.52: It's completely dark out— 22 o'clock. Admiral, as always, good work on today's operations!
177.53: It's 23 o'clock. Hm, it's about time I was relieved so I can rest... Gute nacht... Huh? I can't...?

178.46: 4 P.M. Almost evening, no? Shall we leave it at this?

178.50: 8 P.M. It's really night now... It's bad for my skin, so could we not go on a night battle?
178.51: 9 P.M. H~mm, Japanese battleships have such tall bridges. Those sisters sure are something.
178.52: It's 10 P.M. I shall take a rest soon.

179.1: Good morning. I'm Leberecht Maass. Lebe is fine, yep.
179.25: The German-born destroyer, the first genuine large-type. This shifted high temperature, high pressure engine, it could only have been designed in the country of technical skills! I'm not so great at open-sea warfare though... I'll do my best!
179.3: Nn, what is it? My boiler needs servicing...
179.4: Admiral, what is it? Is this one of this country's greetings? It's going to be difficult until I'm used to it.
179.29: Ah, It's not that I'm bored, I'm just fine, yep.
179.28: Admiral, you're always working so hard, aren't you. But, you shouldn't push yourself so much. I'll work with you.
179.24: Admiral, why the serious face? Eh? What's this box... O-oh. Thank you.
179.8: Looking at the report? Analysis is important.
179.11: Ah, they got me. I've gotta get fixed.
179.6: Admiral, a comrade's repairs have been completed.
179.5: Admiral, looks like a new comrade is here.
179.14: Not commerce raiding, but a fleet battle?... I- I can do it!
179.15: Fleet battle, huh... Okay, here I go!
179.18: Night battle huh, I'll give it a shot
179.23: I did the best? Oh... that's great, yep.
179.21: The engine room is alright, I can still sail forth.
179.22: I'm sinking, once again, huh. But, this time... it was in a real battle...

179.32: 2 o'clock. I wonder if Max is still going?
179.33: 3 o'clock. Ngh... Admiral, aren't you tired? Wow, that's impressive.
179.35: 5 o'clock. It's morning, some new missions have come.
179.36: Good morning. 6 o'clock. Admiral, good day to you.
179.37: 7 o'clock. Breakfast time, yeah? I'll go and get it started.
179.38: 8 o'clock. Admiral, how's the Nürnberger Rostbratwurst? Was it tasty?
179.39: 9 o'clock. Almost time for serious action, yeah?
179.40: 10 o'clock. About time to sortie. But, I've gotta be careful of mines.
179.41: 11 o'clock. I won't confuse fishing boats and enemy vessels, yep. Naturally.
179.42: 12 o'clock. Lunch time. What would be good for lunch, Admiral?
179.43: It's 13 o'clock. I wonder if Max is okay, I'm a bit worried.
179.44: It's 14 o'clock. Practice is important, even in the North Sea, yep.
179.45: 15 o'clock. Talking about seaworthiness...nah, I'm just wondering...
179.46: 16 o'clock. It's okay, I can do it.
179.47: 17 o'clock. It's getting a little dark, yep.
179.48: 18 o'clock. What shall we do for dinner?
179.49: The Sauerkraut and Eisbein, how is it? Admiral, is it tasty? Ah, 19 o'clock.
179.51: 21 o'clock. About time for night battles, yeah? I'm not so great at those.
179.52: 22 o'clock. It's amazing, everybody here just loves night battles, I'm surprised.
179.53: 23 o'clock. Admiral, thanks for everything today. Let's do our best tomorrow too!

14.1: I'm Shikinami. I'll be in your care.
14.25: Special Destroyer number II, Shikinami. Nice to meet you. After participating in Midway and the Battle of Solomon, I serve as a convoy escort. Being a convoy escort is really rough you know... Because it's important...
14.3: What is it, I'm busy here...
14.4: Don't call me if you don't have business with me... It's not like I hate it.
