14.13: Well, let go~! It's time for sortie!
14.9: Eh? Is it all right to strengthen someone like me. It's nothing?
14.10: What is it, to invest toward someone like me... I-it's alright.
14.27: Huh? Are you fine with it, strengthening someone like me, that is. Nothing's gonna come out of this, you know?
14.11: Yayy, well then I'll get myself repaired.
14.12: Haa, it's was dangerous. I'll go to the dock.
14.6: The ship's repairs have finished. She's probably all pretty now, isn't she? Hurm.
14.5: A new ship just joined. I bet she's a cute kid... hurm.
14.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned.
14.14: Shikinami! Sailing! Don't worry about me.
14.18: Night battle huh... Well, it's fine because I'm good at it.
14.17: In the end, it's my turn huh.
14.23: Commander! I'm awesome right? Right? Ah, no, I don't care about that at all...
14.21: Hurm, I don't that I'll lose because I'm worn out!
14.Anniversary 6547: Commander, it's the third anniversary! It's a little hard to believe, you know. But still, I'm also a bit happy. I will continue to be in your care, k?
14.Rainy 6547: The rainy season makes me not want to go out, so I am not too fond of it. Well, whatever. Yeah.
14.Summer 6547: It's summer, Commander. Wanna have some watermelon? Ah, I should bring some to Ayanami too! This is kinda nice.
14.NotFall 6547: *groan* Ugh, another summer is over with. Fall is somehow a little lonely. I'll be fine, though. Really...

180.1: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz. But, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
180.25: Zerstörer 1934 program, third ship. I was designed with good survivability, but... these new turbines have a small issue with maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
180.3: What? Don't touch me that much.
180.4: You... Does that action have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm, I see...
180.29: Hrmm... is there nothing to do? I see... there's really no battles? H~mm...
180.28: Hey, why don't you stop straining so much. Let's take it easy. It'll be alright.
180.24: What is this important business?... Oh, this is for me? Y-you.. h~mm... I-I see... That's how it is... h~mm. Thank you very much.

180.6: Looks like a ship was fully repaired.
180.5: It appears that a new ship has been completed.
180.14: Let's show them our true power. Casting off!
180.15: Fleet... battle, huh... Off I go!

180.23: Oh? I'm number one? H~mm... I-I really am? H~mm...
180.21: I got hit... W-what? A Mine? I was mistaken...?
180.22: To be sunk in this strange ocean... I shall... be sleeping once again...
180.30: It's 0 o'clock. H~mm, it's quite late.
180.31: It's 1 o'clock. You're still awake? Such zeal.
180.32: It's 2 o'clock. I wonder if Lebe is still up too?
180.33: It is 3 o'clock. Hey, you dozed off there just now. Why not take a break soon?
180.34: It's 4 o'clock. H~mm, you're a bit peckish? It's better to not eat anything right now, you know.
180.36: It is 6 o'clock. During the morning, let's clear everything up.

180.39: It is 9 o'clock. Well now, let us reorganize the fleet. Which ship do you wish to drop?
180.40: It 's 10 o'clock. Sea mines are a bit of a landmine for me... as are puns.
180.41: It is 11 o'clock. You're still hungry? Was breakfast not enough?
180.42: It's 12 o'clock. Lunch. It can't be helped, let's have a fulfilling lunch.
180.43: It's 13 o'clock. How about some Baumkuchen for dessert? It's not too heavy?
180.44: It is 14 o'clock. Oh yes, I would like to form a fleet with the rumored Bismarck, I think.
180.45: It is 15 o'clock. H~mm, what is it? You're all restless, aren't you? Don't worry.
180.46: It's 16 o'clock. If you're tired, let's go and have a break.
180.47: It's 17 o'clock. Are you doing well? H~mm, I see. Don't push yourself too hard.
180.48: It is 18 o'clock. I'll prepare for dinner.
180.49: It is 19 o'clock. Yes, Admiral, all the preparation is complete.
180.50: It's 20 o'clock. Admiral, would you like some coffee?
180.51: 21 o'clock. I'm not particularly fond of night battles, I'd rather take a break around now.
180.52: It is 22 o'clock. To prepare for tomorrow, I shall be taking my leave shortly.

181.1: Is a good breeze on the way? I, the next-generation destroyer prototype, Amatsukaze, shall make my debut.

When the data proved reliable, it was passed over to Shimakaze. I was in many tight spots, but I held on and overcame them. It was really tough!

181.4: Stop it. Don't touch my hair. You'll knock my streamers out of place.

181.28: You... from time to time, go take a break. Breaks are important, too... Ugh! Are you even listening? Geez...
181.24: You... what... is this? ...Eh?! For me...? Umm... I'm willing if you are, but... you're... really fine with it being me? ...Thank you. I'm truly grateful.
181.8: So how are you doing? ...Hmmmm... not too bad.
181.10: My Rensouhou-kun is the cutest one, don't you think?
181.11: *whew* I'm worn out. May I head back?
181.12: Bathtime, bathtime, I say! I don't want to smell all sweaty.
181.6: The repair is complete. An improvised repair, what's that?
181.5: A new girl has arrived, it seems. ...That's good.
181.7: The fleet has returned. Good work.
181.14: I'm not a member of DesRon 2 for nothing. Yukikaze, come along, now.
181.15: This wind feels right... Commence firing!
181.18: Didn't I say I wouldn't let you escape?
181.17: It'll be fine... the wind is in our favor!
181.23: Me...? I'm the ship who accomplished the most? My, that's amazing! Tokitsukaze, how about that?
181.21: Ahh... the bow and the first gun turret...! But... I'm not ready to sink just yet!

181.6547: The summer heat is still around, but it's getting a little more tolerable. Eh? Baked sweet potatoes? Um, I'm not really all that interested. I really don't care... at all...

182.4: It's dangerous, so don't touch my cranes... hey! That's even more dangerous!

182.28: Admiral... you've gotta make sure you fix yourself up sometimes. Just leave the maintenance... to me, okay?
182.24: Admiral, what is it? You want to process the ring in my factory? Geez... I wonder who the lucky person is? Ehh... for me?! No way...! I-I'll treasure it! Thank you!
182.8: Do you want to check the fleet's operational status, Admiral?
182.9: Now...this is what I call progress!
182.10: Now I can repair even more! Thank you so much!
182.11: I guess even I need maintenance once in a while...
182.12: Phew... what a blessing it is to have people washing my back. Thanks so much.
182.5: It seems like a new ship has been completed. Looking forward to it.
182.7: The fleet has returned safely. Phew.
182.15: Fighting isn't my... well... but I guess I'll just have to do it!
182.18: A pursuit... w-what am I supposed to do about that?!
182.17: It's not my forte, but here we go...!
182.23: Eh...EEEEEH!? M-me!? How did that happen...? Well, can't say I'm not happy...
182.19: Geh... ouch... is my factory fine?
182.20: I'm hit...don't let the fire spread to the work machines!
182.21: I...I was targetted!? I can't do a good repair job in this state!

182.32: 0200. I've somehow remembered my time at Truk... I sure worked hard.
182.33: 0300. About Palau… I wonder why? I don't really remember much of it.
182.34: 0400. It's morning soon, yeah? Admiral? You sure you're fine with not sleeping tonight?
182.35: 0500. The sky is gradually getting brighter! It's a brand new day!
182.36: 0600. Admiral? What will you have for breakfast? It's not anywhere near Mamiya's level, but my cooking is unexpectedly good, you know?
182.37: 0700. It's morning, huh. Should we go and wake the sleepy heads up?
182.38: 0800, huh. Now! Time to get the repairs on!
182.39: 0900. Which ship would you like me to repair? …Eh!? It can't be… a sortie!?
182.40: 1000. …Admiral? For me, battles are a bit… ah… no… even if you load me with all these weapons…
182.41: 1100. You're too reckless, Admiral. It'll be hell if the work machines broke down!
182.42: 1200. It's afternoon! It's Akashi curry time! What do you say?!
182.43: 1300. I'll be doing the inspection of ship interior factory! There's quite a lot of it~
182.44: 1400. It's about time I dive fully into the afternoon repairs, okay?
182.45: 1500. Admiral? Don't you feel a little hungry now? Hmm?
182.46: 1600. Mamiya Monaka is really tasty, isn't it! I would like to make some in the ship too...
182.47: 1700. The sun will be setting soon. Oof… It's been tiring, yeah.
182.48: 1800. Do you want to eat out for dinner? Like the Yamato hotel, perhaps... just a joke, really.
182.49: 1900. I'm sorry it's only something simple, but dinner is ready!
182.50: 2000 I guess a full stomach really makes you sleepy, huh… Yaaawnn… Ah— I shouldn't!
182.51: 2100, huh. The day will be ending in three more hours. Thanks for the good work.
182.52: 2200 Nights at the anchorage sure is quiet, huh… It'll be nice if it stays like this…
182.53: 2300 Admiral? Thank you for your hard work for today!

182.Summer 6547: It's summer, isn't it! I want to wear a swimsuit, too! Admiral, you can buy me one! *sparkle* Ehe.
182.6547: Fall has arrived. It's a season that gives you a bit of an appetite. Mamiya-san, we need you!

183.1: Admiral, Light Cruiser Ooyodo has joined the battle lines. Please leave the fleet administration & supervision to me.

There was a problem with the installation of the specified new model recon, & the battle situation changed, so I wasn't really able to undertake my role as the combined fleet flagship. However, I participated in the Northern Operation & the Operation Rei-Go. I, too, will do my best on the front lines.

183.14: Combined fleet's flagship, Ooyodo, casting off!

183.20: No way... A starboard list? Flood the ballast!
183.21: Geh, they got me! B-but, I won't sink yet. Ooyodo, will not sink!
183.22: Damage control, hurry! Eh, it's no good? It's no good! Admiral, it looks like this is the end of the line. We'll meet sometime, somewhere, I'm sure...

183.42: 1200. Admiral, Let's have curry for lunch - Military Band curry.

183.44: It is now 1400. Oh my? Ashigara-san. What's the matter? I see.

183.47: It is now 1700. Admiral, the dusk sea is beautiful, is it not?

183.50: It's 2000. Admiral, here is the after-dinner tea.

185.43: 1300. How was my specialty curry? The potato was good too, right?

185.45: 1500. Admiral, it's now time for the carrier squadron to sortie, right? Right?
185.46: 1600. The seared sky sure is beautiful... it's already evening, huh.
185.47: 1700. Have to prepare dinner soon. What would you like, Admiral?
185.48: 1800. Since we had curry for lunch, I guess we should have something more exquisite...
185.49: 1900. Admiral, I tried making Fricandeau Beef. How is it?
185.50: 2000. How was the Fricandeau Beef? Hehe... great to hear!
185.51: 2100. Admiral, want to go draft up tomorrow's operation plans after we clean up?
185.52: 2200. Tomorrow WILL be the day when the mobile squadron get to sortie... Right, Admiral?!
185.53: 2300. Admiral, this sure has been another tiring day. Shall we also do our best tomorrow?

186.1: Kagerou-class Destroyer tenth ship. Tokitsukaze... has arrived!

186.3: Nn? What, what? What is it?
186.4: What is it, Yukikaze, stop it. Eh? ...Huh... Commander, what are you doing? I'll hit you.
186.29: Commander, Commander! Commaaandeer! Hey! Hey, can't you hear me? Hey!
186.28: Commander, have you seen Yukikaze? Hmm, is that so. Then, you're fine as well! Hey~ Hey~
186.24: Commander, what's the matter? Are you looking for Hatsukaze? Wrong? Amatsukaze? That's wrong too? Then who? Huh? Ah, me? W-why? Err, err... Thanks♪
186.8: Commander, looking at scores? Tokitsukaze also wanna look, wanna look!
186.11: Haa. I want to clean up a bit.
186.12: Going to soak in the bath. Sorry-.
186.5: Commander, they said a new ship is done.
186.7: Haaa, tired, tired~. The fleet has returned.
186.23: Hou hou, so Tokitsukaze is first, huh. That's good, pretty good!
186.21: I ha-te unreasonable operations, I really ha-te them.
186.22: I'm... first again, huh... that's okay... Yukikaze, Hatsukaze, Amatsukaze... See, you... again...
186.30: Commander, it's 00:00! Um... Commander? What are you doing?
186.31: 01:00. Commander, what are you doing in midnight? Let me see it too!
186.32: 02:00. Commander, keeping secrets from me is not good. Not goooood!
186.33: 03:00. Fighting with Commander is really tiring... To think he's hiding it until the end...
186.34: 04:00. Whatever. I'll look for it with Yukikaze and the others later, when Commander is asleep.
186.35: 05:00. Commander, it's morning! Totally, totally morning!
186.36: 06:00. Commander, make breakfast please! ...eeh, you can't? Liar, you can't be.
186.37: 07:00. Well, it can't be helped. Let's go together to Mamiya's place, Commander!
186.38: 08:00. Mamiya's breakfast delicious. Me? Impossible, totally.
186.39: 09:00. Now then, I should probably call Yukikaze and others for sortie! Sortie, sortie♪
186.40: 10:00. Amatsukaze's windsock, doesn't it make you curious~? ...eh, it doesn't? ...I see.
186.41: 11:00. Commander, what are you gonna eat for lunch? Where are you going? Curry is good too.
186.42: 12:00. Fufu♪ Afternoon curry with Commander♪ Rice nice, satisfied satisfied♪
186.43: 13:00. When your stomach is full, don't you just want to laze around? You do become like that huh~.
186.44: 14:00. Commander, did you see Yukikaze? She disappeared really fast.
186.45: 15:00. Commander, it's time for a snack. Snack♪ What do you want to eat? I want...
186.46: 16:00. Hatsukaze and Amatsukaze have changed. Right? I'm still normal, right?
186.47: 17:00. Commander, sunset sunset! Isn't it nice, this time of day. I'm pretty fond of it.
186.48: 18:00. Commander, time for dinner! Commander, what do you want to go eat? Hey♪
186.49: 19:00. Eh? Commander is making dinner? I wonder if it's alright... Do you need help?
186.50: 20:00. The commander's handmade dinner, delicious! Cook again tomorrow!
186.51: 21:00. I'm going to Yukikaze's place for a while. Nah, I don't really have anything I need to do there.
186.52: Commander, it's 22:00. It's totally night. Time to sleep...
186.53: 23:00... I'm fine! Since I'm on time announcement duty! I'm not gonna sleep! Maybe!
186.Rainy 6547: I hate the rainy season~ I just hate it~. ....At times like this, I'll just climb on top of the commander's head! Grrrr~♪
186.EarlySummer 6547: Commanderrrr! It's almost summer! Let's go swimming with Yukikaze this summer. Okay? Okayyyy????
186.Summer 6547: Commanderrr! It's summer! Let's go to the sea! I don't mean on a sortie! Come on, hurry, hurry, hurry...!

187.1: Repair Ship Akashi, at your service! Leave the emergency maintenance at the base to me! I'll support the girls in the front lines!
187.25: I'm Akashi, the only dedicated repair ship in the combined fleet. I was in charge of repairing ships damaged in the front lines when I was stationed in the Truk Anchorage. I supported the fleet from behind right up until the destruction of the Anchorage. Pleased to meet you.
187.3: Admiral... I really think you ought to be repaired a little too.
187.4: It's dangerous, so don't touch my cranes... hey! That's even more dangerous!
187.29: Right... don't worry! I'm busy with things such as repairs and procuring new machinery! So don't worry! ... really...
187.28: Admiral... you've gotta make sure you fix yourself up sometimes. Just leave the maintenance... to me, okay?
187.24: Admiral, what is it? You want to process the ring in my factory? Geez... I wonder who the lucky person is? Ehh... for me?! No way...! I-I'll treasure it! Thank you!
187.8: Do you want to check the fleet's operational status, Admiral?
187.9: Now...this is what I call progress!
187.10: Now I can repair even more! Thank you so much!
187.11: I guess even I need maintenance once in a while...
187.12: Phew... what a blessing it is to have people washing my back. Thanks so much.
187.5: It seems like a new ship has been completed. Looking forward to it.
187.7: The fleet has returned safely. Phew.
187.15: You have to wipe off.. the sprinkle of sparks!
187.16: Never have I thought that I would be using my weapons to hit the enemy fleet!
187.18: A pursuit... w-what am I supposed to do about that?!
187.17: It's not my forte, but here we go...!
187.23: I've been under your debt, so take this as a token of my appreciation! My real job is repairs though!
187.19: Geh... ouch... is my factory fine?
187.20: I'm hit...don't let the fire spread to the work machines!
187.21: I...I was targetted!? I can't do a good repair job in this state!
187.22: Seems like I'm heading towards the sea floor... guess I can have another long sleep. Good night.
187.30: 0000, Midnight... Shouldn't you be resting soon?
187.31: 0100. Aren't you sleepy after all? Eh? Me? I'm fine!
187.32: 0200. I've somehow remembered my time at Truk... I sure worked hard.
187.33: 0300. About Palau… I wonder why? I don't really remember much of it.
187.34: 0400. It's morning soon, yeah? Admiral? You sure you're fine with not sleeping tonight?
187.35: 0500. The sky is gradually getting brighter! It's a brand new day!
187.36: 0600. Admiral? What will you have for breakfast? It's not anywhere near Mamiya's level, but my cooking is unexpectedly good, you know?
187.37: 0700. It's morning, huh. Should we go and wake the sleepy heads up?
187.38: 0800, huh. Now! Time to get the repairs on!
187.39: 0900. Which ship would you like me to repair? …Eh!? It can't be… a sortie!?
187.40: 1000. …Admiral? For me, battles are a bit… ah… no… even if you load me with all these weapons…
187.41: 1100. You're too reckless, Admiral. It'll be hell if the work machines broke down!
187.42: 1200. It's afternoon! It's Akashi curry time! What do you say?!
187.43: 1300. I'll be doing the inspection of ship interior factory! There's quite a lot of it~
187.44: 1400. It's about time I dive fully into the afternoon repairs, okay?
187.45: 1500. Admiral? Don't you feel a little hungry now? Hmm?
187.46: 1600. Mamiya Monaka is really tasty, isn't it! I would like to make some in the ship too...
187.47: 1700. The sun will be setting soon. Oof… It's been tiring, yeah.
187.48: 1800. Do you want to eat out for dinner? Like the Yamato hotel, perhaps... just a joke, really.

187.50: 2000 I guess a full stomach really makes you sleepy, huh… Yaaawnn… Ah— I shouldn't!
187.51: 2100, huh. The day will be ending in three more hours. Thanks for the good work.
187.52: 2200 Nights at the anchorage sure is quiet, huh… It'll be nice if it stays like this…
187.53: 2300 Admiral? Thank you for your hard work for today!

188.1: I am Tone! With my addition to the fleet, there will be no problems searching out the enemy!
188.25: The last completed heavy cruiser of the Japanese Navy, oldest sister of the Tone-class, Tone. At Pearl Harbor and Midway, as the eye for the fleet, I unceasingly watched the length and breadth of the ocean. I ended out the war protecting the Kure Naval Yards as a floating fortress, fighting until my blades were broken, arrows were depleted.
188.4: Admiral... you have quite a free time over there don't you. How about use it to adjust my catapult, carefully okay?
188.29: N-no! I'm not... It's not like i'm bored or anything!
188.24: That's right, my scouts have found the enemy fleet!! ...Eh? Enough of that? ...Then what is it? What is this?
188.8: Let's see, now, what's the status like? Hmmm...
188.10: You have my thanks... Compared to that Chikuma, I became stronger again!
188.11: That's right, maintenance is really important. I-it's not like I lack of sleep alright?
188.12: Grr.... Even I get tired. For now... to sleep!
188.6: The ship is fully repaired. That's a relief.
188.16: The catapult has been serviced, just for this moment!
188.18: Did you think you could escape from my scouts!?
188.17: No, not yet..! I will never lose to Chikuma!
188.23: As long as I'm here, it's victory as expected! Because I am "the" older sister, compared to that Chikuma!
188.21: Direct hit!? ...I shall not sink with merely this!
188.22: I have blundered...! I am sinking, no? The siesta of a million years...

189.1: Second ship of the Tone-class, aviation-cruiser Chikuma. I'll do my best with nee-san.
189.25: I'm Chikuma. Carrying 4 twin cannons on the foredeck, and with substantial reconnaissance capability, I am the second of the Tone-class heavy cruisers. Together with Tone nee-san, I acted as the important eyes of the Nagumo task force.
189.2: Tone nee-san? Oh, it's just you Admiral.
189.4: Really, Tone nee-san, please don't come that close. Oh, wait? Admiral?
189.29: Well… It is about time to lay out an operation… Oh you seem busy… Ah…
189.28: Admiral… Thanks for everything until now. You're just like Tone nee-san. Fufu...
189.24: Admiral, calling me out to this place... I... my heart is set on my oneesan... Eh? It's about formations? Oh my... Even me...
189.8: Are you going to check on the report, Admiral? Here's the report~
189.13: Chikuma, all preperations complete! Heading out!
189.9: To take care of just me... Nee-san will get mad, you know?
189.10: I'm so happy♪ I must report this to Tone nee-san.
189.27: Oh… I'm happy. Thank you so much.
189.11: My legs feel a little breezy with this clothing, Fufu~♪
189.12: My clothes and catapult are all spoilt... I'll go and repair it a little, yes?
189.6: Looks like a ship has finished repair.
189.5: It appears that the new ship's construction has been completed.
189.7: I have a report that the operation is complete.
189.14: Is reconnaissance okay? Alright, heading out!
189.16: Nee-san is also doing her best, huh... Attack!
189.17: Recon teams, do your best observing my batteries~
189.23: How am I so strong? There's someone I want to protect. *giggle*
189.20: Ow! The main cannon!? No, I can still fire!
189.21: Ohh... I can't let nee-san see me in such an unsightly shape...
189.22: Is nee-san.... okay? She is..? That's great...

24.1: Hello. I'm Light Cruiser Ooi. Pleased to make your acquaintance.
24.25: I'm Ooi, fourth ship in the Kuma-class light cruisers. I was born in Kobe. I'm an active practice ship at the Navy School, you know? Of course, I'll change into a torpedo cruiser if I need to fight for real. Nice to meet you!
24.2: Is this some sort of drill?
24.4: Admiral.. what's with that hand? Is this some sort of drill? May I shoot it?
24.29: Will Kitakami-san be alright?..... I'm getting worried as I'm not with her... Hmm... I'm so worried... It's definitely, yes, there's definitely something that's about to happen! I have to go now!
24.28: Admiral? What happened to the other girls, you say? Eh...? That's not it? Hmm, it's okay then.. It's okay...
24.24: Kitakami-san!... oh, it's the admiral? Ah, no, it's fine.. yes, I love the admiral too!
24.8: There is a new message for you, Admiral.
24.10: Um, please strengthen the other ships too.
24.27: Yep, be sure to pack me with fuel and torpedoes okay? Fufu, this way I can fight again.
24.11: Yes, I'll be taking a short break.
24.12: Tsk, what terrible command- no, it's nothing~. Ufufu.
24.6: The ship reparation is concluded, that's a relief.
24.5: I'm so happy that a new friend has arrived.
24.7: The fleet has returned. Thanks, everyone.
24.14: Ooi, sortieing! Don't fall behind, everyone!
24.15: I get all worked up when I hear about exchanging shells!
24.18: Who's the one that hurt Kitakami?
24.17: Become scrap at the bottom of the sea!
24.23: Oh, me? Ufufu, that isn't such a bad feeling. I'll try my best again!
24.21: They got me... I'll need to get repaired.
24.22: I wonder if we've worn down the enemy fleet...? Really? That's fine. I'll sink them...
24.30: Admiral, midnight has just came around again. It's late night.
24.31: The time is currently at 0100. Eh...? It sounds too strict? I-I see...
24.32: The time is――... Ah, I mean, it's 0200. Do you prefer it like this, Admiral?
24.33: 0300. ...Geez, so annoying. Being picky even in the way I make the hourly announcements... N-Nothing! It's 0300, sir!
24.34: It's 04...00... Admiral? Admiral...? Did he go to sleep? ...THIS IS MY CHANCE!
24.35: 0500. I need to go to Kitakami-san's side!! Yes, she is definitely troubled! Kitakami-saaaaaaaaaan!!
24.36: 0600! Kitakami-san, are you okay, are you safe!? I-it looks like you're fine... Eh? This knife? Ah, it's for making breakfast...
24.37: 07,00... Yes, I was thinking, of preparing, breakfast... For today's miso soup, are you okay with gluten?
24.38: 0800. Alright, for Kitakami-san's sake, I made breakfast with a quality that is above my skill level! Please go ahead and eat up♪ ...It's delicious? I'm relieved♪
24.39: 0900. Eh, shouldn't I return to my post? But...
24.40: 1000. Admiral, I'm back... Where did I go? ...Isn't it obvious, of course it's to Kitakami-san's place!!
24.41: 1100. Um... Admiral? Why are you holding your head like that? Did you get a flu!? Let's see, where is the flu medicine...
24.42: It's 1200. It is now noon. Should I make some lunch? It's fine. I'm good at cooking.
24.43: 1300. Go on, eat up! Eh? What is this...? It's obviously omelette rice! Should I write something with the ketchup?
24.44: It's 1400. What is it, Admiral? What's with that look of doubt on your face. I didn't do anything like poison your lunch, you know? How rude.
24.45: 1500. It's about time to seriously go out for some sorties now I guess. ..Yes, I'll do my best!
24.46: 1600. Um... For the expedition, what should the fleet do, Admiral?
24.47: It's 1700. Oh my, It's nearly dinner time. I'll prepare dinner food for a while.

24.49: 1900. Kitakami-san♪ I just accidentally cook too much curry! If you don't mind, let's eat togetheeeeR!
24.50: 2000. See, there's a curry for Admiral too. Eh? It's delicious...? Your body is getting hotter? You see?
24.51: It is now 2100. Let's see, we're done washing up, the area around the fire is okay too. Good work for today, Admiral. Fuu...
24.52: 2200. Tsk, That one light cruiser is making such a noise A―GAIN... Admiral, Can I go to complain her? Ah, O...Okay?
24.53: 2300. Admiral, Thank you for your hard work today. Is Kitakami-san already sleeping?
24.Anniversary 6547: Today's an important day! During a day like this, it's the best to spend the day with Kitakami-san! Kitakami-saaaaan!
24.Summer 6547: It's almost summer, isn't it? Time to go buy a matching set of swimsuits with Kitakami. Ufufufufufu.

318.1: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. I'll once again try my best as a carrier!
318.25: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. My speed was not up to plan specifications as there were issues with changing the boilers, but I have an enhanced flight deck and armaments as this Light Carrier class. Carrier Ryuuhou, giving it her all!

318.4: Geez! I'm not a transport, nor an anti-air cannon stand! I'm a carrier, a carrier you know!

318.28: Aren't you tired, Admiral? Want to take a quick nap on my flight deck? Please do!
318.24: Admiral... I thank you from the bottom of my heart for raising me as a remodeled carrier. I will always, yes, always be thankful. I'll always, always be part of the admiral's mobile squadron!
318.8: Admiral, what is the situation like? Is it okay?
318.13: I'd like to show the true power of the Carrier Ryuuhou!
318.9: I do think the Tenzan are adorable.
318.27: Thank you for replenishing my planes!
318.11: I'll just be in the bath.
318.12: Apologies. This may be a long bath.
318.6: Thank goodness, it seems like the reparation has been completed.
318.5: Seems like a new friend has come.
318.7: The fleet has returned safely. What a relief.
318.14: Task force, deploying. I'll go with determination to win!
318.15: This feels great... First assault squad, launch!
318.16: Even I can fight if I have planes!
318.18: Moving into the chase. All ships, launch assault!
318.17: Don't make light of us remodeled carriers!
318.23: My planes did great? H-hurray! This is the strength of the Carrier Ryuuhou!
318.20: Oh no, my flight deck hangar!
318.21: They got me! The elevator has been... but don't worry, I'm not sinking!
318.22: Sinking as a carrier... did I manage to accomplish a lot this time...?
318.30: It's midnight now. It sure has gotten late. Are you tired?
318.31: 0100. Admiral, it's already late into the night, you know?
318.32: 0200. Admiral, are you sure you don't need to rest?
318.33: 0300. Geez, I'm starting to feel a little sleepy, too... I-I'm fine! Yawn...
318.34: 0400. D-don't worry! I've been keeping myself awake by counting the number of Tenzan in my hangar.
318.35: 0500. It's morning, Admiral! You're up early... don't tell me you stayed up all night...
318.36: 0600. What should we have for breakfast? I guess curry is a little too heavy for the morning...
318.37: 0700. Admiral, I tried making miso soup with fried eggs along with fried salmon fillets for breakfast. Dig in!
318.38: 0800. Now, let's get through the day with zeal! Right, Admiral?

318.43: 1300. How was my specialty curry? The potato was good too, right?
318.44: 1400. Um, Admiral, it's time for the mobile squadron to- ah, not yet? Okay...
318.45: 1500. Admiral, it's now time for the carrier squadron to sortie, right? Right?
318.46: 1600. The seared sky sure is beautiful... it's already evening, huh.
318.47: 1700. Have to prepare dinner soon. What would you like, Admiral?
318.48: 1800. Since we had curry for lunch, I guess we should have something more exquisite...
318.49: 1900. Admiral, I tried making Fricandeau Beef. How is it?
318.50: 2000. How was the Fricandeau Beef? Hehe... great to hear!
318.51: 2100. Admiral, want to go draft up tomorrow's operation plans after we clean up?
318.52: 2200. Tomorrow WILL be the day when the mobile squadron get to sortie... Right, Admiral?!
318.53: 2300. Admiral, this sure has been another tiring day. Shall we also do our best tomorrow?

319.1: Myoukou-class Heavy Cruiser, Myoukou. Let's do our best together until the end.
319.25: A heavy cruiser built under the auspices of the Washington Naval Treaty. I'm a first-class warship of the Japanese Navy designed by Yuzuru Hiraga. This name has also been passed on to Aegis destroyers of the modern MSDF.
319.2: Admiral. Did you call for me?
319.4: If it's rather difficult to say, let's move over to the room over there... shall we?
319.29: The admiral seems very busy... In that case, I should do everything I can at hand, so that the admiral may call on me whenever I'm needed.
319.28: If the admiral falls, I...please at least rest a bit when you are tired. It is Myoukou's wish.
319.24: I greatly respect the admiral's fabulous strategy and tactics, and always shall.
319.8: It looks like there is a message for you from Command.
319.9: Thank you very much for the equipment switch.
319.10: With this, it feels like I can fight to the end!
319.27: Thank you very much for the equipment switch.
319.12: Are you sure that someone like myself would be allowed to rest?
319.5: Oh, I'll go greet our new addition.
319.7: The fleet has returned. With wonderful results!
319.14: This Myoukou, for the sake of my sisters, is prepared to fight to the bitter end!
319.18: Then there's no other choice... Moving to pursue!
319.23: It's all thanks to everyone's hard work. Do commend them, would you please?
319.21: What else... can I possibly do...?
319.22: See you... in another life... good bye.
319.30: 0000 hours at night. It's already this late. The day goes fast, doesn't it Admiral?
319.31: 0100 hours. Admiral, pushing yourself too hard might be tough on your health.
319.32: 0200 hours. This Myoukou will look over the remainder, okay? Admi-... Oh...
319.33: 0300 hours. No, I was just taken by surprise when you put the blanket over me.
319.34: 0400 hours. Admiral, what should I do with this? Oh? Admiral, are you sleeping?
319.35: 0500 hours. I better take care of everything while the admiral's asleep.
319.36: 0600 hours. Hngh... It's morning. The admiral's job certainly is a tough one. Oh, a visitor?
319.37: 0700 hours. Coming! Oh, Ashigara, what's wrong? You look surprised?
319.38: 0800 ho-... Ah, good morning. Ashigara was here just... Admiral? You don't look so good.
319.39: 0900 hours. (Sigh) ...Admiral? You forgot your appointment with Ashigara for a discussion over breakfast, didn't you.
319.40: 1000 hours. Goodness. I'll make sure to apologize to her in your stead. By the way, about this document...
319.41: 1100 hours. Yes, I suppose we'll have an early lunch while we work.
319.42: 1200 hou- Oh... another visitor? Come in! Eh-... Haguro? Why are you so teary?! Ah, don't leave!
319.43: 1300 hours. Admiral, I see why you're so troubled... Very well. We'll chat after our work.
319.44: 1400 hours. Admiral, I don't mean to scold, but can we talk for a minute?
319.45: 1500 hours. Admiral, we'll leave out the fact that you're forgetful. But promises are things that are meant to be kept.
319.46: 1600 hours. All the girls look forward to seeing you. And forgetting that is... Are you listening to me!
319.47: 1700 hours. Now you have plans for dinner with someone as well, don't you?
319.48: 1800 hours. Wha-... You want me to make curry tonight? Okay... Very well.
319.49: 1900 hours. Here's Myoukou's Special Curry. The meat has been glazed with brandy, and...
319.50: 2000 hours. Well then, I'll go patrol the base perimeters. ...Admiral?
319.51: 2100 hours. I suppose all the Kanmusus love the admiral anyway. (Giggle)
319.52: 2200 hours. Everything is quiet on the base! Oh. Nachi? Where are you going with that bottle of sake?
319.53: 2300 hours. Hmm? You had plans to drink with the admiral? (Sigh) Goodness... Admiral, you are unbelievable...

192.1: You're.. still on combat duty? Alright, this Nachi will again, go on the battlefields with you!
192.25: Born at the Kure Naval Yards. I am the second of the Myoukou Heavy Cruisers, who was the guardian of Shanghai. I was rushed out to the Pacific front as a flagship of the fifth fleet. Carrier-based planes? Ah, I'm a bit bad with those.
192.3: Mm.. Well then, how about we drink some sake together tonight?
192.4: Hmm? What's that you're doing? What kind of tactic is that?
192.29: No, I'm not bored. In fact i'm enjoying myself looking at what you're doing.
192.28: You, how are you doing? ...I see, it relieves me. We can sortie more together!
192.24: Hey you… Somehow… I don’t hate you…. Yeah, as long as I am with you, I can promise more great victories. Definitely.
192.27: Supply? I really appreciate it to you.
192.11: I'll rest for a bit, but is Ashigara alright?
192.12: Apologies, but let me rest. Recess is part of a battle too.
192.6: Looks like the repairs have been completed. Do you wish to check on it?
192.5: Looks like a new ship has been launched. Looking forward to it.
192.7: The report for the battle results is in. Want to hear about it?
192.14: Let's go! Those who afraid just stay where you are!
192.15: Now, witness my very own war!
192.16: Enemy to starboard! Take aim carefully!
192.18: Alright, we'll sweep up the remnants of the enemy in one go! Nachi squadron, charge!
192.17: One more time... This will be the critical hit!
192.23: I can't be getting all excited about this victory now.. we can't let our guard down yet. Nonetheless, tonight let's drink the night away!

331.Anniversary 6547: Admiral, today is an important day, right? Amagi is honored to be with you! Fufu, I'm happy.

332.1: I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the Unryuu-Class Carriers! Eh? 'A floating anti-air gun platform'? I-It's not like that...! What are you saying!
332.25: I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the Unryuu-Class Carriers!  Yes, a standard aircraft carrier. Looks like I was late. But after the battle was over, I was working at full power. In a sense, I am the best. It's the truth! Really it's true!
332.2: I am a standard carrier. Got it?, a standard carrier!
332.3: Do you understand? Give me your best aircraft!
332.4: Wha... That's not my hanga... What are you doing anyway!? What do you want, you idiot!!
332.29: I see I see, so this is Ryuusei Kai. Yup yup. I've heard about it... wait isn't that one a Reppuu? That's wonderful! They're perfect for me! Eh!?
332.28: Admiral, hey, if only this aircraft was resupplied I would... Eh, what? Even if you look at me with such gentle eyes, nothing... it will gain you nothing! Geez~
332.24: What is it, Admiral? Can you see that I quite busy here, because this engine requires a lot of maintenance... what... this is... Thank you! I...
332.8: Yup. reporting in is extremely important! Shall we go together?
332.13: Aircraft carrier Katsuragi preparation complete! Ready for sortie!
332.9: T-That equipment is not too bad. Yup.
332.10: Yes, this'll help in the fight! I'm happy.
332.26: I'll give it all I've got!
332.27: Thanks for these valuable supplies. Yes, now I can head out again!
332.11: I'm going to the bath! You... don't you dare peek!
332.12: Eek... looks like this will take a while. Sorry, I'm going to the bath... I will kill you if you peek!
332.5: A new member has been added to the force! I'm curious!
332.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned. Well done everyone!
332.14: Carrier task force flagship, Katsuragi, launching! Whee... I've always wanted to say something like that!
332.15: Yes!!! Enemy fleet sighted! Launching strike aircraft!
332.16: Enemy spotted! All AA gun... Wait that's wrong, again from the top!!! Attack force, covering force, prepare to deploy!
332.18: Pursuing, huh? Going too far is restricted, but still sometimes needed... Alright, go!
332.17: Attack force, starting! I... I'm a standard carrier!
332.23: Eh? Me? Katsuragi is number one? Really? Um... thanks...
332.19: No!? Is the flight deck ok? Prevent any secondary explosions! I... I don't want to sink!
332.20: I, Katsuragi, can not sink at such place! Such attacks...!
332.21: I was hit... But the engine room is still undamaged! Can operate without problems!
332.22: I see, this is sinking... cold... and lonely... bye-bye, everyone...
332.30: Um...Today I, standard carrier Katsuragi, will be your secretary. What? Got a problem? I have enough time to do time announcement at least, enough time!
332.31: 1:00 AM Is that okay? Are you listening? I see...then its fine! Alright!
332.32: Its 2:00 AM...Hey...You aren't listening to my announcements! I see...really? Then, that's okay.
332.33: 3:00 AM... See! You clearly didn't listen! Just what were you doing? ...huh, cooking?
332.34: It's 4:00 AM... What? Night meal for me? That's hot pot with udon... well, thank you. It's delicious but... why?
332.35: 5:00... Huh? Compared with my sister, the part that needs to stick out do not stick out, so I have to eat...? Y-You have done it! Any last word!?
332.36: It's 6:00 AM. Hah... just what were you looking at when you are looking at us shipgirls? That place is irrelevant with our ability to perform... good grief...!
332.37: It's 7:00 AM! I got mad at someone and get hungry as a result! You, you need to make breakfast... Isn't that right as a punishment? Yup punishment!
332.38: It's 8:00! No way, your breakfast is... delicious! Where did you learn?... Eh... Amagi-nee? R-Really?
332.39: It's 9:00. I really don't want to... But, a carrier's ability is not limited to her cooking! After all, a carrier is all about...
332.40: It's 10:00 AM! Ah! Zuikaku-senpai! Good work as always!... ah, I was nervous! Well it was Zuikaku-san, the one I admire!
332.41: 11:00 AM. Eh? What, it's true though! After all it's Zuikaku-san, the one I'm admiring! Isn't that wonderful...! I also like her camouflage, mine also matches hers!
332.42: 12:00 PM. Ah! It's already lunchtime!? What are you doing for lunch? Going to Mamiya's or...unnn...
332.43: 13:00 PM. Sometime it's good to go outside the harbor. You get a little of this disembark feeling... Ah! I-It's not like we're on a date or anything!
332.44: It's 14:00 AM. It's not what you think! You're such an idiot... but that Western-style shop is really good... I wouldn't mind going there again.
332.45: It's 15:00 PM! Ah, is Amagi-nee okay? Yup, I'm always perfect! Look! My maintenance is perfect, from my rocket launcher to the flight deck!
332.46: It's 16:00 PM! Eh? What? AA defense? That's my special of special trick! What? Show it right here? It's very flashy, you'll see!
332.47: 17:00 PM. It's already evening, after all that trick... Hah, I can't do any sortie or expedition...B-But I'll do it tomorrow!
332.48: 18:00 PM. Evening already... well... If it's okay I'll do something simple! Rice ball with salt, pickled raikon radish... wait, green leaves with miso soup is alright, right?
332.49: It's 19:00 PM. So? Is my riceball with sal... riceball seasoned with salt delicious? Of course, the level will only increase after this!
332.50: 20:00. W-well sometime, I want to to go out as the main ship of the combined fleet... really.
332.51: 21:00. So, what is your dream like? Isn't it fine, just tell me! Eh? Really? Ehh... Uhm... So it's like that...
332.52: It's 22:00 PM. *humming* Eh? I'm not in a good mood, not such thing! I'm fine! I-am-fine! Ehehe
332.53: 23:00. Finally, today was perfect! Good work from you too! Tomorrow will come soon, so how about a little rest? Huh? You're not gonna?
332.Anniversary 6547: I see. Today is an important day for us, right? It is for you, too... isn't it? Right?
332.6547: Somehow... doesn't fall seem a bit melancholic...? In a way? Eh? Amagi-nee, you love the fall? Why?

326.1: We are Hatsuharu. With us following, thou wilt be fine!
326.25: We are the first Hatsuharu-class destroyer, Hatsuharu. We were attached to the Northern Force. As the clouds of war gathers, we did our duty in the Northern seas at such places as Attu and Kiska. The seas around Hokkaido are our favourite, no? The Gulf of Manila and Ormoc... ah, we are weak to the heat.
326.2: Oh, are you interested in us?
326.3: Yes, this is how you should be treating us.
326.4: You really can't calm down, can you?... Why is that? Dost thou take such interest in us?
326.29: Aah, well, you know, it would be all right if we did some work... it would be all right, you know?
326.28: You should... rest a little better as well. Of course, we can rest when it's important. ...It's pleasant!
326.24: You...!? W-w-w-w-aaa! To expose us to such shameful words! Shame on you! For shame...
326.8: That's right, information is important. Good good. There is a lot to inquire from this.
326.9: Yes. We became stronger once more.
326.10: Did you not say that the equipment up to now was not quite up to par?
326.27: We are grateful... no hardships in this.
326.11: Phew... this bath is nice. As I thought, cypress-tree baths are supreme.
326.12: This arsenal has such skilled craftsman, we are unperturbed.
326.6: Good grief.. Are the repairs finally finished?
326.5: A new ship is complete, perchance?
326.7: It appears that the fleet has returned. Surely, a triumph?
326.15: Thou wishest to see our dance? Very well... we shall show thee plenty!
326.18: At long last... we shall demonstrate our true purpose!
326.23: This triumph, it was not solely due to our efforts. Everyone did their part.
326.20: Verily, thou shalt experience our wrath!
326.21: 'Tis but a scratch! We shall not sink from just this!

405.1: Fifth Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Harusame, yes. Leave the transport missions to me... desu.
405.25: Fifth Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Harusame. Delicious... wait! that's a different kind of Harusame! With Murasame and big sis Yuudachi we cruised the sea as Destroyer Division 2! I'm a bit good at transport and guarding mission, yes!
405.2: Did you have business... with me?
405.3: Commander, um... I have another transport mission, so... Excuse me.
405.4: Hyah! ...C-Commander!? Um... The supplies are fine, they're fine so...
405.29: Commander? ...Um, Commander? ...I wonder if he's busy? ...Yeah, I have to do my best too!
405.28: Um, I can't really say it well, but... I'm always grateful. Truly.
405.24: Commander... U-um, what is it? Is it a new transport mission? Eh, it's not? Then night battle duty? That's not it either? Eh... for me... Fufu, I'll treasure it.
405.8: A business message is... um... Please look.
405.13: Yes, fifth Shiratsuyu-class Harusame... heading out!
405.9: With this... transport missions will progress.
405.10: With this, I'll be able to guard well too...
405.11: Yes, I think I'll take a bath.
405.12: I've gotten a bit tired... yes.
405.6: Repairs, seems like it has to be done, okay.
405.5: A new ship has, yes, been completed.
405.7: Mission complete. Fleet returning to base, yes.
405.14: Second Destroyer Division, Harusame, heading out!
405.18: Allow me to start the night battle.
405.23: I was the best... really? Really? ...Yes, I'm a little bit happy.
405.21: T-they got me... I can still continue my guard duties.
405.22: I guess... that's... it... Murasame-neesan... This time, I'll go on ahead...
405.30: It's 0000. Uhm, it's a new day.
405.32: 0200. It's the dead of the night. I'm a little... No! I'm not scared at all.
405.33: 0300. Wah...! Uuu, I'm sorry. I'll be careful from now on.
405.34: 0400. Hey, I'm feeling kind of... I-It's alright! I'm not sleepy, yes!
405.35: 0500. Commander, it's the start of the day. Good morning.
405.36: 0600. Is it alright if Harusame makes breakfast? Right! Let's do it.
405.37: 0700. And for breakfast it's Mapo Haru... I'm kidding. I made a Japanese set meal. Please help yourself to it.
405.38: 0800. Let's work hard for today's transport mission. Transporting and escorting are important.
405.39: 0900. I wonder if Murasame-nee-san is doing well... Hmm...
405.40: 1000. For lunch... Ah, it's still to early for lunch right now. I apologise.
405.41: 1100. Commander, what are you having for lunch? It's not so bad to eat out once in awhile. Uh... Uhm...
405.42: 1200. Eh, it's alright for me to accompany the commander out for lunch? I'm so happy.
405.43: 1300. It was fun at the western restaurant. I'm glad to have gone, yes.
405.44: 1400. Huh? What's Yuudachi-nee-san doing at such a place? Isn't it dangerous?
405.45: 1500. Commander, uh, uhm... Should I bring along some snacks?
405.46: 1600. The skies are getting darker. It's almost evening, yes.
405.47: 1700. Commander, the sunset is beautiful, isn't it? I feel like I could stare at it forever.
405.48: 1800. I'll prepare dinner. Commander, what do you feel like having?
405.49: 1900. I've gone and done it. Harusame's special Mapo Harusame. T-Try it!
405.50: 2000. How was dinner? The secret ingredients were sesame oil and five-spice powder.
405.51: 2100. Commander, I'll be washing all this dishes up first. Excuse me.
405.52: 2200. Commander, it's about time we made plans for tomorrow's transport mission. Uhm...
405.53: 2300. Oh, uhm, Commander, thanks for the hard work today.
405.NotFall 6547: Forever... at the admiral's side... the second destroyer division will do its best. Yes!

406.1: Unryuu class aircraft carrier, Unryuu is here. Admiral, please leave the future of the task force to me.
406.25: I am the elder sister of the Unryuu class aircraft carriers built under the Rapid Naval Armaments Supplement Programme during wartime. We are the improved mass-production version of the medium-sized carrier masterpiece, Hiryuu. I'll show you the immense potential of the main force of the reborn Mobile Task Force.
406.3: I'm telling you, stop touching my flight deck! Are you really that curious? It can't be helped.
406.4: Hnn...so you'll give me even more outstanding planes? I wonder if you can give me different plane types as well.
406.29: Admiral?.....Admiral? Can you hear me? Should I send a recon plane? Or maybe a dive bomber?
406.28: Admiral, though the battle this time is unavoidable, ease your shoulders and relax a little bit. I'll always be beside you... So it's okay.
406.24: Admiral, what's this formality? Eh, is this for me? It can't be...um...why me? There are others that still...no, I'll treasure it. It's important.
406.8: Information? Let me have a look... Hmm, I see.
406.13: Task force flagship aircraft carrier Unryuu, deploying.
406.9: New planes really boosts morale, huh.
406.10: Ryuusei Kai, huh...? Ah, um, nothing.
406.27: Resupply eh...Please refill my aircraft too.
406.11: My clothes have become dirty. Quite unpleasant....
406.12: Taking a bath after battle... Whew.. I'll just take a breath and rest for the moment.
406.6: Repair is finished. The dry docks are busy after all.
406.5: It seems a hastily-built ship is complete. Is she Amagi?
406.14: Unryuu class transport ship, they say? What a joke. I shall show you my true power.
406.16: I can go? Okay, all aircraft, launch now.
406.17: Stay alert for submarines. Don't let down your guard.
406.23: Unryuu is the most valuable ship? I see...Hnn, I'm happy, it feels good....
406.20: A direct hit!? Engine room! Deploy the power reserves!
406.21: Got hit...must recover from listing... This time... I won't sink...!
406.22: An explosion from the hangar...no good...well...it's fine...this time it was able to work as intended...thank you...
406.31: Admiral, it's now 0100. I don't dislike the stillness of the late night.
406.32: 0200. Admiral, it would be better to take a rest now.
406.33: 0300. Admiral, I... have a feeling someday I will meet Amagi as well.
406.34: 0400. Admiral, it will be dawn soon. Another day will begin.
406.35: 0500. Admiral, it is now morning. Now, let's begin operations.
406.36: 0600. Admiral, what would be good for breakfast? Are you all right if it's the same as mine?
406.37: 0700. I'm sorry for the one-plate meal. Is the amount a little lacking?
406.38: 0800. Now, Admiral, let's bring the carrier-based planes aboard, and dispatch the fleet.
406.39: 0900. What would be good for carrier-based aircraft? Tenzan... ? Ryuusei...? Reppuus are fine too.
406.40: 1000. Admiral, the currently loaded airframes are quite... Um, uh...
406.41: 1100. Admiral, what would be good for lunch? I shall prepare it.
406.42: 1200. I made onigiri for lunchtime combat rations. How is it?
406.43: 1300. Admiral, was the lunch a bit too simple? I'm sorry...
406.44: 1400. Admiral, of course I don't mind the transport missions, but the cargo... err....
406.45: 1500. I see. But carrying such highly volatile cargo is somewhat... yes...
406.46: 1600. Admiral, I'm feeling nervous in this hour. As I thought, one should be more alert to the presence of submarines.
406.47: 1700. Phew... it's a relief once we get past this hour. I was a little nervous.
406.48: 1800. Admiral, it's time for dinner. What would you like? Er...
406.49: 1900. What's the matter, Shigure? Eh, provisions? Thank you, you saved me.
406.50: 2000. Admiral, Shigure has brought us provisions of onigiri and pickled daikon radish.
406.51: 2100. Admiral, we have already had it for lunch. But Shigure's onigiri is delicious, isn't it? Ufufu.
406.52: Now is 2200, Admiral. It's completely night & becoming much quieter now.
406.53: Admiral, Unryuu reports that it's now 2300. Thank you very much for today.

407.3: Mutsu-san...? Ah... Admiral? Um... excuse me. My mistake.
407.4: It'll be great if we can avoid air raids even a little bit. Admiral, would you like to paint yourself, too?
407.8: Want to analyze the intelligence? I'll go get it.
407.9: This is... this is modernization... ...isn't it?
407.7: The fleet has returned safely. I'm really glad!
407.21: Hah... I'm still able to sail... I can... still keep fighting!

408.1: Ex-merchant ship aircraft carrier, Junyo~! Woohoo!
408.25: Wartime remodeling based on the Luxury liner, Kashiwara Maru. The renovated appearance is the aircraft carrier, Jun'you. I fought properly, and survived until the end. Ain't I surprisingly capable ?
408.2: Aaaadmiral~. If you're free, come help out~. Hiyou an' me, we need some planes built, ya know?
408.3: Hiyahh~! A drink after battle is especially great, isn't it? I can see the admiral as two people~! Ahahaha!
408.4: Oohh~, that's a long face, Admiral. That's no good! Drink some of this! Here, here.
408.29: Ahh man, I'm bored. Oh well, I'll drink! Let's see... maybe I'll have hot sake...
408.28: Yo~ Admiral, shouldn't we have a drink together some time? I got some really good sake. Ah, don't worry I have snacks too.
408.24: I'm worked hard so that I wouldn't lose to those aircraft carriers. You're the only Admiral that gets that, you know. Hey, gimme a kiss~.
408.8: That's right. Once in awhile, information management doesn't sound bad. How was it, hmmm?
408.13: Nice! Fully remodeled Jun'you is ready to sortie! Set sail!
408.10: S-so cool! I'm gonna fall in love with myself~!
408.27: Much obliged. And don't forget to supply the canteen either. It's important!
408.11: Phew~! Dunkin' in hot bath stings my wound. Say, is it possible to bring sake in here?
408.12: Dang, my armour's gettin' a bit thin. With me and Hiyou, there's no helping it.
408.6: Repairs are finally over!. Let's celebrate my recovery!
408.5: A new friend has come. Let's have a party.
408.7: The fleet's come back. Good work.
408.14: With me an' Hiyou here, well, we're a Task force, yeah? Yeah!
408.15: Let's go all out! All out!
408.16: Heheh. I'm gonna strike with all my force! Eat this!
408.17: Oh yeah, Reppuus and Ryuuseis. I want some of those too. Gahaha-!~
408.23: Wha? Man, I really did it, didn't I? Carrier-based planes really are the best. Hehe.
408.20: Told ya' my armour was thin. Really!
408.22: H-hey, hey now, I'm sinking? Really?

409.1: I've... come again, to these seas. Yuugumo-class destroyer, Hayashimo... reporting for duty.
409.25: I'm the 17th of the Yuugumo-class Destroyer, Hayashimo. I was born in the Maizuru Naval Base Factory, to times of impending troubles. I launched for the Battle of Leyte Gulf from the Lingga Naval Anchorage... And I've seen many things.
409.3: Heh... Yeah. This scenery hasn't changed.
409.4: Commander? To care about me, you're really kind.
409.29: Just like this... I'm always watching. Watching... always... forever.
409.28: Commander. I think you're working a bit too much too. Umm... Sometimes, together, we should... Uu... I-it's nothing... Uu
409.24: Commander, meeting you, I... I'm glad. So, just this is enough... eh? This is... truly? I... can I change, I wonder?
409.8: Commander, you'll look at the data? I see...
409.9: Stronger... will anything change if I get stronger?
409.27: Thank you very much. You have my gratitude.
409.6: The repair... right... Repair is repair.
409.5: More battle strength is needed... again... they increased.
409.7: The fleet returned. Fu...Fufufu. They returned.
409.14: Victory strategy number one? Oh, it's not huh.
409.15: You want to go at it with me? Fine, I'll be your opponent.
409.18: Night, huh... Fufu, let's jump right in.
409.23: You're giving someone like me your blessing? Commander, you're a good person. Fufu... Ufufu.
409.20: Ouch... what... this time it's my chimney?
409.21: Like this, it can't be helped. Isn't there a good sandbar around?
409.22: Right in front of me... everyone is... what should I do. Wait... wait... I'm going too.
409.32: 0200. We have an enjoyable time at night, too. I've watered it down (the sake), let's keep having fun!
409.33: 0300. Pulling an all-nighter will harm your body, Commander. Rest for awhile.
409.34: 0400. The blue of the morning sky. I don't hate it, but it's a little cold right now.
409.35: 0500. I'm sorry, was my hand cold to the touch?
409.36: 0600. Let's wake everyone up and get ready for the day.
409.37: 0700. The morning checks have been done... Let's look for Mamiya-san... And have our breakfast.
409.38: 0800. Commander, here's the mission file for the day. Let's start by looking at it closely.
409.39: 0900. All fleets that can be deployed have been sent out on expeditions. What should we do with the remaining ships?
409.40: 1000. Ah... What is it, Shiranui-san? Did you need us for anything?
409.41: 1100. Commander, I'll be making... Maizuru-styled meat stew for lunch, alright? Fufu...
409.42: 1200. How was... the meat stew? There's enough... For seconds.
409.43: 1300. Saying it was delicious... That's... Troubling for me...
409.44: 1400. Commander, am I... Mistaken about anything? Oh, I see. It's fine then.
409.45: 1500. It's time for... Some snacks. Caramel... I don't hate it.
409.46: 1600. The caramel was delicious. Makigumo-nee-san... You ate too much.
409.47: 1700. Commander, fighting a losing battle is detestable isn't it? No more...
409.48: 1800. I'll make dinner. It's not something to be made light of... It's curry.
409.49: 1900. I added some coconuts from the southern islands into my curry. Fufu...
409.50: 2000. There's enough curry for every girl, so please help yourself to it.
409.51: 2100. Commander, how was Hayashimo's curry? Fufu...Fufufufu...
409.52: 2200. Ah, Nachi-san brought the whiskey bottle. Will you drink some?
409.53: 2300. When I'm together with the commander... I'll... Forget about all these unpleasant happening.
409.Rainy 6547: Commander. Umm... once in a while, can we... N-Nothing. Ugh...

78.1: It's the English-born returnee, Kongou, desu! Nice to meet you!
78.25: The super-dreadnought fitted with Western technology at Vickers in England, Kongou, desu! Here in the Pacific Theatre, I'll use the power of my speed to be of great use, desu! Look forward to it!
78.3: I'd love a cup o' tea~
78.4: Hey! Admiral! I don't mind you touching me, but there's a time and place for everything!
78.28: Hey! Admiral! Even though you're always doing your best, I want you to not push yourself so hard, desu!
78.24: Admiral... even though it's the time and place, if you forget the mood and timing... it'll be a 'no', you know?
78.8: Admiral! You've got mail! Love letters aren't allowed!
78.13: Now it's our turn! Follow me! Everyone, form up behind me!
78.9: Yes! I will show you what I'm made of!
78.10: It feels like I've finally found the real me!
78.27: Yes! I will show you what I'm made of!
78.11: Always got to make time for teatime.
78.12: Uu~... seems like I went a little overboard, desu...
78.6: The ship has returned from the Repair!
78.14: The one who will win over the admiral's heart is me, desu!
78.18: You think I'm finished?! Think again! I'm not letting up once I lock onto you!
78.23: Did you see my performance? I'll do even better next time— just you watch— so nooo! Don't look away!
78.21: Shit! The precious equipment I got from the admiral!
78.22: Admiral... may your fortunes hold... I'll be... watching from Valhalla...
78.Anniversary 6547: Hey! Admiral~! It's the third anniversary! Yay~! Congratulations and Burning Love~!!
78.Rainy 6547: Oh, it's the rainy Tsuyu season! I don't like it, desu! Uu~!
78.Summer 6547: The summer season! It's here, desu! Hiei, where's my swimwear? Eh... there's nothing?

410.1: Hello! Last of the Yuugumo-class, it's Kiyoshimo! I'm a bit late, but I'll be in your care!
410.25: I'm Kiyoshimo, the 19th and last of the Yuugumo class destroyers. I was born in Uraga dontcha know. And goodness, what a horrible situation it was that I was born into too. I wasn't around for long but I took part in several fleet actions. Leyte was, of course, apalling to see but I even took part in Operation Rei-gou! How's that?
410.2: Hey, aren't you glad it's Kiyoshimo?
410.3: Hmhmmmm! Uraga born and bred. Great, isn't it?
410.4: Geez, Commander! ...Keep it a secret from my older sisters? Ok?
410.29: Hey, Commander? What's that, what are you doing? Hey, watcha dooin? Tell me tell me tell meeeeeee?
410.28: Commander? You know, if you're tired, you can take a break with me? Right, right?
410.24: Commander? What's wrong, you have such a serious look on your face? Eh, what's... this? This is for me? Really? Nn... thank you. I wonder... why... I'm starting to tear up.
410.8: Commander? Want to see the message? Hm?
410.9: I wonder how many more remodels will it take for me to become a battleship...? Eh? O-of course I can!
410.10: How am I looking? Am I cool? Strong?
410.11: I wish I sortie with battleshi~ps!
410.12: I'll be in the bath for sliiiightly longer. Yup.
410.14: Operation Rei-Gou? No? It's all good! Sortieing anyway!
410.15: I won't lose to Yuugumo-neesan or my other sisters!
410.16: I wonder how Musashi-san is doing? I've got to give it my best too!
410.18: A night deployment, huh... I ended up remembering that night.
410.17: I said I'd protect you this time, didn't I?
410.23: Hmhmm, how's that? Now you've seen what I can really do. You want to go ahead and remodel me into a battleship now?
410.19: Hyaa!? It'll be the end if that hit on target!
410.21: Huh? The left side? Huh? Navigation is impossible? No way... That's... Really bad isn't it...?
410.22: Am I... going to sink... again? It's fine... Everyone, go on ahead... Once you hit the enemy... come back, ok?
410.30: 00000! Eh? Was there an extra 0? 0000-... H-huh? Huh? Huuuh?
410.32: 0222! Wah, I messed up again. I'll get it this time! It's 0200!
410.33: 03! ...00... I'm sleepy... This mission, is tough...
410.34: 0400. I'm seriously sleepy right now! Won't someone take over already?!

410.44: 1400. Eh, Kasumi-chan? What's wrong, you're here because you're worried about me again?

410.46: 1600. Commander, this Kiyoshimo has mended her ways. Let's do it!
410.47: 1700. Right, I should get to cleaning the office and prepare for outfitting!

411.1: Of the two Fusou-class super-dreadnought battleships, I am the elder sister, Fusou. Please take care of me and my younger sister Yamashiro.

411.3: Admiral, why is the sky so blue I wonder... My heart is also, towards the admiral... I-It's nothing! Nothing at all. I'm sorry...
411.4: Admiral? If you touch it too much - I'm a little worried about the ammunition storage...
411.29: Um... Admiral? I wonder if I wasn't heard... Admiral? Admiraal? ...Oh my, that's a relief. Fusou, waiting here on stand by.
411.28: Admiral… If you work too hard, your body will get bad. Oh, me?...I...*sigh*
411.24: My main cannons, aren't they wonderful? But specialising in firepower too much can lead to all kinds of problems...If it's Admiral, I'm sure you understand, right?

411.10: Please modernize my sister Yamashiro as well.
411.11: It's only a scratch, don't worry about it.
411.12: With these large turrets, my shoulders get stiff... I'll be resting for a while.

411.5: It looks like we got a new comrade...
411.7: Admiral, the fleet has returned to base.
411.14: Battleship Fusou, setting sail. Yamashiro? Don't fall behind, we're sortieing!

411.18: I'll show you the real power of the Nishimura fleet!

411.21: In this kind of condition, I won't be able to breach the Leyte Gulf...
411.22: Am I going to sink after all? Hope Yamashiro's still fine...

412.2: I've been remodeled... so maybe... this will work...
412.4: You, too... Please take a break sometime.

413.1: Asashio-class destroyer, Asagumo, reporting in! So you're the commander... huh. Hmm. Well, it's fine. I'll do it!
413.25: Asashio-class destroyer number 5, Asagumo. Together with my sworn friend Yamagumo, we made it through many battlefields. That's right, the 9th DesDiv. Famous, right? Eh, you haven't heard of us? You know, I don't really like jokes. Remember that!
413.3: Whaat? I'm pretty busy, you know.
413.4: What is it, geez. Eh, you're interested in Asagumo? Then it can't be helped, huh.
413.29: Wh-What? There's nothing for me to do? Well, it's fine, but kinda annoying. I know, shall I massage your shoulders? Ah, I'm kidding. Just kidding, of course!
413.28: Commander...Its good that you're working hard, but if you overdo things, it makes me worried, seriously! Yes, make sure you rest appropriately...got it?
413.24: What, Commander? I'm pretty busy here... Heh, what? Another joke. ...Eh, you're serious? Ah, what do I do... Y-Yamagumo is... Ehh, umm...
413.8: That's right, you always need to check your information. Isn't that common sense?
413.13: DesDiv 9 moving out. You heard that, Yamagumo? Follow me!
413.10: My, is it alright? Yeah, yeah.
413.26: I'll take it off your hands!
413.27: That's right, supplies are important. Ah, I see, you knew that already, Commander.
413.11: I'll take a bath. D-Don't peek, ok?
413.12: I'm getting in the bath. Geez, even though I said to properly service my turbine!

413.7: Mission complete. The fleet has returned to base. It's good to see everyone's safe.
413.14: Destroyer Asagumo, setting sail. Leave it to me.
413.15: Enemy ships spotted! We can do this, begin firing!
413.16: Don't mess with DesDiv 9! We can do it, keep moving forward!
413.18: Night battle, huh. Yep, let's do this!
413.23: See, isn't it me? I won't lose to the likes of the Kagerou-class. Obviously!
413.20: Tch... That hurts, you know! Quit it!
413.21: I...I've been beaten...but, I can still navigate..! As if I'll sink!
413.22: ...Fufu, Yamagumo... We're together again. It's not like I'm... like I'm lonely, you know...
413.30: Commander! It's gotten pretty late... I'll keep you company for today. It just became midnight, after all!
413.31: It's 0100! The night's a bit cold...
413.32: It's 0200...? What's with that face...? I'm not particularly sleepy or anything. you know?
413.33: It's 0300...? Commander... are you feeling drowsy? You have terrible bags under your eyes... Are you not getting enough sleep? Its fine if you have a nap, I'll be on night watch from here on.
413.34: Its 0400, huh... These early morning hours are cold... I don't hate it, though... What do you think, Commander... oh you fell asleep...?
413.35: It's 0500! Commander! Get up! We have to go wake everyone up soon! Hey, are you listening?
413.36: It's become 0600! Everyone, raise up! Okay? ...Commander? Are you even awake?
413.37: It's 0700! Breakfast time... bread is fine, isn't it? Toast? Aren't you demanding...here you go.
413.38: 0800... I'll take care of the plates, pass them here. Ah, the jam on the toast was good, wasn't it? Yamagumo gave it to me!
413.39: Its 0900. Its about time for the fleet to seriously start running...please use us destroyers well, too! Commander? Are you listening?
413.40: Its 1000 huh... Are the expeditions okay? Our tasks are progressing at a good rate...all thats left is...uh, Commander? What are you doing? Hey?
413.41: Its 1100. Can I have lunch with Yamagumo? I promised her. Ah, she's not a bad girl, really! I guarantee it!
413.42: Its 1200 right? Commander, this is my best friend Yamagumo. She's a little weird, but please look after her! Uhh... Yamagumo, where are you going? Hey!
413.43: 1300. Commander, sorry...it seems like she had something on her mind...I'll ask her about it later! Sorry...how strange though...
413.44: Its 1400 now. As an apology for not eating lunch with you, I bought this at the canteen. We can eat this together...or rather, I'll give it to you, okay?
413.45: Its 1500 huh...Ah! It's Kirishima-san! Welcome back! Yes, Asagumo has been doing well! Yes!
413.46: Its 1600 now. Eh, my attitude towards Kirishima-san is different? Of course, that person is amazing! After all, I saw it! Mmm, I saw it!
413.47: 1700. It's about time to prepare dinner. Ah don't worry, I'll prepare it! I said I'll do it, don't worry about it!
413.48: Its 1800 now. Okay, dinner is served! Eh, you're complaining about the barley rice? What are you talking about, this is the basis of the dish! It's also very nutritious!
413.49: 1900. Hm? But the yellowtail teriyaki was delicious? I know right? It goes will with barley and rice, doesn't it?
413.50: It's become 2000. The night...the night is not my strong point. Ah, don't worry, I'm fine....now...
413.51: Its 2100 now. Oh, Yamagumo? What is it? No no, thats wrong! That's absolutely wrong! Jeez!
413.52: 2200. Yamagumo has some kind of misunderstanding...sometimes she goes into la-la land with her thoughts. She's usually pretty normal though...
413.53: Its 2300, huh...its completely nighttime now. The naval base is...not very quiet though. Yeah, I'll have to go give a warning.

414.1: Good morning~~. Asashio Destroyer number six, Yamagumo. Please treat me well!

414.28: Commander, you're working so hard~ How admirable~ Yamagumo thinks that you're really quite amazing~ Yes, really!
414.24: Commander, what is it? Are you giving this box to Yamagumo? I wonder what it is? Ooh, pretty~ Thank you~

414.10: How is it~? Does it suit Yamagumo~? Really~?

414.12: Uh, I'm sorry~ I'll take it easy with a bath~

414.14: Oh, Asagumo-nee? Do you want to go together?
414.16: Uh-huh~ I want to hit as much as possible~
414.18: Night battles~ Yamagumo might just be a li~ttle bit bad at them~
414.23: Huh~ Yamagumo was the best~? Oh, I guess that could happen~ That's interesting~
414.20: No~ Yamagumo is weak against attacks~!
414.21: I guess I need to get a bi~t more serious.
414.22: I'm sinking, huh... Asagumo-nee... don't come... okay?... See you... later...

415.10: This is good... With this, I feel like I can keep going.
415.27: Thank goodness... Now I can fight.

415.39: 0900. Soon, our Fourth Destroyer Squadron will sortie in full force as well. Commander, your orders!
415.40: 1000. Maikaze, dancing around all the time like that is dangerous... Ah, Commander, I'm sorry!

415.42: 1200... Ah, Akagi-san. And to what do we owe the plea- Eh? Lunch? Y, yes! Help yourself!
415.43: 1300. That surprised me back then. Excuse me... No, I'm fine.
415.44: 1400. Well, let's do our best with the afternoon's missions too. Commander, what's next?
415.45: 1500. Maikaze, I'm sorry, I'm working right now... Haah, it can't be helped... Jeez.
415.46: 1600. Commander, excuse me. I'll be fine. It won't have any effect on the fleet's duties.

415.48: 1800. I will handle the preparations for dinner. How would steak be, every once in a while?

415.51: 21... Ah, Tone-san, Chikuma-san! Chikuma-san, I'm perfectly fine.
415.52: 2200. Commander, it's a quiet night. It would be nice if all nights could be like this, huh.

416.1: I'm Furutaka! I'm a little small for a heavy cruiser but... Heavy cruiser Furutaka will do her best today too!
416.25: Heavy cruiser, Furutaka. Selected by Vice Admiral Mikawa to be a member of the eighth fleet, I took out a lot of enemies at the first Battle of Solomon! This is what a heavy cruiser can do!

416.3: Aoba? Would you sto... Ah, it was you Admiral, g, good work!
416.4: A~o~ba~! ...Ah, it's you again Admiral? Sorry, I thought it was Aoba again...
416.29: The admiral's, busy... uh... what to do...? I wonder what's Kako doing?... Admiral, what should Furutaka do!?
416.28: Admiral? The good points of a heavy cruiser... have you come to a better understanding of them? Really? Then, then that's great! I'm glad!
416.24: Admiral! How was the Heavy Cruiser team's performance? Did we make a difference? Awright, that's great! I'm so happy!

416.9: With this night battles will be a cinch!
416.10: With Team Mikawa's comrades, I can boast.

417.19: Ow! I ain't just gonna take that. Here goes the Kako Special!

417.21: Youuu! You perverted son of a bitch!

419.29: Hamakaze...Yahagi too, I wonder if they're okay...ah! Admiral! I'm just fine. I would save you too!

419.24: Kiska... Ah, I'm sorry! I'm not interested in romance right now... even so, will you wait for me...?
419.8: Yes, our combat strategy is important. Say "no" to reckless plans! Right?

419.12: With this, I'll be able to protect everyone again.

86.1: I'm Hiei, Kongou Onee-sama's sister. I'm looking forward to gaining experience and getting closer to my sister's brilliance.
86.25: The battlecruiser that Admiral Inoue loved, it's Hiei. Even though I'm a shiny Imperial ship, I'll work my hardest. I was even the test-ship for the Yamato class, didn't you know? Eh? The Battle of Guadalcanal? Yes, I fought hard.

86.4: Unnnngh... Ah..!! What is it? I wasn't sleeping! I swear I wasn't!
86.29: Oh yeah! I'm feelin' psyched! ...or so I felt? huh what?... whattt...?
86.28: Hiei can still fight some more. Commander, let's do our best together!
86.24: Thank you for your favour, Commander... B-but... my heart... belongs to oneesama! Eh? It's not that kind of talk!? O-oh.. I see... I-I'm so embarrassed~!
86.8: Seems like there's a notice for the admiral.
86.13: Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!
86.9: Yes! I can feel the power surging!
86.10: I wonder if I got closer to Onee-sama?
86.27: Yeah, my strength is surging up!
86.11: These injuries, are just scratches though...
86.12: While dreaming of Onee-sama, I'll rest.
86.5: Looks like a new younger sister... or perhaps an older sister, has arrived.

86.14: I won't lose to Commander, in love or in battle!
86.18: I will not forgive anyone who gets in the way of Onee-sama!
86.17: I, will do my best, so don't abandon me!

86.21: To do such things to the equipment handed over from Onee-sama... I-I can't forgive this!
86.22: Is Kongou Onee-sama... safe? Then, it's... alright...

86.34: 4 A.M. Can't sleep, why can't I sleep! This is your fault, you know!
86.35: 5 A.M. Hie~i! This turned out to be pretty much an all-nighter!
86.36: 6 A.M. I'm all swollen... I can't let Onee-sama see my face like thiiiis!
86.37: 7 A.M. Hmmm... I didn't get enough sleep, you know~ Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!

86.39: 9 A.M. Yeah! The prep work will be always be ready now!
86.40: 10 A.M. I'm gonna watch TV while on standby, 'ka~y?

86.45: 15 o'clock. Ah Commander, that store over there is still doing lunch.
86.46: 16 o'clock. Ah, today I got to enjoy an outing with the commander. Eh? That's a bad thing?

423.1: I'm the fourth ship of the Akizuki-class destroyers, Hatsuzuki. Are you the admiral? Very well, I'll march on.

In anti-air battles, I covered the rescue of aircraft carriers. Acting as a part of the fleet's rear guard, I faced the enemy.

423.10: This… can I make use of this?

423.32: Its 02:00. I'm not really good at this, but here's your tea. I'll leave it here, so drink it when you get the chance.
423.33: its 03:00. Sleepy? Late nights don't bother me. Its thanks to my training. Don't look down on me.
423.34: Its 04:00. That night? Well, I don't really remember much, other than Isuzu and the others leaving. Sorry.
423.35: Its 05:00. Its morning. Morning's are nice. There's no such thing as a night that never ends. Ah, the morning sunlight feels good too.

423.39: Its 09:00. Ah, Nee-san! Secretarial duties? Yeah, I think I should be able to do them with no problems. At least, I think so.
423.40: its 10:00. That's right! I'm really proud of Akizuki-neesan. She's our nameship after all!
423.41: Its 11:00. Admiral, what do you want to do about lunch? I can make it again if you'd like.
423.42: Its 12:00. Mamiya? I've always wanted to try her food. Is it okay if I have curry? Thank you so much!
423.43: Its 13:00. That curry lunch was delicious! Curry is so good; Mamiya's is so good!
423.44: Its 14:00. Now that we're done with lunch, we should get right to work. Its important that we all learn to work together for both practice and actual combat. That's important not just for combat, but life as well.
423.45: Its 15:0...Ah, Isuzu, what's up? Yeah, I've had no problems. What's this? Sugar Candy? Thanks, I'll take it.
423.46: Its 16:00. Hmm, Isuzu? Yeah, I know her well. She's been helping me get used to the base and teaching me alot. She's been a big help.
423.47: Its 17:00. Sunset. It's almost night. When night comes, my long 10cm cannon starts to act up...my heart as well..
423.48: Its 18:00. Admiral, its nighttime...now. Yeah, don't worry, I'm fine.
423.49: It's 19:00. By the way, What should we do about dinner? Should I cook more boiled barley and rice? I have some a few canned goods as well, so let's...eat together..
423.50: Its 20:00. Admiral, It's...not fair that you're so good at cooking! This food tastes so good...what kind of meat is this? Huh?..Cutlet?!! I didn't even know such a food existed!
423.51: It's 21:00. Okay, meal time's done. Admiral, thanks; I really appreciate it. I'll take care of washing the plates. I want...to at least do that for you.
423.52: It's 22:00. Ah, Zuikaku. Its fine, no problems so far. Admiral's...well, he agrees. I'm fine. Don't worry about me.
423.53: Its 23:00. I'm a bit tired tonight. Admiral. rest well. Let's work hard tomorrow as well. Good night.

Please remember Haruna who, of all four fast battleship sisters, was able to fight 'til the bitter end, okay?.

79.27: I can feel how powerful this is. Thank you so much for thinking of me.

It seems that the technology used in the Japanese carrier, Akagi, was also referenced in my construction. A Japanese fleet, huh. I'm looking forward to it.

443.47: Admiraaal! 17...00! Strongest Battleships... Strongest Battleships... Ah, I know! Warspite! That ship was powerful. I kinda remember it.
