443.49: Nom nom... Admiral! 19...00! Tonight is also at Mammiya's...Nom nom... I'm so happy! Nom Nom... Let's eat at Mammiya's tomorrow or even after!
443.50: Admiraaal! 2000! It's already nighttime. So daaark! Night battle? I wonder... You Japanese really love night battles.
443.51: Admiraaaal! 2100~ I felt a bit sleepy~ You don't feel sleepy, Admiral? Really? How matured...
443.52: 2200~ Admiral! Big trouble! The Japanese light cruisers are making a ruckus. It's kinda loud! Why is that? Oh, let them be? Really?
443.53: Admiraaal! 2300~! Today was a good day~ Let's do our best for tomorrow, too!
443.Anniversary 6547: I'm going to celebrate our third anniversary. Congratulations, Admiral! Hehehe~
443.Rainy 6547: Rain! Rain, rain, rain! Isn't this "Tsuuyou" season nothing but rain? So it's that kind of a season.
443.Summer 6547: So this is summer in Japan. It's so hot, of course. However, I love this ramune♪ I love this shaved ice♪ Ah, Libe will have strawberry ice! Strawberry!
443.6547: That sound I hear... what's making it? An autumn bug? Ah! So it's called a bell cricket. It sounds nice, huh? Eh? Bell crickets eat watermelon? Really?

445.1: I'm Seaplane Tender Akitsushima! Make sure to remember me along with this Taitei-chan, alright!
445.25: I'm the Seaplane Tender Akitsushima! That's right, I'm a Flying Boat Tender constructed for the sake of assisting Large-sized Flying Boat and refueling at sea, among other things! Eh? Is my "makeup" too heavy? You're rude, maybe! I'm not letting you have Type 2 Taitei-chan, kay!
445.3: This Type 2 Taitei-chan? I'm not letting you have her.
445.4: Heeey! Admiral, I hope you will not touch places that had nothing to do with you so much, maybe! Taitei-chan can't sleep like this, right!
445.29: This camouflage is flashy isn't it? Nah, that's not true, don't you agree, Taitei-chan? Don't you think so? Taitei-chan thinks so too, don't you? Ah, Admiral, is it time for our next mission?
445.28: Admiral, why are you so lost in thought? Ah, are you tired? Times like these, the Akitsushima-style shoulder massage technique will be... Ufufu, hey, feels good doesn't it?
445.24: Admiral, you called me here? I'm not giving you Taitei-chan if it's about her. Eh, that's not it? Ugh...this is... wow... it's beautiful... amaaazing... so, why are giving it to me?
445.8: You wanna see the report? That's important, maybe. Here, help yourself.
445.13: Flying Boat Tender Akitsushima, setting sail, maybe! Wait that's not it, setting sail!
445.9: Whoa, such good equipment! I'm happy, I think!
445.10: Admiral, you can't separate Type 2 Taitei-chan from me, maybe! I'm telling you!
445.27: Supply, this helps, I think... Ehehe
445.11: Uuu... my defenses might be on the low side, I think... I'll have a bath, maybe...
445.12: They got me good, I think-.. I'm not meant for the front line, maybe. Logistics might be perfect for me I think..
445.5: Somebody said a new ship girl has come! Who is she? Who is she?
445.7: Operation complete! The fleet has returned I think!
445.14: Now's the time, Akitsushima-style combat navigation technique, maybe I'll do it in a real battle!
445.15: Enemy fleet, sighted, I think! All fleet, prepare for battle!
445.16: Attack power, I might be low on that, I think...
445.18: N-Night battle!? Me? W-well, I guess I have no choice but to go, I think...
445.17: Do you say I wear heavy makeup? It's so rude!
445.23: E-Eh! I'm number one!? Is such a thing even possible... Eh...
445.20: My camouflage pattern, might not have been very useful I think...
445.21: T-..They got me good, I think. That's why I told you offense is not one of my fortes...
445.22: I see, I'm sinking... Taitei-chan, bye, bye. I'm sure the future will be...
445.30: Admiral, the date might have changed! Today I, Akitsushima will be your secretary, maybe. Ok?
445.31: 0100. Is it fine like this? It might be fine? Okay!
445.32: 0200. Maybe I've a knack for this. Aren't I the perfect secretary?
445.33: 03...0...0. But I might be a bit drowsy. It's this late, after all.
445.34: 04...00... Eh, I'm ok. I'm perfectly awake... maybe...
445.35: Oh no! I'm awake! 0500! It might already be morning! I need to get it together!
445.36: 0600. Admiral, what would be good for breakfast? You know, I'm unexpectedly good at cooking!
445.37: 0700. Admiral, have some breakfast, maybe! Look, this miso soup for example... isn't it good? There's also some dried fish!
445.38: 0800. Alright, once we're done with cleaning up, we should hurry and put the flying boat to use! We might have a long-distance recon expedition!?
445.39: 0900. Taitei-chan? Heh, cute right? But no matter how much you praise her, I won't give her to you.
445.40: 1000. Admiral, what will you do next? Maybe check as many missions as you can?
445.41: 1100. Alright, we have to prepare for lunch. If it's lunch, then it should be curry after all, maybe. Is curry fine with you?
445.42: 1200. Tadaa! It's Akitsushima's deluxe curry! It's definitely good, maybe! Try some, try some!
445.43: 1300. How was it? Akitsushima's curry. I have an unexpectedly large food warehouse. Ehehe.
445.44: 1400. As expected, this camouflage might be strange? Really? I rather like it though...
445.45: 1500. Admiral, are you maybe getting hungry? I made some food like Inari-zushi but, will you maybe take some?
445.46: 1600. It might be sunset soon for today as well. Ahh, I might be tired.
445.47: 1700. It might be dusk. Taitei-chan, too, good work today. Afuun.
445.48: 1800. Alright, I shall prepare for dinner, maybe. Admiral, is there something you'd like to eat?
445.49: 1900. Here, tonight I've tried to make my deluxe cabbage roll, maybe. The plentiful potatos and onions are the main point of the flavor!
445.50: 2000. Admiral, how was the cabbage roll? It tasted a bit like a croquette and was delicious, right? Yep, yep. Thank goodness, maybe!
445.51: 2100. Alright! It'll be the end of the day once I've done the dishes. I might be tired!
445.52: 2200. Oh, somehow it's noisy from the direction of the torpedo squadron even though it's nighttime, maybe. Eh? It can't be helped? I see, so that's how it is.
445.53: 2300. Admiral, thanks for your hard work today, maybe. Let's do our best tomorrow too.
445.Anniversary 6547: Admiral! It's the third anniversary kamodesu, third anniversary. Alright, I will make a really, really big cabbage roll to celebrate this happy occasion!
445.Rainy 6547: Admiral, the rainy season is a bit unpleasant, isn't it? It might be troublesome for Taitei-chan, too.... I wonder if I should make a teru teru bozu.
445.EarlySummer 6547: Hey! I think it's almost summer! I just have to swim with Taitei-chan! You're coming too, right, Admiral? I think I'll look forward to it!
445.Summer 6547: Yay! I think summer has arrived! Admiral, come on, come on, hurry up and change into your swimsuit. Let's go swimming! I'll even let you hold on to Taitei-chan, just this once~♪
445.6547: Fall, huh...? I don't think I really like the fall. I mean, the sky is kind of ominous. Right, Taitei-chan?

446.1: The second ship of the Vittorio Veneto-class battleships, Littorio. I have confidence in my speed and firepower. Nice to meet ya ~
446.25: I was born in the country of Pasta. Second ship of the Vittorio Veneto class battleship, Littorio. Armed with high speed armaments and a state-of-the-art fast battleship. I have my sister, Roma, with me. It's a pleasure to meet you.
446.3: Admiral, did you call for Littorio?
446.4: Th-this is the Japanese way of greeting! S-such a Mediterranean Sea way! Wait, Admiral! I'm mad!
446.29: Fritz... Fritz X... Uhm...? Somehow, this strange word keep bursting up in my mind... Admiral, do you know about this? Oh, really...?
446.28: Admiral, I made some delicious Mediterranean pasta. Would you like to join me? There's also wine as well, ufufu ♪
446.24: Admiral, What's with this formality? Well, is this for me? Really? Oh, thank you very much, Admiral... I'll take care... I'll take good care of this.
446.8: Admiral, time to confirm the report. I'll bring it to you.
446.13: I will show you the true power of Italy! Battleship Littorio, going!
446.10: With this, I won't lose to Roma! Ufufu.
446.26: Ara. I think this is good.
446.11: I'm sorry. I've sustained some damage. I'll go to the dock.
446.12: I'm truly sorry. I need the dock for real this time. I'm sorry.
446.5: Admiral, a new ship is ready to be added to the battle line.
446.7: The fleet have returned safely. Good work everyone!
446.14: Roma? I'm gonna leave you behind. Battleship Littorio, going!
446.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Prepare to fire! At last, it's a real fight.
446.16: Turret number one, number two, aiming...Fire, now!
446.18: It's a night battle. Let's do it. Please follow Littorio
446.17: This is the same fleet battle we're into... That's right, this is...
446.23: Eh? Littorio is number one? Wah, thank you. I feel embarrassed.
446.21: Uuu... I'm fairly beaten... But Littorio... won't sink... with just this...
446.22: I'm... going to sink right...? Roma... this time... you can take it easy to come here... good... night...
446.30: Admiral, the date has changed. Today, I will be announcing the time with you. Ufufu.
446.31: 1:00... AM. Are you tired, Admiral? Shall I bring you some wine?
446.32: 2:00... AM. The night here is a bit colder. Are you okay, Admiral?
446.33: 3:00... AM. *fuah* Ah, I'm sorry. Shall I make something like mulled wine, Admiral? It will warm you up.
446.34: 4:00 AM. Morning is coming. This feeling before dawn... is nice...
446.35: 5:00 AM. Buon giorno, Admiral! I'm about to wake the others!
446.36: 6:00 AM. Yup, it's a wonderful morning. What do you want for breakfast?
446.37: 7:00... AM. Admiral, today I have prepared croissant with caffe latte. Please dig in.
446.38: 8:00... AM. Admiral, it's about time for the fleet's operation. Shall we start with some expeditions?
446.39: 9:00 AM. Fu~ I wonder, is Roma doing fine?
446.40: 10:00 AM. Ah! Those German shipgirls are also here? Really...
446.41: 11:00 AM. It's about time for lunch, Admiral. What shall we have?
446.42: 12:00 PM. For today's primo piatto we have seafood pasta. For secondo we have meat. Contorno is important too. As for wine... is red wine ok?
446.43: 13:00... PM. Eh... That's too much for lunch? I'm sorry. I'll reduce the amount of food in our dinner.
446.44: 14:00 PM. Well, let us give our best this afternoon! Which area shall our fleet advance? Western?
446.45: 15:00... PM. The Japanese's fast battleship is not bad. They're wonderful.
446.46: 16:00... PM. That battleship... has such an artistic superstructure... Her bridge is a work of art.
446.47: 17:00... PM. Admiral, the sunset in Japan is beautiful. It's the same in Mediterranean Sea too.
446.48: 18:00... PM. Well, it's about time to prepare for dinner. Which wine shall we have? White wine or red wine? Shall we go with white wine then?
446.49: 19:00 PM. I've brought you dinner, please dig in! Also here's your wine. Whoa! What a wonderful way of drinking
446.50: 20:00 PM. Admiral, I shall open the red wine next. Uhm... which one should I open... Ah! Do you like cheese? Or dolce?
446.51: 21:00 PM. Admiral, you're good. I'm happy to be worthy of making all those food you have eaten.
446.52: 22:00... PM. I'm a little worried about Roma... I'm sorry Admiral. I will check on her.
446.53: 23:00 PM. Don't worry, Roma is doing fine. Am I worrying too much? I'm sorry.

447.1: I'm the fourth battleship of the Vittorio Veneto-class, Roma. Nice to meet you. What? Please don't stare at me, okay?
447.25: The Italian-made, state of the art warship. Fourth of the Vittorio Veneto class battleships, Roma. Yes, I was together with my elder sister at that time. The day those monsters were dropped. I won't forget that pain. I absolutely won't forget it.
447.3: Admiral, do you have an order for Roma? Oh, then that's fine.
447.4: What's that Admiral?　The way you touch the left area around my deck is unforgivable. Can I give you the counterattack?
447.29: Damn that bomber... you better remember this! Ah, Admiral? What? I didn't say anything. None at all. Aren't you just hearing things? Come on, work first work first.
447.28: What, Admiral? You seem free. How about becoming my partner then? Ah, of course that's not what I meant. We're just talking a walk over there, a walk. Let's go.
447.24: What? Even though I look like this, I'm actually busy. What's that box? 'Try to open it'? I'll do it later then. Wha? In this place? But now is...
447.8: Confirming the information? Well that's important.
447.13: Battleship, Roma, sortieing! Nee-san, I'll be fine, don't worry.
447.9: Japanese improvement... Well that's good too, thanks.
447.10: Grazie. With this... maybe I will become better with this.
447.27: Grazie. I'm gonna go again, you can count on me.
447.11: I'm going to need a little repair. What? Don't stare at me.
447.12: Um, for me to be at the dock... well that's fine... Tsk, I already said to not stare at me!
447.5: Admiral, looks like a new ship is ready to join the battle line.
447.7: The fleet has returned. What is it? Please, don't stare at me too much.
447.14: Roma of the Vittorio Veneto-class, starting! I'm serious, follow me!
447.15: Enemy fleet sighted! Commencing artillery fire. I'll destroy you with all my might... Open all the gunports!
447.16: Battleship, Roma, commencing artillery fire. Main artillery, fire!
447.18: I've grown used to night battles now... Follow after me! All ships, charge forward!
447.17: Triple cannons are not toys. Alright? I'll show you what's what!
447.23: Ah!? It's me... Uhm... Is it me again? Well, whatever. I do feel happy though.
447.19: Tsk... that hurt. But it's nothing compared to what I've been through...!
447.20: Iya... t-that place is... damn, I'll show you this time!
447.21: Direct hit!? Am I done for? W-Well, I'm still fine. I won't sink this time!
447.22: Wa...N-no way... I'm sinking, again? That's ridiculous... No... Nee-san...
447.30: The date has changed, Admiral. I, Roma, will be your secretary of the day. What? Do you object?
447.31: 01...0...0... I'm still not used to this style yet. I did it correctly, right? Right?
447.32: 02...0...0... Zero-Two... Zero... Zero... Yes, perfect. I got it down.
447.33: 03...0...0... It's already three o'clock... Are you not getting sleepy, Admiral?
447.34: 04...0...0... Isn't it already morning? As expected, keeping at it everyday seems bad for the skin.
447.35: 05...0...0... I'm going to wake everyone up, okay? Admiral... you are sleepy now?
447.36: 06...0...0... Well then, what should we do about breakfast? Is yesterday's bread fine with you?
447.37: 07...0...0... Admiral. You looked sleepy so I made some cappuccino. Do you need another?
447.38: 08...0...0... Well then, let's get to work. Let's send out the fleet. To the West? South?
447.39: 09...0...0... So that's the Japanese Fast Battleship Kirishima? Hmmm...
447.40: 10...0...0... Eh, with Kirishima? I see. I do feel like trying to go up against her at least once as well.
447.41: 11...0...0... It's already noon... Time flies. What do you want to do for lunch? Mamiya's, perhaps?
447.42: 12...0...0... Japanese lunch is pretty simple, isn't it? I wonder if it can last till nighttime.
447.43: 13...0...0... That dish called katsu curry surprise me a little. Is it a type of risotto? Unique, isn't it? It's powerful.
447.44: 14...0...0... Bismarck? Yes, I do know her, albeit only the name. She's famous, you know.
447.45: 15...0...0... Ah, Kirishima? What is it? Did you need me for something? Ah, my glasses?
447.46: 16...0...0... I got a little nervous. Kirishima... doesn't seem like a bad person, right?
447.47: 17...0...0... The sun is setting. I'm worn out today too. How about you, Admiral? Is that so?
447.48: 18...0...0... Admiral, what do you want to do for dinner? Eh, Kongou? Kirishima? What's happening?!
447.49: 19...0...0... What is the "Fast Battleship Union?" Wha- whaaa—?! Me too? Whaaa?!
447.50: 20...0...0... This white wine known as "Nihonshu"... is good! You drinking, Admiral?
447.51: 21... Phew... They finally went back. Do Japanese battleships not have any sense of shame?
447.52: 22...0...0... Ah, sis. It's fine, I'm doing the job properly. Don't worry.
447.53: 23...0...0... Eh? I reek of alcohol? I... it's the fault of Kirishima and the rest!

448.1: Buon Giorno! I am the first of the Zara-class Heavy Cruiser, Zara! "Tenacity" is my motto. Please to meet you, Admiral!
448.25: I'm the first of the Zara-class heavy cruisers, Zara! I don't mean to brag, but I won't lose to any other heavy cruiser in a gunnery duel! I'm a little worried about my little sister, Pola, but that's neither here nor there... Admiral, I'm going to do my best! Heavy Cruiser Zara will join your fleet!
448.2: That's right, it's me, Zara. At the ready!
448.3: I wonder if Pola is alright... Ah... Yes, I'm ready anytime!
448.4: Even though I said tenacity is my strong point.... this is going too far ! Admiral, I'm going to get angry !
448.29: Eh? Pola? She still carries a bottle of booze? That's sounds typically bad. Admiral, where did you saw her? I need to look for her...
448.28: Admiral, how are you? Good, I'm relieved! Of course, I'm worried about Pola too, but right now it's just us two, right? Hehe... Oh! I didn't mean it in that way, but...
448.24: Admiral, what's the matter? This is... eh? A ring? Admiral, you want to remember me even more? I see... It seems my tenacity hits you as well, is it? Hehe... Grazie, Admiral.
448.8: Intelligence? Yes! I have it with me.
448.13: Zara-class heavy cruiser, Zara, set sail! Away to the fleet, sally go!
448.9: I'm actually a Treaty heavy cruiser... Ah, this is good! Good indeed.
448.10: Torpedo tubes...? No, I don't need it. It's not needed for me. But I don't mind equipping it.
448.11: They got me. Sorry. I'm going to the shower. Just a moment, I'll be done in a moment.
448.12: Sheesh... my clothes and equipment is in shambles! I still lack toughness! But next time I will succeed!
448.5: Admiral, A new ship has been constructed.
448.14: Pola, you okay? No booze for you today. Zara's fleet, moving out! Follow my lead!
448.15: Enemy ships spotted, ready for shelling! Now, let's begin us Zara's battle!
448.16: Main batteries to the enemy ship dead center. Commencing assault! Sink away!
448.18: Night battle... Sounds good. Finally we, the Zaras will show what we're made of. All fleets, follow my lead. We're breaking through!
448.17: Battery number four, I'm counting on you. My tenaciousness is depending on this shot!
448.23: Eh? I'm number one? Grazie! I'll take the prize. Hehe...
448.21: Kya! My plate won't fall off from just that!
448.22: It's cold...water is... I see... Pola, don't drink too much... Okay?... I will...be going...ahead...
448.30: Buona sera! Admiral, I'll be in charge of secretary duties today. Is that okay?
448.31: Um... Zero one... zero zero hours. Like that? That's how? Ufufu, good. Zero zero!
448.32: 02..00 hours. Yes, it's the middle of the night. I hope Pola's not still out drinking... I'm a little worried.
448.33: 0300 hours. Alright, I think I'm getting used to it. Admiral, aren't I doing it perfectly? Ehe~
448.34: 0400 hours. It'll be morning soon. I'm a little tired, but... I'll keep going, Admiral!
448.35: 0500 hours. Alright, it's morning! Admiral, we stayed up all night, didn't we? Now everyone in the fleet is getting up and going through their morning rituals too... yeah!
448.36: 0600 hours. Buon giorno. The morning sun feels good, doesn't it Admiral?
448.37: 0700 hours. Admiral, I made breakfast for you. It's just a simple espresso and a fresh croissant, but please enjoy.
448.38: 0800 hours. Admiral, would you like another espresso? R-really? Okay, I'll bring it right out!
448.39: 0900 hours. Okay, time to start making use of the fleet. First up are the expeditions... oh? You want to do something else? Roger!
448.40: 1000 hours. Which practice exercise did you want? I kind of want to take a crack at those Takaaao-class! Admiral, is that alright? Ehe... roger.
448.41: 1100 hours. Those Takaaao sisters surprised me. I took some hits, but... how do I say it... it wasn't that bad. I'll challenge them again any day!
448.42: 1200 hours. What would you like for lunch? I learned to make a new sort of pasta—would you want to try it? Do you prefer rosso or bianco?
448.43: 1300 hours. How was it? Since it has a strong flavor, it's best to drink some wine first. Oh! But don't drink too much.
448.44: 14—Ah, Ciao, Libe! How are you? That's good to hear. I made a lot of new friends. Eh? I'll introduce you next time!
448.45: 1500 hours. Oh, RADAR? Um, I think I might need it. They call it "dentaaan" here, right?
448.46: 160—Ah, Roma and Littorio! Ciao! Oh... yes, I'm still getting used to it. I'm sure there's a lot you both could teach me.
448.47: 1700 hours. Admiral, what do you want to do for dinner? You want to go to "Mamiiiya"? Mamiiiya! Is that some sort of bar?
448.48: 1800 hours. So this is Mamiiiya's Bar... wah, something smells really good. Oh, my order... I'll have what the admiral is having.
448.49: 1900 hours. Admiral, is thish what Japanesh food tastesh like? Making the bestsh use of raw ingredients. I should... mmm... mph!
448.50: 2000 hours. This is also tasty... wait, who's that! Po... Pola!? She's here.. it can't be! Admiral, excuse me! Wait up!
448.51: *pant* 21... *pant* 00... hours. I'm so sorry, Admiral. It turned out to be nothing. Nothing... at all...
448.52: 2200 hours. Admiral, you worked hard today. Is it alright if I turn in early? I'm just a little... tired.
448.53: 2300 hours. You've had a long day, Admiral, so don't work too late. Buona notte!
448.Rainy 6547: "Tsuuyou" is what you call this time of year, right? With such a variety of names based on the season, Japan sure is an interesting place. No, I don't mind it at all.
448.Summer 6547: Swimsuit? No, I didn't bring one, but maybe I can buy one? Hmmmm.
448.6547: I like autumn. After all, this is the time of year when I was commissioned. I like how it makes me feel a little at ease. Right, Pola? Wha... you're off drinking! I said you can't!

89.1: Aircraft carrier, Houshou here. Although I'm inexperienced, I look forward to your guidance.
89.25: I am the aircraft carrier known as Houshou. I was designed as a carrier from the beginning and I am the world's first aircraft carrier. I may be petite for a ship, but I'll do my best.
89.4: You must be tired. Shall I prepare the bath? Or perhaps dinner? Or perhaps... fufu! Just kidding.
89.28: Admiral, thanks as always for the hard work. When you can, please be sure to relax a little.
89.24: Someday... someday, just the two of us... I would like to enjoy a nice, relaxing cruise with you, okay?
89.8: Admiral, a message for you has arrived.
89.13: Live combat...? I suppose it can't be helped.
89.9: I'm so sorry. For you to be reinforcing my armament is...
89.10: Isn't this... a little too much for me?
89.27: I'm so sorry. For you to be reinforcing my armament is...
89.11: In that case, I'll have a little rest.
89.12: I shouldn't have acted so recklessly.
89.5: It looks like new children are on the way!
89.7: Thanks for the hard work. The fleet has made its return.
89.15: Wind direction... check! Air force, take off!
89.16: This is... not an exercise. It's live combat!
89.18: When you do something... you do it well!
89.17: We can't just keep doing exercises forever!
89.23: That's... is that true? To have been of some help to you... that's wonderful!
89.21: I have no intention of sinking like this...!
89.22: Even I... can sink, it seems...
89.Rainy 6547: It's raining again. It's troubling that it might rain and ruin the food. There's also the laundry to take care of. What should I do...?
89.Summer 6547: That's true... to help the ship girls and the admiral at the beach, we can open a seaside teahouse. Mamiya-san? Irako-san?
89.6547: It's been a little cooler recently. It must be autumn.

450.1: I'm Seaplane Tender Akitsushima! Have you already remembered Taitei-chan and I?
450.25: I'm the Seaplane Tender Akitsushima! That's right, I'm a Flying Boat Tender constructed for the sake of assisting Large-sized Flying Boat and refueling at sea, among other things! Eh? Is my "makeup" too heavy? You're rude, maybe! I'm not letting you have Type 2 Taitei-chan, kay!
450.3: This Type 2 Taitei-chan? Like I said, I won't let you have her.
450.4: Admiral~ I hope you will not touch such strange places so much, maybe! How long will Taitei-chan have to wait to go to sleep?
450.29: This camouflage is flashy isn't it? Nah, that's not true, don't you agree, Taitei-chan? Don't you think so? Taitei-chan thinks so too, don't you? Ah, Admiral, is it time for our next mission?
450.28: Admiral, why are you so lost in thought? Ah, are you tired? Times like these, the Akitsushima-style shoulder massage technique will be... Ufufu, hey, feels good doesn't it?
450.24: Admiral, you called me here? I'm not giving you Taitei-chan if it's about her. Eh, that's not it? Ugh...this is... wow... it's beautiful... amaaazing... so, why are giving it to me?
450.8: You wanna see the report? That's important, maybe. Here, help yourself.
450.13: Flying Boat Tender Akitsushima, setting sail, maybe! Wait that's not it, setting sail!
450.9: Aaa they even have those equipments . I'm happy
450.10: Admiral, you can't separate Type 2 Taitei-chan from me, maybe! I'm telling you!
450.27: Supply, this helps, I think... Ehehe
450.11: Uuu... my defenses might be on the low side, I think... I'll have a bath, maybe...
450.12: They got me good, I think-.. I'm not meant for the front line, maybe. Logistics might be perfect for me I think..
450.5: Somebody said a new ship girl has come! Who is she? Who is she?
450.7: Operation complete! The fleet has returned I think!
450.14: Now's the time, Akitsushima-style combat navigation technique, maybe I'll do it in a real battle!
450.15: Enemy fleet, sighted, I think! All fleet, prepare for battle!
450.16: I was renovated but... attack power, I don't have any
450.18: N-Night battle!? Me? W-well, I guess I have no choice but to go, I think...
450.17: You still say my makeup is heavy? It's really rude!
450.23: E-Eh! I'm number one!? Is such a thing even possible... Eh...
450.20: My camouflage pattern, might not have been very useful I think...
450.21: T-..They got me good, I think. That's why I told you offense is not one of my fortes...
450.22: I see, I'm sinking... Taitei-chan, bye, bye. I'm sure the future will be...
450.30: Admiral, the date might have changed! Today I, Akitsushima will be your secretary, maybe. Ok?
450.31: 0100. Is it fine like this? It might be fine? Okay!
450.32: 0200. Maybe I've a knack for this. Aren't I the perfect secretary?
450.33: 03...0...0. But I might be a bit drowsy. It's this late, after all.
450.34: 04...00... Eh, I'm ok. I'm perfectly awake... maybe...
450.35: Oh no! I'm awake! 0500! It might already be morning! I need to get it together!
450.36: 0600. Admiral, what would be good for breakfast? You know, I'm unexpectedly good at cooking!
450.37: 0700. Admiral, have some breakfast, maybe! Look, this miso soup for example... isn't it good? There's also some dried fish!
450.38: 0800. Alright, once we're done with cleaning up, we should hurry and put the flying boat to use! We might have a long-distance recon expedition!?
450.39: 0900. Taitei-chan? Heh, cute right? But no matter how much you praise her, I won't give her to you.
450.40: 1000. Admiral, what will you do next? Maybe check as many missions as you can?
450.41: 1100. Alright, we have to prepare for lunch. If it's lunch, then it should be curry after all, maybe. Is curry fine with you?
450.42: 1200. Tadaa! It's Akitsushima's deluxe curry! It's definitely good, maybe! Try some, try some!
450.43: 1300. How was it? Akitsushima's curry. I have an unexpectedly large food warehouse. Ehehe.
450.44: 1400. As expected, this camouflage might be strange? Really? I rather like it though...
450.45: 1500. Admiral, are you maybe getting hungry? I made some food like Inari-zushi but, will you maybe take some?
450.46: 1600. It might be sunset soon for today as well. Ahh, I might be tired.
450.47: 1700. It might be dusk. Taitei-chan, too, good work today. Afuun.
450.48: 1800. Alright, I shall prepare for dinner, maybe. Admiral, is there something you'd like to eat?
450.49: 1900. Here, tonight I've tried to make my deluxe cabbage roll, maybe. The plentiful potatos and onions are the main point of the flavor!
450.50: 2000. Admiral, how was the cabbage roll? It tasted a bit like a croquette and was delicious, right? Yep, yep. Thank goodness, maybe!
450.51: 2100. Alright! It'll be the end of the day once I've done the dishes. I might be tired!
450.52: 2200. Oh, somehow it's noisy from the direction of the torpedo squadron even though it's nighttime, maybe. Eh? It can't be helped? I see, so that's how it is.
450.53: 2300. Admiral, thanks for your hard work today, maybe. Let's do our best tomorrow too.

451.1: Admiral, thank you for your hard work. Seaplane Tender Mizuho has now arrived. It is a pleasure to meet you.
451.25: I am a seaplane tender, Mizuho. Together with Chitose and Chiyoda, I am capable of utilizing the Kouhyouteki midget submarine. Although I was not bestowed with the latest model engine, I manage to participate at the start of the Southern Operations. I shall do my best to meet your expectations.
451.2: Did you call me? I'm so happy for it.
451.3: Hehehe... What's the matter, Admiral? Did you happen to forget something?
451.4: Admiral, I am happy that you take good care of me. Don't worry, I am ready for sortie anytime.
451.29: How strange, I was supposed to have a new model engine, but why... Ah, Admiral!? It's nothing. I am okay.
451.28: Admiral, Are you tired? Goodness gracious, I shall make something tasty for you. Let's see... What would be nice...?
451.24: Admiral, did you summon me? Did I make a huge mistake? Eh...? You're giving me this box? May I open it? Eh... I... I... I'm so happy...
451.8: You want to look at the intel? A moment, please. I'll sort it out for you.
451.13: Seaplane Tender Mizuho, Ready! Forgive me if I'm a bit slow.
451.9: Should I take the seaplanes or Kouhyouteki? I'm at a loss...
451.10: I never saw this armament before. Is this a new weapon? Thank you very much.
451.27: Admiral, I am grateful for this.
451.11: I am slightly covered with soot. My apologies. I shall lay down for a while.
451.12: My apologies for being in this state... I shall take a bath now. I'm sorry.
451.5: Admiral, The construction of a new ship has completed.
451.7: Admiral, the fleet has returned. What a relief for everyone to return to the dock safely.
451.14: Fleet Command Mizuho, Sailing out! Let's go, everyone.
451.15: E-enemy fleet has been spotted!? What should I do? R-ready for battle... is it?
451.16: Mizuho, moving in! Commencing assault. Ready the guns!
451.18: It is now nighttime. I wanted to pursue the enemy, but it ended up in a night battle... What should I do?
451.17: I must... pursue the enemy... Get your bearings, Mizuho!
451.23: Ehh...!? I... I have excelled in battle? Admiral... I... I'm lost for words.
451.19: Hyaah! It... It hurts. Was that a torpedo?
451.20: Nooo! I-I am fine. Don't let me sink, please!
451.21: Hyaaaaaah! For me to be in this state... But I am still able to cruise!
451.22: Am I... Sinking? But, this time I am able to be useful. I... am glad...
451.Anniversary 6547: Admiral, it is the third anniversary. Congratulations. I, too, am happy for it.
451.Rainy 6547: This season feels a bit melancholic, doesn't it? Because of submarines? Maybe so... even now, I still feel a bit conflicted about them...
451.EarlySummer 6547: It's getting hotter and hotter. This year... summer is back for the year... Mizuho thinks summer is too much...
451.Summer 6547: What a strong heat wave this is. Admiral, how are you feeling? So I see. You're so energetic... aren't you?
451.6547: So it's autumn. Admiral, it's the season of delicious food. Shall I make something for you? What would you like?

452.1: As the fourteenth ship of the Yuugumo-class Destroyers, I'm Okinami. Umm... Yes, I'll do my best. Pleased to meet you!
452.25: As the fourteenth ship of the Yuugumo-class Destroyers, I'm Okinami. I was developed as part of the Rapid Naval Armaments Supplement Programme. Yes, my birthplace was in Maizuru. Though by that time, the front line was already heading towards disintegration... But I still did my best escorting the main fleet and convoys.
452.2: U-Umm...Commander? Did you call for Okinami?
452.3: My glasses...glasses... Oh...I...had them on. Well... That's great.
452.4: Commander? Umm...I'm sorry. I can't see very well... Wah... too close... That's too close, Commander!
452.29: Um, Commander? Co... -mmander? Umm... I guess you're busy at the moment. Okinami will then focus on training herself. Right, umm... ummm...
452.28: Commander, um... I'm... very sorry for always causing you trouble. Oh, no, not at all...Because you're a very kind Commander. Because you're very kind and I... Huh?... No... Why am I... crying? I don't...Why?
452.24: Commander, Did you call for Okinami? Did I do something wrong...I...Huh? That's for me?! Wha... I don't... but... I can't... believe it... Ehhhh?!
452.8: Th-The information, Commander? Okinami will...bring it over. Aahh!
452.9: An-, an improvement. Thank you very much.
452.10: This equipment is... With this equipment, I won't lose against even a swarm of fighters as thick as clouds. Probably?
452.27: Commander. From the bottom of my heart, I thank you very much for your kindness.
452.11: Um... I'm very sorry. I have to dock for a little while. I'm sorry...
452.12: Commander, this is very embarrassing but have to take a bath... a long bath... and um...
452.5: Commander. there's a new kanmusu that... Yes, that's correct.
452.15: Enemy fleet spotted! All ship... prepare for gun battle...Please take care of me.
452.18: I can't see very well at night... But, we have no choice! All ships, charging in!
452.17: M-My glasses... Ah, I'm okay. That's wrong. Firing guns, over there! Fire!
452.23: Wha... Ehhhh?! Me? Okinami is number one...? Umm...umm...I, I'm so sorry!
452.21: It, it's okay... My glasses are... safe...
452.22: This... is what feels like... to sink into the ocean...? Oh... You... can't see anything... anymore...
452.Rainy 6547: It's been raining a lot. However, I find the rainy season to be quite fun. I love it.
452.Summer 6547: It's getting hotter, Commander. Eh? A swimsuit? Ah... I don't think... eh? Really... are you sure?
452.Summer 1471: Since you strongly recommended it, I... um, bought a swimsuit. How is it? U-Um, p-please don't stare so intently.
452.6547: So it's autumn? It's the season for reading. I really love this time of year! Admiral, what are you reading right now? Is that a photograph collection?

453.1: Third ship of the Yuugumo class destroyers, Kazagumo. So you're the admiral. Roger. Well then, your orders!
453.25: Fleet type destroyer, Yuugumo class, Kazagumo. Regards. From Midway to Solomon, I advanced around the main battlefields. On that fateful night, I looked upon the burning aircraft carrier. I'll never forget the dragon's last moments.
453.3: I'm Kazagumo. Not "Fuu'un". Understand? Then, it's fine.
453.4: What is it, Admiral? I don't need extra outfitting. Eh, that's not it? Eh?
453.29: Hey? What is my next mission...? Huh, even though you're that busy... Admiral, I... Ahh... It is okay? Take it easy once in a while? Okay...
453.28: What is it? Get it together. If you're not well, I won't be able to do my best either.
453.24: What? Calling me to a place like this, Admiral, do you have a new task or something? Eh...! The new task is... meaning, this... put it on... eh...! Me?
453.13: Yuugumo-class destroyer, Kazagumo, setting out. Ok? Fleet, sortie!
453.10: What? Torpedoes? It would be nice if they didn't blow up.
453.27: Thanks for the supplies, Admiral. I'll head out again.
453.12: Ahh, geez. I can't fight like this! I'm going to hop in the bath for a bit, so don't peek!
453.5: Admiral, a new ship has come. Yeah!
453.7: Admiral, the fleet has returned. Good work, everyone.
453.14: 10th DesDiv, sortie! This Kazagumo will take the role of the flagship. Advance!
453.15: I found you! Fleet, prepare for battle, let's do this. Okay?
453.16: Aim towards the enemy on the starboard side. Begin firing!
453.18: Night... huh. Hiryuu-san... All ships, sortie! We'll annihilate the enemy in the night battle!
453.17: Not bad, I'm returning it! There!
453.23: Eh, I... this Kazagumo's battle results... Well, it doesn't... feel bad... I guess!
453.20: Mo~u. It hurts! But this won't...!
453.21: Ehh. They got me. No~, don't explode!
453.22: N... Not yet, I'm going to go ahead. I'm... still, going. Still... still...
453.30: I, Kazagumo will be in charge for today's hourly notification duty! ...What's with that face? Are you saying that you have a problem with it!?
453.31: Ah, really? Then it's okay... Admiral! It's now precisely 0100!
453.32: It's 0200. Hmm... And that's that♪ It's not a problem right?
453.33: It's 0300, Admiral. What? Something about my sister? Yuugumo...? What, You like her!?
453.34: Admiral, it's 0400. Not her? Okay then... Eh, is it about my other sister, Makigumo?
453.35: It is 0500. Oh really? It's not her either. Okay then... Then who are you referring to?
453.36: Your story makes no sense that I forgot it's already morning, Admiral. It's 0600.
453.37: It's 0700, Admiral. I'll be making breakfast right away. It's OK, leave it to me. I'm surprisingly... Ow! I-I'm okay!
453.38: Admiral, It's 0800. Sorry for taking it so long, but breakfast is ready. Have some! There's even seconds!
453.39: It's 0900, Admiral. What, my finger? Oh don't worry, it's not so bad! First aid box, you say? Oh for pete's sake, you're over-exaggerating it, Admiral!
453.40: Admiral, it's 1000. It's this late already? Uhh... The sallying fleet and... Ah, the expedition... W-wait...
453.41: It's 1100, Admiral. It's almost noon. What's our plan for lunch? Is it at Mamiya's?
453.42: *Nom nom nom* Admiral, it's 1200. *nom nom* Nothing like a curry at Mamiya's for lunch, eh? It's delicious! *nom nom*
453.43: Admiral It's 1300-hmm? Akigumo? What's up? Model for your rough sketch? No! Go find someone else!
453.44: It's 1400, Admiral. Phew... Akigumo finally leaves. She's quite the pestering one...
453.45: Admiral. It's 1500. Akigumo? Ah, She's not really that bad. Rather she is... No, I mean... a bit of a bother.
453.46: Admiral, It's 16... Ah, Shoukaku, Good work for today! Zuikaku? No, I don't think she went here...
453.47: It's 1700, Admiral. The sunset sure is pretty... Let's go back inside.
453.48: Admiral, 1800. Today's I'll be making dinner... Eh? I'm not doing this out of desperation, I really want to do it. Honest!
453.49: 1900. The admiral ended up making dinner in the end... Down the hatch. Oh, it's delicious! Eh, this one too! But why?
453.50: 2000. So you can cook, Admiral. Very good in fact. Where did you learn it? Eh, during your academy years? I see...
453.51: Admiral, it's 2100. Sendai? No, the new squadron 10 was under Yahagi as flagship. I greeted her the other day. Hehehe.
453.52: It's 2200, Admiral. Today was quite a day. Thanks for that. Me? I'm fine. I actually worked hard as part of the Squadron 10, you know.
453.53: Admiral, it's 2300. Here, have some tea. Eh? I can do something as easy as serving a tea! What do you expect? Geez... Good night!
453.Anniversary 6547: Admiral, it's the third anniversary? Why didn't you tell me earlier? I haven't prepared anything to celebrate it! Geez~!
453.Rainy 6547: I'm not fond of this season. For some reason, it makes me feel gloomy deep inside. I wonder why?
453.Summer 6547: It's getting so hot. I wonder what the rest of DesDiv 10 will do with their swimsuits this year. What should I do?
453.Summer 1471: I bought one. It's a bit embarrassing, but since it's summer, it's okay, right? Ah, Akigumo, what are you drawing?! Let me see! Hey!
453.6547: It's gotten a bit chilly, hasn't it? Fall, huh? Potato. I wanna have a baked sweet potato. Right, Akigumo?

454.1: Yo, I'm the 16th Kagerou-class Destroyer, Arashi!
454.25: I'm the 16th ship in the Kagerou-class Destroyer line. I was part of the Fourth Destroyer Squadron, and was an asset to the Fourth Torpedo Squadron. At Midway, I was assigned as an escort to the Nagumo Carrier Task Force. After that, I also did occasional stints at the frontline as needed......Remember me... and my comrades of the Fourth Destroyer Squadron. Please.
454.2: What do you want? All right, leave things to me!
454.3: Hm? Commander, what's up? You lonely? Ya can't be, haha.
454.4: Hagi, cut that out! I'm ticklish! Oho! ... Oh, oh...? If it isn't the commander!
454.29: Man, how boring is this... my body'll get weak... Commander, just what are ya doin'... Oh? Seems like you're pretty busy, huh. Well, guess I'll just have to wait for a while.
454.28: What's up, Commander? Are you tired or something? Hmm... doesn't seem like it... Well then, shall we rest a while? I'll lend you my lap to use as a pillow. Come on over. It's all right, to take a rest once in a while... you know.
454.24: What's up, Commander? You called for me? You sure you didn't mistake me for Hagi? Ah... are you really ok choosing me? R... really? What's with the formality...it's embarrassing. Eh... to put this on my finger? Ah... Ahaha... It seems a bit a bit inappropriate... but thank you for treating me so warmly!
454.8: Oh, you wanted to see the intel? Important stuff! Here ya go.
454.13: The flagship of the Fourth Destroyer Squadron, Arashi, is sortieing forth! Follow me, everyone!
454.9: Nice, I'm fired up! Thank you!
454.10: Ah. I have to wreck those submarines I underestimated earlier. Some depth charges, please.
454.11: I'll go take a bath. All right?
454.12: These wounds hurt. A bath is what I really wanted. Commander, wanna join me?
454.7: The operation is concluded. The fleet has returned.
454.14: It's time for the Kagerou-class Destroyer, Arashi, to make my appearance! Ahh...the storm is rising, just watch!
454.15: Enemy ships spotted, get ready for the battle. Begin... fire!
454.16: Well the, it's time for me to do it! I'll raise a storm!
454.18: Now, it's time for night battle. Cautiously yet boldly...storming in!
454.17: The mighty Fourth Destroyer Division, coming through! Eat this!
454.23: Hehe~. Was the risen storm branded into your vision? Yeah, it's thanks to the commander and everyone.
454.19: Gahh! Where did that come from!
454.20: Wh, what is it, what is it?! Where's the enemy?!
454.21: Tch! What's with you doing as you please... however... I haven't sunk yet!
454.22: I'm... I'm sinking...? Hagi... until next time... Shigure... after this... I'll leave it to you...
454.30: Aah, Commander, what's up, seems like Arashi'll be your secretary ship for today. Yeah, leave timekeeping to me. It just turned midnight now, yep.
454.31: It's 0100, Commander. Night... the night can put you a bit on edge, huh. Just a little bit... right?
454.32: It just turned 0200, Commander. What's up, you were going through the docs? Reading through 'em must be drag, your eyes'll go bad. Here, use this searchlight...
454.33: It's 0300, Commander. Ah... now's a pretty good time to just chill out.
454.34: It's 0400. There's somethin' about the dead of night that makes me feel feel weird... ah, ya don't think so? That so... Commander, you're pretty cool. You're one of Sendai's buddies, huh.
454.35: 0500! Mornin's a'comin', mornin'! YEAH! It's MORNING! Commander, IT'S MORNING!
454.36: It's 0600! Fleet, reveille! Commander, it's time for some food! Hurry up and get some breakfast ready! ...eh? Me? ME?!
454.37: It's 0700... I was listenin' to how Hagi would do it, but what do we got to eat right now...? Ah, for the time being, we've got some Miso soup and rice, and for later, we've got dried fish!
454.38: 0800. My cooking... how was it? Surprisingly good? Is... is that so, yeah, of course! Don't underestimate Fourth Destroyer Division, heh, heheheheheh, heheh!
454.39: It's 0900, Commander. Alright, Fourth Destroyer Division, round up! So we won't lose in night battle (?), we'll commence special training! First off...
454.40: It's 1000, Commander. The Fourth... (?) Yeah, we're always ready for the frontlines. Just leave it to us!
454.41: It's 1100. ...Oh, seems like the torpedo squadron'll be on sortie. OK, who's the flagship?! Naka-san? No way, Jintsuu-san? Eh... ehh?! SENDAI-SAN?!
454.42: Oh-tweeellve-huundreedd! Hey Commander, it's lunch, so let's get a big helpin' of curry! Ashigara-san'll be at Mamiya's today. Let's go!
454.43: 1300... Yeeah, that was good... the katsu curry was real good! Now that was some good stuff. "So with that, victory!" ...is what I'm thinkin'. Hahaah... I'm stuffed, stuffed!
454.44: Fourteen hundre-... ooh, Nowachi! How ya doin'? Ooh, I'm feelin' great. Commander 'n me make a great pair... ain't that right, Commander? Wait - That's ain't it!
454.45: It's 1500, Commander. Ahh, talk about about the First Carrier Division's final moments? ...It was a horrible thing. Fighting a battle lost. No matter the time... it was just horrible.
454.46: Sixteen-hundre... ah, Shoukaku-san! Welcome back! Yes, I'm doing fine! It'd be great to go out on sortie with you! Yes! I'll be looking forward to it!
454.47: It's 1700, Commander. The sunset sure is beautiful, isn't it... What's this - it's as if I'm being taken aback by it, like I'm gonna be moved to tears. Ah-wh, what...?
454.48: 1800. Commander, how about some dinner? I'll be the one to put it together again? I've been looking at this recipe. Let's see... Fuu, ka, de, pi... hm, fu? Fu... well, now...
454.49: Nineteen-hundre... oh, Kagerou-nee! Eh, you've got some food for us? (sniff sniff) Ah! This smells amazing! Is this really okay? You've saved us! Commander, dinner has arrived!
454.50: 2000. Kagerou-nee brought this soup, "cla-m chowder-" ...is it? (sip) Hm... mm... the rice works surprisingly well here! Delicious! Let's chow down!
454.51: 2100... What's up with this time of day... I've got a bad premonition about it. Hah-, Sendai-san! Eh, ye-, yes! About the night sortie, I'll be sure to attend it...
454.52: 2200. Stay on full alert... eh, Shigure, did you just say something?! Th-the enemy?! Evade! Evade! Regroup for a counterattack! Damn it!!
454.53: 2300. We've returned, I still have my own legs, just in case. Wh, what is it?! I wasn't crying, I'm fine, Commander! What's with you, jeez...
454.Rainy 6547: Gosh... it's still raining. If it keeps on raining, I feel like my body will rust. How are you holding up, Commander?
454.EarlySummer 6547: Woah. Mai, you seem so energetic. Eh? You're going to buy swimsuits with Nowacchi? Hmmmm...
454.Summer 6547: Hagi, what's up? Eh... wear a swimsuit... to the beach? Sure, count me in. Commander, you coming, too?
454.6547: Alriiiight! I made it through the nights in summer! Now I should be fine! Shigure, Sendai-san... I've won!!!!

455.1: Hagikaze, 17th Ship of the Kagerou-class Destroyer, reporting! Commander, please give me your orders!
455.25: I am Hagikaze, the 17th ship of the Kagerou-class Destroyer. I was born in Uraga. I worked diligently as part of the Fourth Destroyer Division with Arashi. Being the escort of the Nagumo Taskforce, I took part in the unforgiving battle in the Solomon Islands. I was with Arashi on my last night to. Please remember us, the Fourth Destroyer Division.
455.3: Commander, if there is anything I can do, please let me know. I will do my best.
455.4: Listen, listen! You know what?! Oh, my! Commander! I’m such an idiot. I’m s-sorry!
455.29: Commander, did you see Arashi? Huh, you haven’t? Come on, what in the world is she up to? I will give her a good talk about this next time.
455.28: Commander? Huh? “Are you fine with the night now?” Yes. I still can’t get myself to like the night, but I am okay now. Commander can you put your hand here please. It calms me.
455.24: Commander? What’s up? Do you have something for the Fourth Destroyer Division? Should I go get Arashi? Huh, that’s not it? Me? This is…?! Th-Thank you! I… will cherish it greatly!
455.8: Commander. Ah, you want to check the situation? Roger that. I will bring you the report.
455.13: Fourth Destroyer Division, Hagikaze! Setting sail!
455.9: This equipment, I'm happy for it.
455.10: I am not that fond of the night.
455.27: Thank you. I am ready to go again.
455.11: Sorry for causing such trouble, Commander. I will take a short leave from the ranks.
455.12: The night… The night is still haunting. When I enter the bath, it just comes back to me.
455.5: Construction of a new ship has been completed. Wonderful!
455.7: The fleet is returning. Welcome back, everyone!
455.14: Ready, everyone? Fleet, Flagship Hagikaze, leaving port!
455.15: Enemies… Where are the enemies? F-Found them! Enemy vessel sighted! Fleet, ready torpedoes and guns portside!
455.18: The night… The night sea is scary! But for now, I must go! All ships, forward!
455.17: Open fire! Hagikaze, engaging the enemy!
455.23: Huh? Me? Hagikaze is… the MVP? That’s all thanks to everyone from the Fourth. Thanks, everyone.
455.20: What?! N-no! Can I keep going?
455.21: Hyaaa! D-did the rudder get hit?! Can it be fixed? Please!
455.22: With this wound… there is no hope of returning… Arashi?! I... will be leaving you here. Good… bye.
455.Rainy 6547: I... really love it... the color of the Hydrangea flowers. Even though they're so pretty, I've heard that Hydrangeas have poison in them. How intriguing, isn't it, Commander? Commander?
455.EarlySummer 6547: Maikaze, you're going to buy a swimsuit? With Nowaki? I should go with Arashi... On second thought, she probably has no interest...
455.Summer 6547: Arashi, you're not coming to the beach along with the Commander? It's summer, so why not wear a swimsuit? Ehhhh... not interested?!
455.6547: Summer passed in the blink of an eye and it's already fall! Commander, I'm currently studying up on healthy autumn cuisine.

458.1: I am Umikaze, the Seventh of the Shiratsuyu-class Destroyer, and the First of the Revised Shiratsuyu-class. I'll be in your care, Admiral!
458.25: I am Umikaze, the Seventh of the Shiratsuyu Class Destroyer, and the First of the Revised Shiratsuyu Class. I was built according to the second Naval Armaments Supplement Program. I participated in the Battle of Guadalcanal, as part of the Second Torpedo Squadron. I will be in your care, Admiral.
458.3: Kawakaze? Well, what is it? Whoa!? Admiral!? Please, excuse me! Huh? Uhm....
458.4: Ah, the Bridge? Yes, as for the Umikaze-class... Ah, I'm sorry. It's Revised Shiratsuyu-class.
458.29: Admiral? Admi...ral? He seems busy. Maybe I should go see how Kawakaze is doing? But there is no way to know when he will need me...
458.28: Admiral, are you not tired? Really? Are you okay? Your health is important. Please do not push yourself too hard. Ah, Umikaze will make some tea.
458.24: Did you call for Umikaze, Admiral? You plan to summon the Revised Shiratsuyu-class and.. Ah, that's not it? This is... Really? Wow, I'm so happy!
458.8: The information, Admiral? Yes, Umikaze will bring it for you.
458.13: First of the Upgraded Shiratsuyu-class, Umikaze, setting sail!
458.9: Thank you very much, Admiral. I'm happy to become stronger.
458.10: Uh... Uhm. If it is okay, I would be happy if the same can be done for Kawakaze.
458.27: Ah, thank you for the resupply. It helps.
458.11: I'm sorry. I'll be in the dock for a bit.
458.12: I'm sorry... I'll take your word and let my wounds heal thoroughly.
458.5: It seems that a new ship girl has arrived.
458.7: Fleet has returned safely to port. Thank you for the hard work! Phew...
458.14: 24th Destroyer Division, leaving port! Everyone, follow me please!
458.16: It is just like the Solomons... I will fight this time!
458.18: We will clear the remaining enemy through night battle! All fleet charge! Everyone, follow me please!
458.23: Umikaze is the top? Th-thank you! It's a bit embarrassing...
458.19: No! I'm hit? Wh-what is it?
458.20: Kyaa! What is it? Torpedo? Enemy ship?!
458.21: I was hit heavily. This place is... dangerous.
458.22: It seems like Umikaze... ends here... Kawakaze... you... take your time... okay?
458.30: Admiral, Umikaze will be by your side to alert you of the time today. Ah, I'll brew some more tea.
458.31: Admiral, it is 0100. Fleet in the night is... quiet as well.
458.32: Admiral, it is 0200. Do you feel a little sleepy? Then I will make a strong tea.
458.33: Admiral, it is 0300. Should I make black tea sometimes? Ah, no. I guess green tea is the best. Here it is.
458.34: Admiral, it is 0400. It's almost morning... Admiral, do you want to take a short nap? It's alright because Umikaze will be awake.
458.35: Admiral, it is 0500. It is... morning. Mmmpph, it is a nice morning. Let's strive today as well.
458.36: Admiral, it is 0600. I'll make the wake-up call to the fleet. All fleet, wake up! Good morning!
458.37: Admiral, it is 0700. I've prepared your breakfast as well. Today's fish is split mackerel. I'll get the tea now.
458.38: Admiral, it is 0800. After I'm done with the laundry, I'll get to checking the fleet composition and expedition. I'm sorry, please wait.
458.39: Admiral, it is 0900. I have finished checking today's fleet composition and expeditions. What will you do about the morning's sortie?
458.40: Admiral, it is 1000. Will you send the fleet to the South? Oh, should we prioritize the supply transport mission?
458.41: Admiral, it is 1100. My sisters? Yes, they are my pride. I wonder if Kawakaze is doing well? Ehehe.
458.42: Admiral, it is 1200. Leave the lunch to Umikaze as well. How about curry? Ah, curry udon sounds good too.
458.43: Admiral, it is 1300. Ah, didn't some curry get flung out? Are you okay? Curry stains are hard to get off, right?..... Ah , it's okay. Good.
458.44: Admiral, it is 1400. Ah, Jintsuu-san, you must be busy. Ah, right. 24th Destroyer Division is doing well. It's okay.
458.45: Admiral, it is 1500. Being part of the Second Torpedo Squadron is a great pride, but it makes me nervous. Yes...
458.46: Admiral, it is 160... Suzukaze! It must be tiring. You are full of energy. Ehehe, keep it up!
458.47: Admiral, it is 1700. Ah... What is it Michishio? Eh? Asashio ? I haven't seen her... are you searching for her?
458.48: Admiral, it is 1800. Umikaze will start preparing the dinner. I wonder what would be good tonight?
458.49: Admiral, it is 1900. Your evening meal is ready. Tonight's menu is chicken rice. How is it? Is it good?
458.50: Admiral, it's 2000. Hm, Kawakaze? You're sortieing with Sendai for a night battle? Ah... be careful! Do your best!
458.51: Admiral, it's 2100. Ah... I'm a bit worried about Kawakaze. If anything really happened...
458.52: Admiral, it's 2200. Kawakaze made it back to the port safely, thank goodness. Thank you for your hard work too, Sendai-san!
458.53: Admiral, it is 2300. It has been a hard day of work today. Let's keep our diligence tomorrow too.
458.Rainy 6547: It rains pretty often at this time of year, doesn't it? But it's quiet... it's nice. I... like the rainy days, too.
458.EarlySummer 6547: It's getting hotter. Admiral, it's going to be summer soon. What should I do for this year's swimsuit? Should I buy a new one?
458.Summer 6547: Admiral, it's summer. The sunlight is really strong, isn't it? Oh, I'll be fine. I'll put on sunscreen just in case. Ehehe♪
458.6547: Fall potatoes taste delicious, don't they? Admiral, shall I make steamed sweet potatoes? I'll prepare some tea as well. One moment, please.

459.1: The ninth Shiratsuyu-class Destroyer, Kawakaze of the revised Shiratsuyu-class. Nice to meet you! Ah, about the reading of my name, do not get it wrong!
459.25: Ninth ship of the Shiratsuyu-class, the revised Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Kawakaze. Well now, I was built under the Maru 2 program, the same as Umikaze and our big sisters. Maaan, that was some hard, hard work! We sailed the Solomon's seas many times over. My last moments were during night battle. The enemy's radar... really, what foul play!
459.2: Hm, Admiral. Did you call me?
459.3: Revised Shiratsuyu-class. Top balance is good, don't you think?
459.4: The hell? Don't touch my equipment... Hm~? Admiral what's wrong? You're interested over me? Hm?
459.29: Ahhhh~ So bored. Hey Admiral, let's do something.　Or else my body will become quite weak.　Admiral, you listening?!
459.28: Whats up Admiral, tired? That's embarrassing. I guess I have no choice, you can lean on me. Nn? Here, hows that?
459.24: Hmm? Whats up, Admiral? Whats with the box? Are you giving it to me? Eh, what kind of wind blew around? I'll still take it though!
459.8: Hm? ...Admiral, what's up? You looking at the report? Alright, alright.
459.13: Revised Shiratsuyu Destroyer, Kawakaze, launching. Follow me!
459.9: Oh? Thank you. Yep~ that's nice.
459.10: Yeah! Nice, nice! New stuff is definitely a step forward for me!
459.11: Hmm... I'll just take a short bath...
459.12: Oh well. Gonna take a long bath. You wanna join me, Admiral? Ha, kidding.
459.5: So, a new one has arrived.
459.7: Ahh~ Operation is over. Good work, good work!
459.14: Yeah, let's go and get hype! 24th Destroyer Division, sortie!
459.15: Hm. I saw enemy fleet, let's do this. Guns ready!
459.16: Hm, nice nice. Destroyers really belong to the battlefield. Let's go!
459.18: Heheheh, Night battle ho! Let's plunge in, sissies! Follow me!
459.17: Alright, let's take 'em all at once!
459.23: Hm? I'm number one? Heh, Nothing personal, Shiratsuyu sis. Cause I'm numero uno! Hehehe.
459.19: Puah... I still can go on! I ain't dying just yet!
459.20: Tch... What? Where did they hit me?!
459.21: Dammit... They got me... but I ain't sinking yet... owowowowow....
459.22: The hell... I'm in deep sea again... Big sis... everyone... let's meet... again..
459.30: Alright, Admiral, today's timekeeping role will be me, Kawakaze! Oh you can count on me! Gehehe!
459.31: It's 0100. Admiral, hehe, this is how it's done, right?
459.32: It's 0200, Admiral. Gehehe, easy peasy! Even timekeeping won't hold me back!
459.33: 03..0...0...  !! I'm not sleeping! Not sleepy at all! Because this is easy!
459.34: 0...4...zer-... !! Ah, big sis made me some morning tea! It's helpful! Now this will be a walk in a park!
459.35: 0...-ive...0...0...Admiral...while i'm doing this it's morning all sudden...Ahh, it's getting brighter...so this is morning huh, uhehe...sleepy...
459.36: Admiral,its 0600! It wakie time for everyone! Wake up-!! Sissies-!! It's Morning-!!
459.37: It's 0700! Admiral, let's eat breakfast! Breakfast! Uh, I can't do this, I'm not my sister. Now, let's go!
459.38: (munch) Admiral its 0800. The breakfast at Mamiya's is delicious!
459.39: It's 0900! Admiral, let's begin managing fleets. Where should I start... from expedition ? hmm...
459.40: 100-eh, Solomon seas? Yeah, I've been there, quite a lot actually. Drum cans on my back transporting stuff and also patrol duty. Quite a chore.
459.41: It's 1100 now, Admiral. We talked too much that it's already noon. Say, you're hungry? Eh, we're having field rations for lunch?
459.42: It's 1200, Admiral! Lunchtime is Onigiri time. Whoop-pe-doodie-do. I'm good at making onigiri. Eat'em!
459.43: Admiral, It's 1300 now. How do you like my onigiri? Taste good, eh? Nothing beats like making em above water. That's what I think.
459.44: It's 1400, Admiral. Alrighty, It's time to get serious. Tokyo Express, eh. Now where's my drum?
459.45: Admiral! It's 1500! Where's the snack? Huh?! Nothing?! Why nothing?! My stomach's rumbling here!
459.46: Admiral, it's 1600 already. It's already dusk... Say, does that mean there's night battle tonight? Sendai's gonna be there, right?
459.47: It's 1700 now, Admiral. So how's dinner...? Huh, what? You're gonna cook? Yeah, Not a bad idea♪
459.48: Admiral! It's 1800! Whoa! Dinner's served! Down the hatch~! *nom* *nom* 'tis good, Admiral. Awesome!
459.49: Ahh— I've ate well... No wait, it's 1900, Admiral. So— I'm off with Sendai to a night battle~
459.50: 2000. Gonna watch out for the enemy's radar detection. Sendai, let's proceed with caution!
459.51: 2100. Eh? Shigure, what's the matter? Ah? Numerous torpedoes?! Evaaadeee!
459.52: 2200. Admiral—! We've made it back safely from the night battle! Sendai and everyone else is alright. Phew!
459.53: Admiral, it's 2300, today was a tiring day huh, good work! Tomorrow we'll work at it too! Yeah!
459.Anniversary 6547: Hm? It's the third anniversary, isn't it? Way to go! That's quite a shocker! Yay~!
459.Rainy 6547: Hmm... It's been raining for days. It's the rainy season, after all. Oh well, time to relax.
459.EarlySummer 6547: Hnnnaaa... It's so damn hot. I can't stand it. I should put on something cooler like a swimsuit. Ahh, can I get away with it? Can I wear a swimsuit around the base?
459.Summer 6547: It's summertime?! Ku~ it's so damn hot!! What a shame! It'd a waste not to wear a swimsuit now, am I right? Admiral, you can strip down, too.
459.6547: Alright! We made it through summer. Fall is pretty nice. Kinda makes me feel carefree, and even the food tastes great.

26.1: Of the two Fusou-class super-dreadnought battleships, I am the elder sister, Fusou. Please take care of me and my younger sister Yamashiro.
26.25: The first of the Japanese designs for the super-dreadnought battleship class, Fusou. Please remember to take care of my younger sister, Yamashiro, as well. Leyte Gulf? Oh well, I would like to go there someday. Right?
26.2: Admiral, the weather is good today...
26.3: *sigh* Although the sky is so blue...
26.4: Admiral? If you touch it too much - I'm a little worried about the ammunition storage...
26.29: Um... Admiral? I wonder if I wasn't heard... Admiral? Admiraal? ...Oh my, that's a relief. Fusou, waiting here on stand by.
26.28: Admiral… If you work too hard, your body will get bad. Oh, me?...I...*sigh*
26.24: My main cannons, aren't they wonderful? But specialising in firepower too much can lead to all kinds of problems...If it's Admiral, I'm sure you understand, right?
26.8: There's a notification for the admiral.
26.10: Please modernize my sister Yamashiro as well.
26.11: It's only a scratch, don't worry about it.
26.12: With these large turrets, my shoulders get stiff... I'll be resting for a while.

26.5: It looks like we got a new comrade...
26.7: Admiral, the fleet has returned to base.
26.14: Battleship Fusou, setting sail. Yamashiro? Don't fall behind, we're sortieing!
26.16: Yamashiro, are you okay? It's the firefight.
26.18: I'll show you the real power of the Nishimura fleet!
26.17: I absolutely cannot lose out to Ise and Hyuuga...!
26.23: At least I can take pride in my firepower. ...Eh? Armor and speed? Those...are things I want...but...
26.21: In this kind of condition, I won't be able to breach the Leyte Gulf...
26.22: Am I going to sink after all? Hope Yamashiro's still fine...

26.Rainy 6547: Yamashiro, there is indeed a lot of rain in the rainy season.... I wonder if Shigure is well....
26.Summer 6547: Yamashiro? It's going to be summer soon. Would you like to go somewhere together? I wonder where would be nice.
26.6547: Autumn... it's that time of year again... Yamashiro, are you prepared? This is the year we'll finally break through.

460.1: Good morning!　I'm Hayasui, an oiler equipped with seaplanes!　I'll do my best to support everyone!
460.25: Fleet escort oiler, Hayasui. Best regards! I'm a multi-purpose refuel vessel that can supply a variety of different materials and am also designed to carry carrier-based aircraft. With a change of plans after the Battle of Midway, I also became able to launch Ryuusei.
460.3: A supply mission, Admiral? I'll do my best!
460.4: Admiral, my turntable is... um... well... it's nothing. I'm fine!
460.29: Excuse me, aren't we suppose to go for our next mission? Oh, not yet? I'm sorry. Is there anything I can help... Yes. I'll be on standby.
460.28: Admiral, Ryuusei is fine, but seaplane is good too. Zuiun is also... Ah...No! Not about me...I was talking about... Mogami-san or Hyuuga-san...
460.24: Admiral, did you call for me? Hm? This box is for me? Can I open it? Whoa... so beautiful! Ah! Does this mean... Does this mean...!!!
460.8: The recent report right, Admiral? Yes, right away!
460.13: Yes sir. Combined Fleet commanded oil tanker Hayasui, Setting sail!
460.9: This equipment is... Ah, yes! It is compatible with me!
460.10: With this... Perhaps with this I can fight alongside the others in the fleet.
460.27: That's right. Even I needed to resupply too. Thank you as always, Admiral!
460.11: I'm sorry, My armaments and my supply equipment is... Yes, I'll get it fix.
460.12: Oh no! There's a hole in my petroleum tank? Eh!? The Powder magazine and the provisions too? I'm sorry. I'll fix it up.
460.5: A new ship is ready for commission. I'm looking forward to it.
460.7: The fleet has returned! Ahh... thank goodness everyone's fine.
460.14: Supply corps 1 flagship, Hayasui, Set sail! The fleet is mobile!
460.15: Enemy fleet spotted!? Umm... Attacking! Hayasui air squadron, prepare for take off!
460.16: Is the flight deck OK? Air squadron, launch!
460.18: Night battle? Hmm... We have to do this! Cannons, ready for barrage. Charging in!
460.17: Hayasui air squadron, I'm counting on you!
460.23: Ehh!? My air team performs very well? I'm sincerely happy about it. I really am!
460.19: Hyaaah! Oh no... Is the crude oil tank OK?
460.20: I-It hurts! Ahh... Not my precious supply goods...!
460.21: I'm hit. I don't have much protection, so I'm having a bit of trouble right now.
460.22: Ah...? My body is tilting forward...? Eh? Hayasui is... sinking...? No...
460.30: Admiral, the date has changed. Hayasui will be alerting you on the time. Yes! Leave it to me.
460.31: Admiral, it is 0100. Yes. Hayasui is still fine. Look!
460.32: Admiral, it is 0200. No, I'm not feeling sleepy! Yes!
460.33: 03...0...0... H-huh? I'm awake! I'm totally fine!
460.34: 0...4... Mmph... I can't load any more...
460.35: Mmph... mmph... Wah! Come on, Admiral! Why didn't you wake me up! No!
460.36: It is 0600. Admiral... Yes, I'm sorry. I will start preparing breakfast.
460.37: 0700, and the breakfast is ready. Please, help yourself. Today's menu is mugimeshi with potato miso soup, dried fish and...
460.38: Admiral, it is 0800. Yes! It might not be as good as Mamiya-san's, but I have a storage so I am quite good at cooking.
460.39: Admiral, it is 0900. Well, let's work hard today as well!
460.40: Admiral, it is 1000. We will start with status check on the expedition fleet. Hmmm...
460.41: Admiral, it is 1100. Expedition should be good with this! Would next be exercise? Okay!
460.42: Admiral, it is 1200 and noon! I will bring the lunch! Please wait.
460.43: It is 1300. Admiral, how was Hayasui's Omurice? Hehehe, I might have gone a little over the line.
460.44: Admiral, it is 1400. Let's do our best for the afternoon as well.
460.45: It is 1500. Admiral, how about having some tea and sweets? Hayasui, will prepare them. Please wait.
460.46: Admiral, it is 1600. Eh? Kazahaya? No, I haven't meant her in a while. I'm pretty it's been since Truk or something. I wonder if she's doing well...
460.47: Admiral, it is 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful. I want to watch it forever.
460.48: Admiral, it is 1800. What should we do about dinner. What will be good? Hayasui, will prepare it.
460.49: 1900! Yes! I did my best to prepare a Western style dinner. The main dish is beef steak! Yes, beef steak! It's special!
460.50: Admiral, it is 2000. Here is your after dinner coffee. Did the dinner suit your taste? Really!? I'm glad.
460.51: Admiral, it is 2100. The third torpedo squadron seems to be lively. I wonder what's going on? Eh, don't worry about it? Ah, okay.
460.52: Admiral, it is 2200. Eh? Taiyou-san? Yes, I believe we'll meet here someday. For sure.
460.53: 2300. Admiral, good work today as well. Let's do our best tomorrow too! Yes!
460.Anniversary 6547: It's the third anniversary Admiral! Amazing! Hayasui is very happy.
460.Rainy 6547: The rainy season is humid, so I don't really like it. But, don't worry! I will always support the fleet and the admiral! You bet!
460.Summer 6547: Summer is here for the year. Every year, when this season comes around, I get stomach aches. U... hehehe... I wonder why...?
460.6547: Admiral, it's fall! Fall! I really like fall for some reason. Want me to bake us some sweet potatoes?

461.1: I'm Shoukaku, the first of the Shoukaku-class carriers. Alongside Zuikaku as remodeled Shoukaku-class, I'm hoping to be a useful source of strength for the admiral.
461.25: I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten over Mariana, I wish to continue taking a leap forward with the admiral.
461.3: Zuikaku, don't give our supporting ship a hard time, okay? Zuikaku...? Zuikaku!?
461.4: Geez, Zuikaku, stop fiddling with my skirt so mu- huh, oh my, Admiral?
461.29: Admiral? Um... We should head to Port Moresby... Um, uh...
461.28: Admiral... Had I, been of help to you? Fufu... I see... so that's how it is. I'm glad... I'm so glad!
461.24: Thank you, Admiral. Giving me these planes that I've never seen before, my gratitude is overflowing. Maybe… just maybe… if my wish comes true, after the Marianas, we can stay together…
461.8: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
461.13: New CarDiv 5, flagship Shoukaku, moving out!
461.9: So this is the new model equipment... Ah, yes! I shall put it to good use.
461.10: I'm so happy! Many thanks, Admiral.
461.11: I'll take a short bath... be out in a bit.
461.12: I seem to get injured rather easily... right, Zuikaku?

461.5: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
461.7: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
461.14: You ready, Zuikaku? Don't fall behind. Mobile squad, setting sail!
461.16: Here I go. All planes, attack!
461.18: Now... what's going to appear? Make sure you watch out for submarines.
461.17: Support team, cover the assault squad!
461.23: I did it, Admiral! It's all thanks to the planes and supporting ships! Thank you all!
461.19: O-ouch... I can still do this!
461.20: Ah! Ouch! A-are we still able to takeoff?
461.21: The remodeled Shoukaku-class, will not sink with just this. ...Is the flight deck alright? ...Hm? ...Thank goodness. I can still fight on!
461.22: Looks like... I'm gone again... Yahagi, Akizuki... please take care of things now.
461.30: Admiral? Seems like the date has changed.
461.35: It's now 0500. The sun's about to come up, huh.
461.36: 0600. It's about wake-up time for everyone.
461.37: 0700. What would you like for breakfast?
461.38: 0800. I'll do my best today too.
461.39: It's now 0900. Should I send out scout planes?
461.40: It's 1000. I wonder if Zuikaku is okay?
461.41: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
461.42: Admiral, it's 1200. Shall we have lunch?
461.44: It's 1400. Admiral, are you feeling tired?
461.45: It's 1500. The campaign is about to begin.
461.46: 1600. I'll be sending up the CAP.
461.47: It's 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful, Admiral?
461.50: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
461.53: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?

462.1: The carrier whose rigging was completely modernized, Zuikaki here. Don't confuse me for your average aircraft carrier!
462.25: Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, Zuikaku. Following the battle of Midway, I occupied a core position in the First Mobile Fleet along with Shoukaku-nee. I fought until the very last arrow was fired... which was literally the day the Mobile Fleet was completely annihilated. ...However, this time will be different! I will show you the strength and potential of a fully remodeled aircraft carrier! Shoukaku-nee, let's do this!
462.9: New planes? That's great! Thank you!
462.14: Mobile Fleet flagship Zuikaku, now setting sail! Follow my lead!
462.15: Shoukaku-nee, let's do this. Bow to windward! Strike squadron, commence takeoff!
462.23: Yesss!!! Did you see? This is the true power of the new CarDiv 5! The Goddess of Fortune is on my side!

465.1: Mr. Admiral, thanks for the hard work. Training cruiser, Kashima, checking in! Ufufu!
465.25: Second of the Katori-class training cruisers— the little sister, Kashima. I was built at a time of peaceful waters in order to raise a new generation of capable fleet ships. The time spent on my original duty wasn't long, but I gave my very best both as a fleet flagship and escort. After the battle ended, for the sake of the future, I worked very hard! Please don't forget about my services, okay?
465.3: Oh, my. I'll be the Fourth Fleet's flagship, then? Not right now? Well, now...
465.4: This sensation... that's not big sis Katori, is it...? See! I knew it! Mr. Admiral! Fufu♪
465.29: Mr. Admiral? Mr. Admiral! Umm... I want to talk about the escort fleet... O-Oh, you look busy... don't you? Excuse me. Later is fine with me... okay.
465.28: Mr. Admiral. Someday, when the waters are peaceful again, I would like to go on a deep sea cruise with you! There are so many places that I want to see! Will we? We'll go for sure, right? I'm looking forward to it.
465.24: Mr. Admiral? Is this a briefing for a deep sea practice drill? Or maybe an anti-submarine battle... Eh? It's not? This is... for me? No way, eh... really? Umm... I'll gladly accept it. Thank you so much! I'll treasure it...
465.8: Oh, do you want to see the stats? I'll get them for you, okay?
465.13: Flagship Kashima, now sortieing! Everyone, please follow after me!
465.11: Uu... I got a little dirty. I'll go take a bath, okay?
465.12: I'm sorry. I... both my uniform and myself... I'll go freshen up a bit. Wait for me, okay?
465.5: Mr. Admiral, the new ship would like to introduce herself.
465.14: Marine escort fleet flagship Kashima, now sortieing! Ehehe... I'll try!
465.15: Enemy? Is it the enemy? We have no choice but to fight. Fleet, make preparations to engage. Please hurry!
465.18: You can't escape! Pursue them. Port and starboard engines, flank speed. I-I can do this!
465.17: Don't underestimate a training cruiser! My equipment and proficiency are more than enough!
465.23: Eh? Are you kidding... it's me? I had the best battle results? Really? No way... Mr. Admiral, I'm... a little... happy!
465.21: Kyaaaa! I-I... won't sink... I have no intention of sinking... in this place...
465.22: No way... it's so cold... Eh!? Seawater...? This is... I'm... eh...? I'm... sinking...? No way...
465.Anniversary 6547: Congratulations on the third anniversary, Admiral. It's your third anniversary, isn't it? This make me happy, too. Heheh~
465.Rainy 6547: It's raining a lot lately. On a day like this, shall we stay indoors and plan strategies for future operations?
465.Summer 6547: It's almost summer. I wonder what Katori-nee will do about her swimsuit? I suppose I should get one as well? What should I do?
465.6547: Mr. Admiral, it's a pleasant fall, isn't it? I was also launched in fall, you know? Ufufu♪
