91.27: Thanks for the resupply. With this, I'll be able to sortie again! Alright!
91.11: I'll go do some quick repairs on my flight deck.
91.12: Good grief. Well, sometimes there's nothing you can do but enter the dock.
91.5: Construction is complete. Hopefully she's a good ship.
91.7: The fleet has returned. Is Operation MI next?
91.14: We'll win decisively! Be sure to scout thoroughly.
91.16: A second attack wave is required. Hurry!
91.18: Alright! Tomonaga Squadron, I'm counting on you!
91.17: Even if I'm the last ship standing, I'll give them hell!
91.23: How's that! Hey, Tamon-maru, were you watching?
91.19: This is nothing but a scratch!
91.20: Ouch! Are we... still able to land and take off?
91.22: So I'm going to sink... then I'll have one final little drink with the moon...
91.Anniversary 6547: So we're gonna celebrate today! Yessss! Hiryuu wants to celebrate with the admiral next year, too.... Okay?

49.1: I'm Kasumi, charging forth. Follow me.
49.25: I fought intensely as a main fleet destroyer in history. In the end, I fought alongside battleship Yamato in Operation Ten-go against the fierce attacks of American carrier-based aircraft. I won't lose!
49.2: If you need me for something, look at me in the eyes!
49.3: Like I said, what is it?
49.4: Hah? Now you're angry at me for what you did? How undisciplined.
49.29: Hey! Why are we on standby at such a crucial time?! What is the meaning of this? Are you listening?!
49.28: W-what? I'm actually grateful to you a little, if you weren't here I'd be lonely… D-don't get the wrong idea!
49.24: Oh, for the garbage commander to be in a place like this, you must be quite free huh... eh... present? For me? Eh... Ah... you idiot...
49.8: It's a letter. How many times are you going to make me say that, you garbage?
49.13: Kasumi, departing! I can't just stand by and watch.
49.9: Something like this wouldn't even fall in the category of an upgrade.
49.27: Something like this wouldn't even fall in the category of an upgrade.
49.12: Geez, what kind of order is this. It's really troublesome!
49.6: Repairs have been completed. Verify it soon.
49.5: A new ship has been completed. Go welcome her.
49.7: The operation has been completed. Listen to the report.
49.18: Argh, there's nobody else but idiots...
49.17: It would be great if you would just die!
49.23: It's not like I'm happy or anything. But for now I'll accept your praise.
49.19: Kyaa! You've got to kidding me!
49.21: It seems we have some half-decent opponents. I'll give you my praise.
49.22: To think that I would sink... I won't... I won't accept this...!
49.Anniversary 6547: Why don't you ever tell me something this important beforehand! It's the third anniversary! Third anniversary! ... It's really amazing! Tell me quicker! ... Congrats
49.Rainy 6547: It's the rainy season, huh. Even the outside looks foggy with all the rain. We'll be fine as long as the haze remains. Arare, don't worry.
49.Summer 6547: What? Kiyoshimo, you're buying a swimsuit? Hmmm. I guess that one is fine. Why don't you try it on...? Eh? Me...? I don't need one... Ehh!? I don't want one!
49.6547: It's fall... and after fall, it's winter... Operation Rei-Go... where I tried so hard as flagship. Why...? I'm remembering it so clearly... Just why...

17.1: We've finally met! I'm Kagerou. Treat me well!
17.25: Constucted for the Circle-4 programe, Kagerou-class nameship, Kagerou. As the main power of the newly-made ships, staring off with the Hawaii attack force, I was in lots of varied battles! Treat me well!
17.4: I'll get angry if you touch me too much, you know?
17.29: Commander, are you listening? Commander? Oh, come on, Commander! What's the big idea, ignoring me?!
17.24: Ah, Commander! Great work!... Erm, right.. Um, here's a Hawaiian souvenir chocolate for you!
17.8: A telegram for the commander has arrived.
17.9: Thanks! Expect great things from me!
17.10: Oh? This is pretty good! Thanks.
17.27: Thanks! Expect great things from me!
17.12: I'll be away for a bit. *sigh*.
17.6: Looks like a new friend has just finished repairs.
17.14: Both turbines to full speed, Kagerou sortieing!
17.17: How bad for you, take this!
17.23: How was it, my fighting? A text-book case? Ah, thanking me is enough.
17.20: Hmmph, it'll take more than that!
17.21: I'm not worth of the position of the Kagerou nameship... *sigh*
17.Anniversary 6547: Isn't today an important day? Commander, everyone, congrats!
17.EarlySummer 6547: Shiranui~! You, should buy a new swimsuit this year, too. Eh? Ahh, sheesh! I'll choose one for you!
17.Summer 6547: Hey! We're going to sea with the 18th Division's members. Are you all wearing your swimsuits under your clothes? Shiranui, this goes for you, too!

18.1: I'm Shiranui. I look forward to your guidance and encouragement.
18.25: Second Kagerou-class destroyer, Shiranui. Along with the other Kageros I served as the escort for the Hawaii Operational Forces. In the fated Battle of Leyte Gulf, I was attached to Shima's fleet and rushed to the Surigao Strait.
18.2: Did you call for me, Commander?
18.3: Do you have something for me to do?
18.4: What is it... did I make a mistake?
18.29: Shiranui is absolutely not bored. No, please don't mind me. Do as you like...
18.24: Commander, what do you think of my battles...? Oh, I see... Well, that's fine too.
18.9: Oh. Good upgrade. I appreciate it.
18.27: Oh. Good supplies. I appreciate it.
18.11: Though I can still sail... but if it's an order...
18.12: I wont just sit here and accept this.
18.6: A ship has been fully repaired.
18.5: It appears a new ship is complete.
18.14: I will live up to your expectations.
18.18: I will chase them down completely.
18.23: I'm bored. Is there no more spirited foe?
18.19: This level of damage won't sink me.
18.22: If this is death, everyone is coming with me... That includes you.
18.Anniversary 6547: Commander, isn't today a really important day? Really...? Well then, it's delightful.
18.EarlySummer 6547: No. I will not buy such a.... Fine. No way around it. Ah, this might work.
18.Summer 6547: No. The sea is somewhere we go all the time. Just because it's summer is no reason to go in our swimsuits...

19.25: Built in the Osaka Civilian Naval Yards, third of the Kagerou-class Destroyers, Kuroshio. Even though I look like this, I participated in such hard-fought battles as Surabaya, the South Pacific and the third Battle of Solomon, ya' know.
19.4: Hey, there's nothing wrong with my body, y'know?
19.29: Chief? Chieeef? Can yoouu heeeear me? ...Oh well. Guess I'll just take it easy then.
19.24: I... I'm... always lookin' at the chief, y'know? Really! C'mon, believe me...
19.13: Well then, Kuroshio, off I go!
19.11: I'm just gonna rest for a bit~
19.12: Oww... I can't really bear this level of pain...
19.6: The ship repair has been finished?
19.15: Well now, let's get this party started!
19.23: It just kind of happened that way, don't worry about me.
19.22: I… I can't live any longer… Goodbye…
19.Anniversary 6547: Commander, today is an anniversary, right? Kuroshio is happy, too!
19.Rainy 6547: The rain, huh. The season of rain - it's fine, in its own way.
19.Summer 6547: Chief? Why don't we go together to the sea? Nah, not to an expedition— to the sandy beach!

74.1: I'm the light aircraft carrier, Shouhou. Yes, I'm a little small, but please make a place for me on your fleet!
74.25: First of the Shouhou-class aircraft carriers. Originally, a submarine tender. If it's not the flagship or the main fleet but a small task-force, then by all means use me! If you make use of me, I'll surely get good results!
74.3: Eh, do I like coral? No, I hate it!
74.4: Um...if you touch me too much, I can't launch my aircraft. Can we do it after I've launched everything?
74.29: One dive bomber... two dive bombers... three... Ah, Admiral! It's okay, I'm not lonely or anything. I have my planes with me and... Ah, yes!
74.28: Once in a while, won't you try taking it easy and be yourself? Forget about things like sortie and your duty... I mean, I'm sorry! That's no good, isn't it...
74.24: Admiral, am I being useful? Really? Then...that's great. From now on, I'll always be by your side!
74.8: Admiral, you have a message from command.
74.9: Huh? I'm so happy! For you to be giving me strength!
74.10: Thank you! Now, I'll be able to keep up with the fleet carriers!
74.27: Huh? Huh? I'm so happy! For you to be giving me strength! Supplies, much appreciated.
74.11: Time for a little rest. I'll be well shortly.
74.12: If I stay like this, I'll just be a target for the enemy. I'm sorry, but I need to rest a little.
74.6: Thank you for waiting! Ship's repairs have been completed.
74.5: Looks like a new ship has arrived.
74.7: A fleet has just returned to port from an operation.
74.14: Will my planes be okay...? No, it'll be fine!
74.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Bombers, please prepare for flight!
74.16: I'm still an aircraft carrier! I can do it!
74.18: Second attack squadron, are you ready? Then, prepare for launch!
74.17: Straying too far from the fleet is dangerous...
74.23: Yay, I did it! I'm so happy! From now on, I'll be sure to keep working hard!
74.21: Ah... I'm done for... I can't fight like this.
74.Rainy 6547: The rainy season, huh... This is the season in which I was launched. I.... ah, no, it's nothing. I'm fine.
74.Summer 6547: For summer, this clothing works well, Admiral. Isn't it cold during the winter, you say? W-well. N-no! It's fine!

104.1: I'm Chitose. I'm the the first Japanese seaplane tender. Nice to meet you!
104.25: I'm the Seaplane Tender, Chitose. Although I'm an exceptional ship capable of making use of seaplanes a lot, I was used as an oiler and supplied fuel to other ships. In the latter stages of the war, I was remodeled into an aircraft carrier and fought in the frontline.
104.2: Admiral, what do you want to drink?
104.3: You want some more? Here you go!
104.4: Admiral~ you can really knock them back! Here, another drink!
104.29: You're busy aren't you? That's fine, that's fine. How about we take it easy?
104.28: Admiral, it's not good to work yourself too hard. Once in a while, won't you drink some fine sake with me, and have a little rest? Alright...?
104.24: Admiral, after the battle's over, why don't we have a drink together? Ah, not some fuel!
104.8: Admiral, there's a message for you.
104.13: No problem, leave it to me.
104.10: Ah, fix it right there. Yeah, there. I want to be more useful.
104.11: With only this much... I'll be better soon.
104.12: Since Chiyoda will worry about me, I'll heal up as fast as possible.
104.5: Umm, it looks like a new ship has arrived.
104.15: I'm proud of my newly developed E12 seaplanes!
104.23: No need to thank me, it's all thanks to the seaplanes...

105.1: Seaplane tender Chiyoda. My older sister Chitose isn't bothering you, is she?
105.25: Laid down as a Seaplane Tender, second of the Chitose class, Chiyoda. I was able to make use of midget subs, you know. I'll do my best alongside Chitose-onee!
105.2: Eh? Did Chitose-onee do something again?
105.3: Chitose-onee... watch out... ah... A dream?
105.4: Chitose-onee.. that tickleeeesss... oh, Admiral, What are you doing?
105.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
105.28: Admiral, had you not seen Chitose-onee around here? Ah, is that so, hmm... well, then, umm... you look a little worn-out so I'll lend you my lap! I'll let you rest a little!
105.24: Admiral, do you need something? Ah- You wanted to know if I'd seen Chitose-onee? I see...
105.8: Communique for Chitose-onee... no, for the admiral.
105.9: I'm getting a bit closer to Chitose-onee, aren't I?
105.10: Heheh I can win with this... Maybe even beat Chitose-onee!
105.11: I'm not really fond of docking, actually...
105.12: Urgh... I'm going for heavy repairs...? Don't tell Chitose-onee! I beg you!
105.6: I heard the the damaged ship has been repaired.
105.5: A new ship has been finished~ Oh, here she comes~
105.7: The fleet has returned. Is everybody safe?
105.15: This is Chiyoda's seaplane. I've spotted the enemy!
105.23: Chiyoda's the best? Oh my, am I as good as Sis?
105.20: I'm not going the same way as Chitose-onee!
105.21: No... At this rate, my seaplanes...

57.1: I'm torpedo cruiser Ooi. By the way, I wonder where Kitakami-san is.
57.25: It's Ooi, torpedo cruiser edition. My torpedo powers were counted in, but I didn't have much of the limelight. I'll show you what I'm made of this time. Keep your eyes open!
57.2: Is this some sort of drill?
57.4: You like them too, Admiral? Yes, I have a lot attached to my legs! ...but you've touched them too much, so how about eating 20 of them?
57.29: Will Kitakami-san be alright?..... I'm getting worried as I'm not with her... Hmm... I'm so worried... It's definitely, yes, there's definitely something that's about to happen! I have to go now!
57.28: Admiral? What happened to the other girls, you say? Eh...? That's not it? Hmm, it's okay then.. It's okay...
57.24: Of the two Torpedo cruisers, you chose me, right?... If you betray me, I'll sink you in the ocean, you know...
57.8: It seems there is a message for you, Admiral.
57.9: These Type-93 Oxygen Torpedoes are so cool... and marvelous.
57.10: I want to be able use my torpedoes to their maximum abilities.
57.26: If Kitakami is fine with it, go ahead.
57.27: Yep, be sure to pack me with fuel and torpedoes okay? Fufu, this way I can fight again.
57.11: Yes, I'll be taking a short break.
57.12: That strategy was horrible... No, sorry for my incompetence.
57.6: That's right, a ship is fully repaired.
57.5: A new friend has joined our fleet.
57.7: The campaign has ended. Good work.
57.14: Now, let's go and fire these oxygen torpedoes up!
57.18: Who's the one that hurt Kitakami?
57.23: I'm the one? Aww, I'm loss for words♪ Eh, Kitakami-san...? Did Kitakami-san see that!? Did she!?
57.21: Oh no! My torpedo tubes are in tatters now!
57.22: I guess it isn't bad... to sink as a Torpedo Cruiser...
57.30: Admiral, midnight has just came around again. It's late night.
57.31: The time is currently at 0100. Eh...? It sounds too strict? I-I see...
57.32: The time is――... Ah, I mean, it's 0200. Do you prefer it like this, Admiral?
57.33: 0300. ...Geez, so annoying. Being picky even in the way I make the hourly announcements... N-Nothing! It's 0300, sir!
57.34: It's 04...00... Admiral? Admiral...? Did he go to sleep? ...THIS IS MY CHANCE!
57.35: 0500. I need to go to Kitakami-san's side!! Yes, she is definitely troubled! Kitakami-saaaaaaaaaan!!
57.36: 0600! Kitakami-san, are you okay, are you safe!? I-it looks like you're fine... Eh? This knife? Ah, it's for making breakfast...
57.37: 07,00... Yes, I was thinking, of preparing, breakfast... For today's miso soup, are you okay with gluten?
57.38: 0800. Alright, for Kitakami-san's sake, I made breakfast with a quality that is above my skill level! Please go ahead and eat up♪ ...It's delicious? I'm relieved♪
57.39: 0900. Eh, shouldn't I return to my post? But...
57.40: 1000. Admiral, I'm back... Where did I go? ...Isn't it obvious, of course it's to Kitakami-san's place!!
57.41: 1100. Um... Admiral? Why are you holding your head like that? Did you get a flu!? Let's see, where is the flu medicine...
57.42: It's 1200. It is now noon. Should I make some lunch? It's fine. I'm good at cooking.
57.43: 1300. Go on, eat up! Eh? What is this...? It's obviously omelette rice! Should I write something with the ketchup?
57.44: It's 1400. What is it, Admiral? What's with that look of doubt on your face. I didn't do anything like poison your lunch, you know? How rude.
57.45: 1500. It's about time to seriously go out for some sorties now I guess. ..Yes, I'll do my best!
57.46: 1600. Um... For the expedition, what should the fleet do, Admiral?
57.47: It's 1700. Oh my, It's nearly dinner time. I'll prepare dinner food for a while.
57.48: The time is currently at 1800. What kind of pot is this, you ask? It's certainly, my special curry, fulfilled with my love! I'm leaving!
57.49: 1900. Kitakami-san♪ I just accidentally cook too much curry! If you don't mind, let's eat togetheeeeR!
57.50: 2000. See, there's a curry for Admiral too. Eh? It's delicious...? Your body is getting hotter? You see?
57.51: It is now 2100. Let's see, we're done washing up, the area around the fire is okay too. Good work for today, Admiral. Fuu...
57.52: 2200. Tsk, That one light cruiser is making such a noise A―GAIN... Admiral, Can I go to complain her? Ah, O...Okay?
57.53: 2300. Admiral, Thank you for your hard work today. Is Kitakami-san already sleeping?

58.1: A brand new Kitakami... that's me, all right. I feel a lot more grown up, loaded to the brim with oxygen torpedoes.
58.25: It's Super Kitakami-sama, equipped with type-93 oxygenated torpedos, with 20 firing tubes on each side. It's been said that I have overpowering strength, but I did not really get any chances to shine. Bah.
58.2: These Type-93 oxygen torpedoes sure are heavy...
58.3: Nuh... What, Admiral...? What is it with you? I don't mind it, though.
58.4: T-that? I'd rather not load any...
58.29: You know... My shoulder is getting all stiff. Even though I'm still too young for this~. Torpedoes really are kinda heavy, aren't they?
58.28: Admiral? What's up? Feeling down? That's not like you, it's all good.
58.24: Admiral, I got a bit of a request... that weapon, I don't really want it, yeah?... I'm countin' on ya!
58.8: A message for you, Admiral. Here.
58.9: Keep em' coming! I'll become an even better ship.
58.11: Yeah... 'tis a difficult ship, ain't it.
58.12: Yeah... sure is a difficult one. I'll go get fixed in the meanwhile.
58.6: Repair is done. How bout you take a look.
58.5: A new ship has been floated.
58.7: Oh, seems like the fleet returned.
58.14: Well, I make the ultimate combination with Ooi.
58.15: 20 shots of Oxygen Torpedoes, going in twice.
58.16: My 40 firing tubes ain't just for show, 'ya know.
58.18: Time to make oil soup out of you!
58.17: Well, my main cannons are... well... yeah...
58.23: Hehe, so this is the power of a torpedo ship. Man... I'm glad I got to do something.
58.19: Guh... I really have no defensive powers...
58.21: Well, how should I say this... I guess these things happen. I wanna get fixed!
58.22: I'd like to be a battleship in my next life after all... gulp
58.31: 0100. Yes, that's right. It's the time keeping thing. I'll be doing it for today.
58.32: 0200. I'm gettin' bored of it-. Don't you have things like manga? No manga? ...tch.
58.33: 0300. It's completely late into the night now. I'm sleepy too...
58.34: It's now 0400. Aren't you sleepy, Admiral? I see, isn't that nice...
58.35: 0500. It turned into morning now... It's so bright-... I'm sho sleepy, can I sleep? Starting from right now...
58.36: 0600. Wah! What's wrong, Ooichi? Why're you makin' such a scary face? What's wrong? What's up?
58.37: 0700. Admiral, Ooichi made breakfast. Eh? It's fine, I'm thankful for it.
58.38: 0800. The breakfast that Ooichi made, time to eat! ...Hmm, why is there only portions for two? What about Admiral's?
58.39: 0900. So I keep saying, I'm fine, Ooichi. Go on, go back to your post~. Yes, yes.
58.40: 1000. Fuu... Ooichi has finally gone back. No, she's a good girl, really. Ah, you already knew that? Is that so.
58.41: 1100. After doin' the things on hand, it's already noon huh. Hmm, what should I eat for lunch? Ah, there's still work to do? Right right.
58.42: 1200. It's lunch tiime-! So, what should I eat today? Hmm.
58.43: 1300. That's right, as expected, it's got to be curry for lunch~! Should I go for Mamiya curry? Or should I just take a rest?
58.44: Fuu, in the end, it's always Mamiya-san's curry. Well, that's fine too. It's delicious after all. Ah, it's 1400. Just for the record.
58.45: 1500. Well. Lot'sa things happened. But y'know, that also can't be helped. Is what I'm thinking now.
58.46: 1600. Ah, it's Abukuma. O~i! Hmm? Why did she run away? O~i. ...What a weird person, right?
58.47: It's now 1700. Almost time to finish for the day~ The sun's heading down~
58.48: 1800. Well, 'bout time we close up, yeah? Oh, still too early? I see... tch.
58.49: 1900. Ah, Ooichiii! Why'ya holding a pot? Eh? Ooichi's deluxe curry? C-Curry is it...
58.50: 2000. Hey, Admiral, it is okay to have curry again for dinner? Hmmm. It's pretty good, I'm gettin' chills! Ooicchi, thanks♪
58.51: 2100. Well, we ended up having nothing but curry today, but Ooichi's sure is delicious, yeah? The flavor's a bit strange, though.
58.52: 2200. Well, it's about time for the fleet missions to end for today, yeah? Good work everyone~. Time to sleep, time to sleep. Bye Admiral.
58.53: 2300. ...mm? Mmm~? Ehh.. I'm on night duty today? Eh~? Can I pull it off, doesn't it seem kinda impossible?

106.1: I'm Chitose. I'm the the first Japanese seaplane tender. Nice to meet you!
106.25: I'm the Seaplane Tender, Chitose. Although I'm an exceptional ship capable of making use of seaplanes a lot, I was used as an oiler and supplied fuel to other ships. In the latter stages of the war, I was remodeled into an aircraft carrier and fought in the frontline.
106.2: Admiral, what do you want to drink?
106.3: You want some more? Here you go!
106.4: Admiral~ you can really knock them back! Here, another drink!
106.29: You're busy aren't you? That's fine, that's fine. How about we take it easy?
106.28: Admiral, it's not good to work yourself too hard. Once in a while, won't you drink some fine sake with me, and have a little rest? Alright...?
106.24: Admiral, after the battle's over, why don't we have a drink together? Ah, not some fuel!
106.8: Admiral, there's a message for you.
106.13: No problem, leave it to me.
106.10: Ah, fix it right there. Yeah, there. I want to be more useful.
106.11: With only this much... I'll be better soon.
106.12: Since Chiyoda will worry about me, I'll heal up as fast as possible.
106.5: Umm, it looks like a new ship has arrived.
106.15: I'm proud of my newly developed E12 seaplanes!
106.23: No need to thank me, it's all thanks to the seaplanes...
106.30: 12 midnight. Together with the admiral, I watched the day tick over! *giggle*
106.31: It's 1 A.M. Ah, somehow I'm uneasy... perhaps Chiyoda is mad?
106.32: It's 2 A.M. Being the timekeeper, it's a bit rough, you know...
106.33: It's 3 A.M. Just as a nightcap, would you like something to drink?
106.34: 4 A.M. I wonder if Chiyoda is sleeping well...
106.35: 5 A.M. Admiral, the daily quests have renewed. Let's clear them out together!
106.36: zzz... haa... Ah! 6 A.M. Admiral! Sorry! I borrowed your lap for a bit.
106.37: 7 A.M. Daybreak sure is refreshing. Good morning.
106.38: It's 8 A.M. Thanks to the admiral, I was able to sleep well last night.
106.39: 9 A.M. For me, it's too early to be drinking or to be sober. *giggle*
106.40: 10 A.M. Today's maneuvers, what are you considering?
106.41: 11 A.M. For lunch, what do you want to do?
106.42: 12 midday, it's lunch time, no? On a hill overlooking the port, even a bento is great!
106.43: It's 1 P.M. With the admiral, even a convenience bento is great. *giggle* How lovely!
106.44: It's 2 P.M. Ah.. Admiral, I see Chiyoda over there! He~y Chiyoda~?
106.45: It's 3 P.M. Oh my? Chiyoda, she ran away all angry. I wonder why~?
106.46: It's 4 P.M. Admiral, this evening's maneuvers, what are you considering?
106.47: 5 P.M. Such a beautiful twilight, isn't it?
106.49: 7 P.M. Just time for dinner, no? How about we go to Houshou's?
106.50: 8 P.M. Admiral, how about taking your time in a bath today?
106.51: 9 P.M. Admiral, the bath is.... going together is impossible!
106.52: 10 P.M. Oh my, what is it Chiyoda? It's all right, I'm not bothering the admiral. Don't worry.
106.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, staying up late every day is bad. Go to bed early today...

88.1: Ise-class Aviation Battleship, Hyuuga... Pushing forward.
88.25: I'm Hyuuga. I got the ability of carrying aircrafts, and now I am an aviation battleship. I fought bravely in Battle of Leyte Gulf. An operation of transporting tactical goods "Operation Hoku-Go", it is one with a lot of memories for me. Ah yes, JMSDF's DDH "Hyuuga" succeeds to my name.
88.2: Oh... It's you. You're still here.
88.3: Looks like the days of plain-old battleship is over.
88.24: Aviation Battleship... got a nice ring to it, yeah? You get it, right? Alright... let's drink! We're not going back 'till morning!
88.8: Here's a letter for you... No, not from me.
88.9: The unlikely age of the aviation battleship, is it?
88.10: So the world's finally caught up with me then.
88.27: The unlikely age of the aviation battleship, is it?
88.11: I won't be able to carry the 60's even with the repairs, you know?
88.6: The repairs seem to be finished.
88.5: A new face is coming to our fleet... Let's go welcome her.
88.7: The fleet's returned. Let's hope they're all present and well...
88.15: Get to know the true power of the aviation battleships!
88.16: That's right... Launch the fighters and charge-in. Like this.
88.18: You're a problem... We'll have to wipe you out here!
88.17: Well, it's not like the rear deck is a shield...
88.23: I see, so it's an age of aerial combat from now on... I hope Mogami's faring fine as well.
88.21: Ugh... I wouldn't want Ise to see me like this
88.22: Even if I get heavily damaged and sunk to the bottom of the sea, it is inside Kure naval base that I'll accept this fate, I surely decided so, but… it cannot be helped.

418.1: How's the remodeled Satsuki? Want to try me?
418.25: I kept getting injured again and again on missions, but I fought bravely to the end as the fifth of the Mutsuki-class destroyers. After the war began, I did my best to escort the fleet and guard areas of the ocean. I really did!
418.29: Geez Commander, is it not my turn yet? Are you listening to me? Aah... I see, understood.
418.28: Seriously, I'm no match for the commander... hehe~
418.24: Commander! I'm sorry for always making you fret… but… it was a little on purpose… just kidding!
418.9: Thanks for the enhancement! With this I can protect the admi—I mean, I can protect everyone!
418.10: Yeah, I'm different from the everyday me!
418.12: Woah~ I thought I was really gonna die~
418.5: Looks like a new friend has arrived.
418.15: You gonna fight with me? Ain't that cute of ya!
418.16: Alright, my fight starts now! Everyone, follow me!
418.23: Ehehee!! Are you reconsidering me now?
418.22: H-hey? What's this... the ocean... is dark... I can't see anything... why?

464.1: I am Kasumi, now a remodeled Asashio-class destroyer! Of course, we are charging forth. Come. Follow me.
464.25: I fought intensely as a main fleet destroyer in history. In the end, I fought alongside battleship Yamato in Operation Ten-go against the fierce attacks of American carrier-based aircraft. I won't lose!
464.2: If you need me for something, look at me in the eyes!
464.3: Like I said, what is it?
464.4: Hah? Now you're angry at me for what you did? How undisciplined.
464.29: Hey! Why are we on standby at such a crucial time?! What is the meaning of this? Are you listening?!
464.28: W-what? I'm actually grateful to you a little, if you weren't here I'd be lonely… D-don't get the wrong idea!
464.24: Oh, for the garbage commander to be in a place like this, you must be quite free huh... eh... present? For me? Eh... Ah... you idiot...
464.8: Ah, you are looking for intel? Wait a moment. I'll sort them for you now.
464.13: Kasumi, departing! I can't just stand by and watch.
464.9: Something like this wouldn't even fall in the category of an upgrade.
464.27: What is it, resupply!? ...Well, it's necessary though.
464.12: Geez, what kind of order is this. It's really troublesome!
464.6: Repairs have been completed. Verify it soon.
464.5: A new ship has been completed. Go welcome her.
464.7: The operation has been completed. Listen to the report.
464.14: Kasumi, interim flagship of the Second Torpedo Squadron, leaving port! Follow me!
464.18: Argh, there's nobody else but idiots...
464.17: Argh, no one but idiots! Action is all there is! Let's do it!
464.23: It's not like I'm happy or any... No, that's not it. The will and pride of destroyer crews... It's rather nice. I'll take it.
464.19: Kyaa! You've got to kidding me!
464.20: Hit!? Me!? You bastard! I'll get you!
464.21: It seems we have some half-decent opponents. I'll give you my praise.
464.22: To think that I would sink... I won't... I won't accept this...!

470.28: W-what? I'm actually grateful to you a little, if you weren't here I'd be lonely… D-don't get the wrong idea!

470.23: It's not like I'm happy or any... No, that's not it. The will and pride of destroyer crews... It's rather nice. I'll take it.

470.20: Hit!? Me!? You bastard! I'll get you!
470.21: I won't sink from something like this! It's no joke, I tell you!

422.1: I am Teruzuki, the second ship of Akizuki-class Anti-air Destroyer! As with Akizuki-neesan, it is a great honor to be in your care!
422.25: Second of Akizuki-class Anti-air Destroyer, Teruzuki. With Akizuki-nee, we're organized as Destroyer Squadron 61. In the Battle of Solomon, we fought together with Hiei-san and Kirishima-san! What? The supply drum transport? Ah... that's.... that's...
422.3: Admiral, are you interested in Anti-Aircraft Fire Director? Would you want to touch Teruzuki's?
422.4: Ah, that's not where the Anti-Aircraft Fire Director is. Wait, Choujuusenchihou-chan, don't get mad...
422.29: Drum can, huh... it gives me weird feelings. I would rather be an escort to a taskforce... Oh!? Admiral? It's nothing!
422.28: Admiral, did you see Akizuki-nee? Is that so? And I was thinking about sharing this canned food with her... Ah! Do you want to eat it together, Admiral? This is...
422.24: Admiral, did you call for Teruzuki? Huh? You would give this ring to Teruzuki? Is that okay? Thank you! I will cherish it forever!
422.8: Admiral, you are going to check the information? Okay. Teruzuki will bring it!
422.9: I might be happy with this one! Thanks, Admiral!
422.11: I was damaged a little... I'll get it patched up quick, okay? Right!
422.12: I was damaged quite a bit... I'm sorry, Choujuusenchihou-chan!
422.5: A new ship has arrived. Teruzuki is excited too!
422.7: The fleet has safely returned to port! What a relief!
422.14: Flagship in the front! Teruzuki, leaving port! Follow me!
422.15: Well, let's get this started! Main guns, prepare for anti-air duty!
422.16: Teruzuki is going to start! Open... fire!
422.18: It's night battle under the glimmering moon! Fleet, engage!
422.17: Keep the heat up! Chojuusenchihou-chan, keep it up!
422.23: No way! Teruzuki is the top? Really? I should go tell Akizuki-nee. Ehehe.
422.19: Hyaa! I got hit! Can I still fight? ... Really?
422.20: Hyaa! Come on! What? A torpedo? Can I still move?
422.21: Owwwww... Is the torpedo launcher okay? If it seems risky, just throw it off!
422.22: Teruzuki is sinking again? That was fast... The moon... is beautiful.
422.30: Admiral, the date has changed. I, Teruzuki, will be keeping your time for today.
422.Rainy 6547: The rainy season is all damp and humid. It's unpleasant, isn't it? We have to take out the laundry while the weather's still clear. Now, Admiral. I'll be washing that, so take it off.
422.EarlySummer 6547: Akizuki-nee, it's almost summer! Let's go buy new swimsuits! Eh? That?! You're going to wear that again? Umm, I think...
422.Summer 6547: It's summer! Yay! I want to split watermelons! Watermelon splitting! I'll cover my eyes... and strike! This... sensation... Huh?! Admiral!!
422.6547: Fall, huh. Fall is Akizuki-nee's season, isn't it? And winter is Fuyutsuki season. Huh? So which season would be mine, then?

305.1: Hello~! I'm the latest light cruiser Agano~. *giggle*
305.25: Designed and built as the next-generation of Torpedo squad flagships, Agano-class light cruiser, the eldest, is me, Agano! I've got the the high-end technology! Have a look, this refined body... This time, I'll certainly show off my special features!
305.3: Admiral, what is it? Something you need with me?
305.4: I-I'm not slacking off! I'm just adding an entry to the admiral's log!
305.29: Agano-class, first ship, Agano, will be waiting for you all the time, right? Admiral?
305.28: Admiral, how have you been? That's good to hear. If you're not feeling well, I'll use my Kirarin Beam! Hah...! You want me to? Alright... Agano, kirarin!
305.24: Admiral. Thank you for always taking such good care of me. Eh? I seem different from always? Well, yeah, I guess so because, you know, today's a special day! It's a special day for you and me!
305.8: The admiral's report, eh? Lemme see, lemme see!
305.9: Wait a bit, if Agano gets even better performance than this...
305.10: Kirari~n! A new Agano! How is it?
305.11: Agano's just... going to the washroom for a while.
305.12: Uuu... I got beat... Yahagi's gonna get mad again... dangit....
305.6: Just got out of the bath? How was the water temperature?
305.5: Hm? The factory workers are waving their hands!
305.15: Finally Agano's show time, right? Hehehe, I've been waiting.
305.18: No way, I'm not gonna lose to Noshiro or Sakawa, you know?
305.23: Huh? At last, Agano's the best? Yeah! D-did you see, Yahagi. This is the true power of the Agano-class!
305.21: Geez, no way... I'm all tattered, aren't I?
305.22: Again.... Agano leaves before everyone else? Well, that's okay, I worked pretty hard this time... bye bye.
305.30: 12 o'clock! Is where the enemy is coming from! Just kidding. Sorry, it's the time.
305.31: 1 o'clock at night. Agano, can she sleep?
305.32: 2 o'clock in the morning, Agano's always sound asleep now~
305.33: Admiral! It's 3 A.M! Geez, you work too hard!
305.34: It's 4 in the morning, you know.... Well, the dailies refresh in an hour...
305.35: 5 A.M. For Kancolle, the new day is starting! Do your best!
305.36: 6 A.M. Admiral! Agano, she's wide awake!
305.37: 7 A.M. What should we do for the morning petit four? Hey, Admiral?
305.39: It's 9 A.M. Admiral, are today's dailies done? Ah, I see!
305.40: 10 A.M. Where should we try to go today?
305.41: 11 A.M. Let's slow down a bit before lunch, okay? I'm already empty.
305.42: Yeah! Midday! Lunch! What are you having?
305.43: 1 P.M. I'm making fried rice! Without shrimp, of course!
305.44: It's 2 P.M! Agano, giving a report! Let's take a aftenoon nap...
305.46: It's 4 P.M. Aw crud! I think I overslept!
305.47: 5 P.M. Ah, what should I do... the promise to drink tea with Noshiro... I forgot...
305.48: 6 P.M. The promise with Noshiro? Yeah, that always happens, I tend to forget the time...
305.49: It's 7 P.M. So then, by following Noshiro, we can have dinner together, yeah?
305.50: It's 8 P.M. Sorry! It's time for what I said before!
305.51: It's 9 P.M. Noshiro really needs me ... Huh? The opposite you say?
305.52: It's 10 P.M. Admiral, thanks for the work today. Agano is already sleepy...
305.53: It's 11 P.M. Agano is already completely tired. Admiral, good ni~ght...

440.1: Hi! I am the Iowa-class battleship, Iowa. You're the admiral of this fleet? Hmm... not bad! The pleasure is all mine!
440.25: Hi! I'm the name ship of the Iowa-class battleships, Iowa. Although I'm a high-speed battleship, I'm heavily armed, and could be said to be the penultimate form of battleship. As the last of the battleship classes born in the USA, I will work hard for the fleet. Take good care of me!
440.3: Sortie? Hm... sounds good to me.
440.4: This is not a drill. I repeat, this is not a drill! Hey, Admiral?!
440.29: This is the Japanese fleet, huh... Ohh! That battleship has such a unique bridge. I like her. Hey! Hey, you!
440.28: Admiral? What's wrong? Are you tired? Okay, it's fine if you take a quick nap. It's fine. I don't mind.
440.24: What...? Admiral, what's this ring? An engagement ring? For me...? Ah...! Thank you... me, too...
440.9: Oh, this is great! It'll really help.
440.11: Time for some quick repairs... I think I'll take a shower.
440.12: Oh, shit... I'm starting to feel indebted to Japan's amazing baths...
440.5: Okay! A new ship is finished being built. I can't wait to meet the new friend!
440.15: Now, time to show you my overwhelming firepower! Open fire!
440.16: Fire! Fire! Ahaha! Let's go! Let's get them!
440.18: I'm a fast battleship, so don't even think of running. Night battle— let's get this started!
440.17: I'm not a name ship for nothing, y'know. Fufufu, let's finish this.
440.23: Iowa is the most valuable?! Really? Thanks! *♥*
440.21: Ouch! You've done it now... I'll get you back for this... it's a promise, damn it!
440.22: Oh my god... I lost...? The water is... it's hard to see... Admi... ral...
440.Rainy 6547: It's raining so much at this time of year. "To-you" is what you call it...? As in, "for you"? What a romantic season. That's Japan for you.
440.6547: Japan in autumn is... ... ... ...Ah...! This beer is amazing! Eh? There's a kind of beer made just for autumn? Japan... is incredible, isn't it?

360.1: Hi! I'm the Iowa-class battleship, Iowa. Admiral, how've you been? Doing okay? Well then, let's do our best today! Go! Go!
360.10: Harpoon? Mmm... it's not bad, but... isn't it too soon for that? You can wait... can't you?
360.16: If you think the age of battleships is over, then pay attention. Fire!
360.30: Today I'll be your secretary ship. That okay? Hmhm! Leave it to me.
360.32: Two o'clock now. Is that fine?
360.33: It's three o'clock now. *sigh* I'm falling asleep.
360.34: Four o'clock now. It's almost morning... *yawn* ...Admiral, you up?
360.36: 6 o'clock! Admiral, I'll make you some scrambled eggs this morning, okay? Ah, please help yourself to the coffee! Okay?
360.37: 7 o'clock. Alright, let's begin our morning duties! What do you want to do first?
360.38: It's 8 o'clock. Alright, let's proceed with the fleet maneuvers. Go! Go!
360.39: 9 o'clock. *whew* This should wrap up our morning duties, right? Is that okay?
360.40: 10 o'clock! Eh?! You're mean you're really still working? Japan's fleets are so hard-working...
360.41: It's 11 o'clock! Admiral, what are you having for lunch? Huh? Steak?! I'll tag along!
360.42: It is noon! Alright, let's sit down and enjoy our lunch!
360.43: Mamiya restaurant, huh... I've heard rumors. Ohhh! So this is a traditional Japanese lunch? Great! I'll dig right in!
360.44: Yeah... the portions are a little small, but traditional Japanese lunches aren't half bad. The fact that it's also healthy is great! Ah! It's 2 o'clock now. I forgot.
360.45: 3 o'clock! Hey! Yamato! Let's have it out for real next time! During an exercise, of course! It's a drill, only a drill!
360.46: 4 o... ohhhh! The Kongou sisters! Japan's fast battleships are really pretty! Huh? Kirishima, why are you angry? What's wrong?
360.47: It's 5 o'clock. Japanese sunsets are so beautiful! Admiral, it's wonderful!
360.48: It's 6 o'clock! Admiral? What are we going to have for dinner? Ohh?! Yamato will? I'm excited for that! Let's go!
360.49: 7 o'clock. Yamato, thanks for the invitation for dinner! I'm just going to help myself to Yamato's hotel dinner.
360.50: 8 o'clock. Yamato's hotel dinner was great! Huh? I'm praising you. Yamato, what's wrong?
360.51: 9 o'clock! Oh, that's why. What are you saying, Yamato? You're a great battleship! You're beautiful!
360.52: It's 10 o'clock! Admiral, we did a good job today! Great!
360.53: 11 o'clock! Well then, let's finish it up for the day! Good night!

471.1: I've kept you waiting, Commander. First ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers, Kamikaze, has arrived. Are you ready, everyone? Follow me.
471.25: I am the first of the Kamikaze-class Destroyers, Kamikaze. I am the nameship of a fleet of destroyers designed during the Eight-Eight Fleet Program era. We may be an older model compared to the Mutsuki-class, but I managed to run through that battle to the very end. I hope you'll remember who we are.
471.2: Commander, did you call me? I am prepared.
471.3: I'm an old type? Silly you. A destroyer's capabilities aren't about her specs.
471.4: Stop it, Harukaze. I'm not fond of such things... eh? It's you, Commander. What's the meaning of this? I desire an explanation.
471.29: Destroyer-1? Ah, I was once called that a long time ago. But I am now Kamikaze! That's my nameship! Be sure to remember it!
471.28: Commander, you look tired. Okay, I'll pour something warm for you to drink. One moment, please. Here you go. So, are you warming up? Really? That's a relief.
471.24: Yes, Commander? Another escort mission? I don't mind that... Eh, no? What is that on your hand? It's... for me? Wow, really? Thank you. I'll treasure it... I will treasure it for sure!
471.8: Looking at intel? It is vital. I'm glad that you're an able Commander.
471.13: Destroyer Division 1 Flagship, Kamikaze. It's time to weigh anchor!
471.9: Am I getting stronger? Th-Thank you. I'm glad, but...
471.10: Mm, this is good. I can survive till the very end with this. Thank you.
471.27: Right. Refueling complete! What's next? Fleet escort?
471.11: Just a little... let me rest a little. No peeking. I'll be done in an instant.
471.12: Ahh... this is awful in many ways. Commander, I'm taking a break for a while. Hurm...
471.5: New ship construction has completed. Good!
471.7: Commander, the fleet has returned. In any case, I'm glad that they're all okay.
471.14: Flagship Kamikaze, setting sail. Are you ready, everyone? Follow me.
471.15: Enemy fleet spotted. Right, ready for battle. On me, everyone.
471.18: Pursuing the enemy fleet. Battle speed 5. Charge! Follow me!
471.23: Yes! Ah, but please don't praise me. I'm only doing my usual routine. T-that's right.
471.21: I'm hit? Where? I-I won't sink!
471.22: No way. It can't be! I'm filling with water... No...
471.Rainy 6547: Miss Haguro, please be careful at this time of year! Ah, you too, Miss Ashigara! If you're heading somewhere, I'll accompany you.
471.6547: Commander, it's autumn! This time of year makes me feel so excited! Commander, how does autumn make you feel?

476.1: Commander, I'll do my best! First ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers, Kamikaze, has arrived. Let's face our battles head-on!
476.4: Is that Ashigara? I'm a bit busy right now... Eh? Commander!? What's the meaning of this? I would like an explanation of what it is you think you're doing.
476.9: You're going to make me stronger? Thanks. Don't forget the anti-sub equipment!
476.10: Huh? It's for a transport mission? I guess. Actually, I'd rather not remove my torpedoes...
476.14: Even if the war outlook is bad, we've got to do something! Flagship Kamikaze, setting sail. Fleet, weigh anchor!
476.30: Right! Today I'll be taking care of you as your secretary. Is that ok? It is now 12 midnight. Leave the hourly announcements to me!
476.31: 0100. *yawn* I'm a bit sleepy... but I'll be fine. You can rely on me.
476.32: 0200. It's the hour of Ushimitsu. What? You're scared, Commander? Guess you do have an adorable side.
476.33: 0300. Umm... do you feel like... going to the washroom? I'll accompany you there. How's that...?
476.34: 0400. Oh, thank goodness. It's going to be morning. Eh? The night? I don't... find it... scary...
476.35: 0500. That's not it! I'm completely fine on the ocean. It's not the same as night time on dry land. Geez...
476.36: 0600. Commander, I'll be performing the morning call. Fleet, arise! It's morning. The morning has arrived. Rise and shine, everyone!
476.37: 0700. Right! Commander, allow me to cook. Wait a moment, please... Okay! Sorry to keep you waiting. I had to watch the barley rice.
476.38: 0800. What do you think of my cooking? Mmm! Right! So, after this, let's begin on with fleet operations.
476.39: 0900. What shall we start with this morning? Expeditions? Quests? Mmm, I can't decide with such a wonderful fleet. Commander, what do you think?
476.40: 1000. Right! Now then, we should begin with an expedition. Put me in charge of a convoy escort. Hey! I can say with confidence that I won't return with less than one shou's worth.
476.41: 1100. Geez, it's almost lunch time... what should I do? I don't mind cooking again, but... how about cooking together? It can be the commander's solemn duty, mmm?
476.42: 1200. Okay, I've decided. We'll have salted rice balls for lunch...is that ok? I'll prepare some miso soup to go with it. It matches with the salty flavor.
476.43: 1300. How was it? Lunch, I mean. There's a shortage of vegetables. Fresh vegetables have gotten so expensive.
476.44: 1400. Didn't my salted rice balls turn out well? What? Did it take long to make....? ...Ah, no, not at all! I am very efficient cook.
476.45: 150— Ah, Haguro! Thank you for your hard work. You look great... eh... ah... Well, I'm feeling great too. Look, look! I'm fine!
476.46: 1600. A transport operation? Right, then. Though I do feel a little worried without torpedoes... I'll be fine, so don't worry!
476.47: 1700. Ah, Commander, the sun is setting. How beautiful... this reminds me of the sunset I saw in Singapore. It's nostalgic. Is Nokaze....all right?
476.48: 1800. Commander, it's past sunset, isn't it? The fleet has returned to port? Let me cook dinner, then. Please look forward to it.
476.49: 1900... Here, Commander! Kamikaze special pork miso soup with fresh vegetables. It'll go well with the barley rice. Bon appetite!
476.50: 20— Oh?! Ashigara? Mmm, mmm... You are preparing pork cutlet curry rice here? Wow, that's wonderful... Commander, can you eat? Ah, you ate it. That's great.
476.51: 2100. Mmmmmm... delicious. Ashigara, thank you for the victory pork cutlet curry rice. *sigh* I overate.
476.52: 2200. Eh... Commander, what is it? What makes me feel afraid? Mmm...submarines are a nightmare for a convoy escort, you know? Eh, you don't believe me?
476.53: 2300. I can't do it! Submarines are terrifying. Of course, any enemy is horrible... Night time? The sea at night is not so frightening.

473.1: My name is Harukaze, third ship of the Kamikaze class of destroyers. Commander-sama, I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
473.25: I am Harukaze, the third ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers. I was born in Maizuru. I used to be called Destroyer-5, but I later got a real name, "Harukaze". I was in Destroyer Division 5 and also belonged to the first Maritime Escort Flotilla, in which I helped protect everyone. Even if the fighting ends... I will still protect you.
473.3: Hm? Oh? Commander-sama, thank you for today.
473.4: Commander-sama, is there something wrong with my rig? Ah, there was a flower petal? Ufufu, it's elegant on me.
473.29: I wonder what is Asakaze doing now. If it's her, she's probably frolicking around, Commander-sama. Hm? Commander-sama? You look tired. Wait, I'll give you a blanket. Good night.
473.28: Commander-sama, do you want to hear about my dream? I was injured and then... Commander-sama? Did you fall asleep?
473.24: Commander-sama, you called for the fifth destroyer group? Eh? Only me? Ah, yes. This is for me!? Thank you very much. I will cherish it.
473.8: You want to look at the report, right? I will bring it to you.
473.13: Harukaze of the Fifth Destroyer Corps. Thank you for the privilege of sortieing. Setting sail.
473.9: This is for me? You have my thanks, Commander-sama.
473.10: This is... really great equipment! I'm really happy.
473.27: Refueling. I confirm that I have received it.
473.11: Commander-sama, I am going to freshen up. Please wait a bit.
473.12: Commander-sama, I am so sorry. I'm going to heal my injuries.
473.5: I should go and meet the new ship.
473.7: Commander-sama, I'm here to report in. The fleet has returned to base.
473.14: Flagship Harukaze, setting sail. Everyone, please take care of me, okay?
473.15: What do I do... enemy ships have been spotted. Everyone, please get ready.
473.18: It has come to a night battle. Everyone, please continue to follow me.
473.17: Oh, my. The enemy is still here as well.
473.23: I am...? Really? Thank you, I'm glad to be here. I am delighted.
473.21: Aaaaah! In this shape I can neither do battle nor escort...
473.22: I'm going... to sink here... Asakaze, Matsukaze, Hatakaze, goodbye... surely... somewhere we will...
473.Rainy 6547: Rain... I'm well aware that not many are fond of the rainy season, but I love it. It fits well with my umbrella. I adore it so much. Don't you agree?
473.6547: Commander-sama? Autumn is a time of delicious food. If I may, I would like to show you my skill and prepare you some delicious food, okay? Ufufufu.

363.1: My name is Harukaze, third ship of the Kamikaze class of destroyers. Commander-sama, I am pleased to make your acquaintance. I will support you until the end.
363.14: First Escort Fleet, Harukaze, setting sail. Everyone, please take care of me.
363.30: Commander-sama, I think for today, I will be serving as your secretary ship. Is that all right with you? I'm glad.
363.31: Notifying you that it's 0100. Commander-sama, you still intend to continue working? I am going to make tea.
363.32: Notifying you that it's 0200. I finished making the tea. I'm going to put it here. There are tea-cakes as well.
363.33: Notifying you that it's 0300. Commander-sama, the late night is completely silent. I would like it... if it was always like this.
363.34: Notifying you that it's 0400. Commander-sama, was it not because you did your duties all night that you got tired? Here, let me give you a shoulder massage.
